original: zhes pa ni bha ga'i dbus na gnas pa'i rdo rje ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ni bha ga'i dbus na gnas pa'i rdo rje ste /
translated: This is the vajra located in the middle of the bhaga.

original: shin tu stong pa thams cad nam mkha' dang mnyam par bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: shin tu stong pa thams cad nam mkha' dang mnyam par bsgom pa'o //
translated: One should meditate on the emptiness of everything as being equal to space.

original: ma rig pa'i skyon glo bur ba'i rtog pa nyid las rtog pa nyid kun du byung ba tsam dang bral ba rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal zhing dag pa'i sems ni me long dang 'dra bar blta'o //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i skyon glo bur ba'i rtog pa nyid las rtog pa nyid kun du byung ba tsam dang bral ba rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal zhing dag pa'i sems ni me long dang 'dra bar blta'o //
translated: The mind, which is naturally luminous and pure, free from the mere occurrence of conceptual thoughts that arise from the adventitious faults of ignorance, should be seen as being like a mirror.

original: me long ral gri gdong bcas pa'am //
analyzed: me long ral gri gdong bcas pa'am //
translated: The mirror, sword, and face,

original: zhes pa yang gzugs brnyan lta bur dag cing gsal ba'i chos nam mkha' lta bu ni ral gri ste /
analyzed: zhes pa yang gzugs brnyan lta bur dag cing gsal ba'i chos nam mkha' lta bu ni ral gri ste /
translated: The Dharma, which is pure and clear like a reflection, is like a sword, like space.

original: nyon mongs pa rnams gcod cing sems can gyi don la rnon por 'jug pas so //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams gcod cing sems can gyi don la rnon por 'jug pas so //
translated: It is sharp in engaging for the benefit of sentient beings, cutting through the afflictions.🔽The banner,

original: rgyal mtshan zhes pa ni rgyal mtshan lta bur bsod nams kyis bteg pa'o //🔽mdung thung zhes pa ni mdung lta bu ste rtse gcig pa'i sems kyis nyon mongs pa 'bugs pa'o //
analyzed: rgyal mtshan zhes pa ni rgyal mtshan lta bur bsod nams kyis bteg pa'o // mdung thung zhes pa ni mdung lta bu ste rtse gcig pa'i sems kyis nyon mongs pa 'bugs pa'o //
translated: The banner is raised by merit, like a banner.🔽The spear,🔽The spear is like a spear, piercing the afflictions with the mind of one-pointedness.🔽The mirror,

original: me long dag gis kha sbyar du //🔽zhes pa la /
analyzed: me long dag gis kha sbyar du //🔽zhes pa la /
translated: The mirror is the mirror of the mind.

original: kha sbyor ni thog ma'i bde ba de kho na nyid rab tu gsal ba'i rnal 'byor ba'o //
analyzed: kha sbyor ni thog ma'i bde ba de kho na nyid rab tu gsal ba'i rnal 'byor ba'o //
translated: Union is the yoga of the clear light of reality, which is that very first bliss.

original: mtshan ma'i gzugs dbyibs shes par bya //
analyzed: mtshan ma'i gzugs dbyibs shes par bya //
translated: One should know the form of the sign, the shape.

original: zhes pa ni rdo rje dang / 'khor lo dang / rin po che dang // padma dang / ral gri dang / sna tshogs rdo rje dang / rgyal mtshan dang / mdung rnams ji lta ba'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni rdo rje dang / 'khor lo dang / rin po che dang // padma dang / ral gri dang / sna tshogs rdo rje dang / rgyal mtshan dang / mdung rnams ji lta ba'o //
translated: This refers to the vajra, wheel, jewel, lotus, sword, crossed vajra, victory banner, and spear, just as they are.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs kyi phye ba ste /🔽rdo rje dang rgyal mtshan dang / ral gri dang mdung ni nas 'bras tsam gyi tshad do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs kyi phye ba ste / rdo rje dang rgyal mtshan dang / ral gri dang mdung ni nas 'bras tsam gyi tshad do //
translated: The vajra family and the divisions of the Tathagata family are as follows.🔽The vajra, victory banner, sword, and spear are the size of a finger joint.

original: 'khor lo dang rin po che dang padma dang sna tshogs rdo rje rnams ni sran ma'i tshad tsam mo //
analyzed: 'khor lo dang rin po che dang padma dang sna tshogs rdo rje rnams ni sran ma'i tshad tsam mo //
translated: The wheel, jewel, lotus, and crossed vajra are the size of a pea.

original: mi bskyod pa la sogs pa ni rim pa ji lta bar rang gi mtshan ma rnams kha dog lnga dang ldan pa'i dbus su dkyil 'khor 'khor lo phra mo'i sbyor ba ston pa'i sems kyis bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: mi bskyod pa la sogs pa ni rim pa ji lta bar rang gi mtshan ma rnams kha dog lnga dang ldan pa'i dbus su dkyil 'khor 'khor lo phra mo'i sbyor ba ston pa'i sems kyis bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Akṣobhya and so forth are meditated on with a mind that teaches the union of the subtle maṇḍala wheel in the center of their respective signs endowed with the five colors.

original: phyag rgya sbyor bar grub pa'i rol pa bzang pos dngos grub tu 'gyur ba'o //🔽'di dag ni dpal he ru ka bde mchog @110a * //
analyzed: phyag rgya sbyor bar grub pa'i rol pa bzang pos dngos grub tu 'gyur ba'o // 'di dag ni dpal he ru ka bde mchog @110a * //
translated: The excellent play of the perfected union with the consort is the spiritual power.

original: gi 'grel pa sgrub thabs rnams kyi gnas zhes bya ba las le'u nyi shu rtsa gsum pa'i rnam par bshad pa'o /
analyzed: gi 'grel pa sgrub thabs rnams kyi gnas zhes bya ba las le'u nyi shu rtsa gsum pa'i rnam par bshad pa'o /
translated: This is the commentary on the twenty-third chapter of the Sri Herukābhidhāna, called “The Chapter on the Practice of the Yoginīs.

original: // / de nas skad ni gzhan rnams kyis //
analyzed: // / de nas skad ni gzhan rnams kyis //
translated: Then, with other languages

original: zhes pa ni skad kyi brda ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ni skad kyi brda ste /

original: yul sna tshogs pa'i skad kyi khyad par ro //
analyzed: yul sna tshogs pa'i skad kyi khyad par ro //
translated: It is the particular languages of various countries.

original: brda zhes pa ni brda ste /
analyzed: brda zhes pa ni brda ste /

original: rnal 'byor ma rnams kyi dam tshig gi phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma rnams kyi dam tshig gi phyag rgya'o //

original: pro tam g'i zhes pa la sogs pa ni ji ltar gsungs pa bzhin pas go sla'o //
analyzed: pro tam g'i zhes pa la sogs pa ni ji ltar gsungs pa bzhin pas go sla'o //
translated: “ Protkṣipta” and so forth are easy to understand as they are taught.

original: skad de dag la sbyar ba de nyid rnal 'byor bas the tshom zi za'o //
analyzed: skad de dag la sbyar ba de nyid rnal 'byor bas the tshom zi za'o //
translated: The yogi/nī should doubtlessly apply these terms.

original: 'di dag ni dpal he ru ka bde mchog gi 'grel pa sgrub thabs rnams kyi gnas zhes bya ba las le'u nyi shu rtsa bzhi pa'i rnam par bshad pa'o /
analyzed: 'di dag ni dpal he ru ka bde mchog gi 'grel pa sgrub thabs rnams kyi gnas zhes bya ba las le'u nyi shu rtsa bzhi pa'i rnam par bshad pa'o /

original: // / de nas don kun la ni 'dod pa'i zhes pa la sogs pa'i don ni 'di dag la brgyad po mthar sbyar gsungs pa zhes pa ni yang dag par sbyar te /
analyzed: // / de nas don kun la ni 'dod pa'i zhes pa la sogs pa'i don ni 'di dag la brgyad po mthar sbyar gsungs pa zhes pa ni yang dag par sbyar te /
translated: Now, the meaning of “all objects are desired” and so forth is stated as “the eight are applied at the end.”

original: de la brgyad pa'i mtha' ni yi ge ha'o //
analyzed: de la brgyad pa'i mtha' ni yi ge ha'o //
translated: The end of the eighth is the syllable ha.

original: de nyid la yi ge au dang thig ler ldan par bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid la yi ge au dang thig ler ldan par bya'o //

original: des na 'di ltar 'gyur te /
analyzed: des na 'di ltar 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, it becomes this:🔽oṃ namo bhagavate

original: aom na mo bha ga wa te p'i re sh'a ya /
analyzed: aom na mo bha ga wa te p'i re sh'a ya /
translated: śrīherukāya🔽mahā

original: ma h'a zhes pa la sogs pa gsal lo //
analyzed: ma h'a zhes pa la sogs pa gsal lo //

original: 'di dag ni dpal he ru ka bde mchog gi 'grel pa sgrub thabs rnams kyi gnas zhes bya ba las le'u nyi shu rtsa lnga pa'i rnam par bshad pa'o /
analyzed: 'di dag ni dpal he ru ka bde mchog gi 'grel pa sgrub thabs rnams kyi gnas zhes bya ba las le'u nyi shu rtsa lnga pa'i rnam par bshad pa'o /

original: // / de nas gzhan na med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dpal he ru ka bdag nyid chen po'o //
analyzed: // / de nas gzhan na med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dpal he ru ka bdag nyid chen po'o //

original: rim dang rim bzlog pa'i zhes pa ni rim pa bzhin du bslang bar bya'o //
analyzed: rim dang rim bzlog pa'i zhes pa ni rim pa bzhin du bslang bar bya'o //
translated: “ In sequence and reverse sequence” means that one should raise [the winds] in the proper order.

original: steng 'og dngos grub rtag tu ster //
analyzed: steng 'og dngos grub rtag tu ster //

original: zhes pa ni 'og ces pa ni sa 'og la sogs pa gang cung zad yod do cog go //
analyzed: zhes pa ni 'og ces pa ni sa 'og la sogs pa gang cung zad yod do cog go //
translated: means that “lower” is whatever exists in the lower regions, and so forth.

original: steng zhes pa ni steng gi dngos grub ste /
analyzed: steng zhes pa ni steng gi dngos grub ste /
translated: “ Higher” is the higher power,

original: phyag rgya chen po'o //
analyzed: phyag rgya chen po'o //

original: pho nya ma zhes pa la /
analyzed: pho nya ma zhes pa la /

analyzed: pho nya ma dang 'dra bas pho nya rnams su 'gyur te /

analyzed: thams cad phun sum tshogs pa'i byang chub thams cad nges par ster bar gnas pa gnyis su med pa dga' ba'i gzugs can no //

analyzed: bdag gi pho nya ma zhes pa ni de dang lhan cig tu spyod cing mngon du spyad par bya ba ma'o //

analyzed: zhes pa ni gsal lo //

analyzed: dpal ldan he ru ka nyid las //
translated: From the glorious Heruka himself

original: rnal 'byor ma chog ni gzhan med do //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma chog ni gzhan med do //
translated: there is no other yoginī collection.

analyzed: zhes pa ni snying rje chen po dang rab tu dga' ba'i thabs su sbyor ba'i mchog 'di bor nas gzhan la'o //

analyzed: kun sbyor bar zhes pa ni dngos grub kyi don la sbyor ba lhag pa'i lha las gzhan par kun du 'dod pa'o //
translated: Joining means that one should not desire another deity for the sake of power.

original: de ni gang dngos grub 'dod pa la rnam par rmongs pa ste dmus @111a * //
analyzed: de ni gang dngos grub 'dod pa la rnam par rmongs pa ste dmus @111a * //
translated: That is the delusion of one who desires power.

original: long lta bu'o //
analyzed: long lta bu'o //

original: de ni sdug bsngal mang pos gdungs pa ha cang yang ches te /
analyzed: de ni sdug bsngal mang pos gdungs pa ha cang yang ches te /
translated: It is too much, being tormented by many sufferings.

original: rgyal po rgyal srid dang bral nas mi tha mal ngar gyur pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: rgyal po rgyal srid dang bral nas mi tha mal ngar gyur pa lta bu'o //
translated: It is like a king who, having lost his kingdom, becomes an ordinary man.

original: lha mo gzhan dang kun sbyor ba //
analyzed: lha mo gzhan dang kun sbyor ba //

original: zhes pa la kun sbyor ba zhes pa ni rnam pa mang por rol pa la gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes pa la kun sbyor ba zhes pa ni rnam pa mang por rol pa la gsungs te /

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i sems kyis rigs thams cad la mnyam par sbyar ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i sems kyis rigs thams cad la mnyam par sbyar ba'o //
translated: It is the union with all families through the nonconceptual mind.

original: mi mo'i spyod dang gtsub shing du //
analyzed: mi mo'i spyod dang gtsub shing du //
translated: The conduct of a human woman is like a kindling stick.

original: zhes pa ni dbang po gnyis rab tu sbyor ba ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ni dbang po gnyis rab tu sbyor ba ste /
translated: This is the practice of the union of the two organs.

original: rna ba la sogs pa'i dbang po thams cad bde bar bsdu zhing yang dag pa'i snying po gang la kun du spyod pa'i khyab bdag go //
analyzed: rna ba la sogs pa'i dbang po thams cad bde bar bsdu zhing yang dag pa'i snying po gang la kun du spyod pa'i khyab bdag go //
translated: It is the universal lord who enjoys the gathering of all organs such as the ears and so on in bliss.

original: tshangs spyod de bzhin bsam gtan dang // zhes pa la /
analyzed: tshangs spyod de bzhin bsam gtan dang // zhes pa la /
translated: Brahmacharya, likewise, is concentration.

original: tshangs spyod ces pa ni stong pa nyid du 'gyur pa la dran pa'i sbyor ba ma spangs pa'o //
analyzed: tshangs spyod ces pa ni stong pa nyid du 'gyur pa la dran pa'i sbyor ba ma spangs pa'o //
translated: Here, “brahmacharya” is the practice of mindfulness in the state of emptiness.

original: de yang bde ba byang chub kyi lam dag pa de kho na nyid bla na med pa'i dam tshig la spyod pa 'dzin cing brtags pa ste /
analyzed: de yang bde ba byang chub kyi lam dag pa de kho na nyid bla na med pa'i dam tshig la spyod pa 'dzin cing brtags pa ste /
translated: Further, one should practice and maintain the bliss of the path of awakening,🔽the pure, unsurpassed samaya of reality.🔽

original: byang chub pa sgrub pa pos rtag tu shes par bya ste /
analyzed: byang chub pa sgrub pa pos rtag tu shes par bya ste /
translated: That is to say, one should always know that the adept of enlightenment practices and observes the pure, unsurpassed commitment of reality, which is the path of enlightenment, and is the bliss.

original: yang dag par gnas la byang chub bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: yang dag par gnas la byang chub bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: One should accomplish enlightenment in the true abode.

original: lhag ma rnams ni go sla'o //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni go sla'o //
translated: The rest is easy to understand.

original: rgyud rnams kun gyi thun mong ste //
analyzed: rgyud rnams kun gyi thun mong ste //
translated: Common to all tantras,

original: zhes pa ni bya ba dang spyod pa dang / rnal 'byor dang rnal 'byor bla na med pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ni bya ba dang spyod pa dang / rnal 'byor dang rnal 'byor bla na med pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: means that the action, conduct, yoga, unexcelled yoga, and so forth,

original: rnal 'byor ma chen po'i rgyud kyi rang bzhin la bya ba 'dra bar sbyar bas mi gzhom mo //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma chen po'i rgyud kyi rang bzhin la bya ba 'dra bar sbyar bas mi gzhom mo //
translated: are similar to the nature of the Great Yoga Tantra, and so are not to be destroyed.🔽Therefore,

original: des na / rgyu med par ni gzhom mi bya //🔽zhes pa smos te /
analyzed: des na / rgyu med par ni gzhom mi bya // zhes pa smos te /
translated: one should not destroy without cause.

original: go 'phang mtshungs par ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: go 'phang mtshungs par ma mthong ngo //
translated: One should not see as equal the state of being a woman and the state of being a man.

original: rgyud de dang de dag la rgyu'am gtan tshigs med pas na dam tshig gi spyod pa sbas shing gang la spyod pa ming tsam yang sbyin par mi bya zhing skal ba dang ldan pa'i sems can rnams la bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyud de dang de dag la rgyu'am gtan tshigs med pas na dam tshig gi spyod pa sbas shing gang la spyod pa ming tsam yang sbyin par mi bya zhing skal ba dang ldan pa'i sems can rnams la bshad par bya'o //
translated: Since there is no cause or reason for this or that tantra, the conduct of the commitments should be concealed, and one should not give even the name of the conduct to anyone. It should be explained to fortunate sentient beings.

original: khra sogs pho nya brgyad po la //
analyzed: khra sogs pho nya brgyad po la //
translated: The eight messengers such as the owl

original: drod dang da pa 'phel byed cing //
analyzed: drod dang da pa 'phel byed cing //
translated: increase heat and passion.

original: zhes pa ni 'dod pa'i de kho na nyid phun sum tshogs pa ster bar nges pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ni 'dod pa'i de kho na nyid phun sum tshogs pa ster bar nges pa ste /
translated: This is the bestowal of the perfection of the reality of passion.

original: kun du khyab pa'i byang chub kyi lam du gnas pa'o //
analyzed: kun du khyab pa'i byang chub kyi lam du gnas pa'o //
translated: One abides on the path of awakening that pervades everything.

original: dad pa tsam gyis blang bya yi //🔽zhes pa la /
analyzed: dad pa tsam gyis blang bya yi // zhes pa la /
translated: One should take it up with mere faith.

original: dad pa tsam gyis zhes pa ni dad pa'i rgyus chos ston la /
analyzed: dad pa tsam gyis zhes pa ni dad pa'i rgyus chos ston la /
translated: Here, “with mere faith” means that the Dharma is taught by the cause of faith.

original: de la shes rab kyi rgyus de kho na nyid rig par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de la shes rab kyi rgyus de kho na nyid rig par byed pa'o //
translated: There, reality is known by the cause of wisdom.

original: de skad du brtag pa'i rgyal po gnyis pa las /
analyzed: de skad du brtag pa'i rgyal po gnyis pa las /
translated: Thus, in the second chapter of the Tantra of the Great River of the Inconceivable Secrets of A it says:

original: nya phyis kyis min lag pas ma ni //
analyzed: nya phyis kyis min lag pas ma ni //
translated: Not with a shell, not with the hand,

original: @111b rig pa lce yis myong byas na //
analyzed: @111b rig pa lce yis myong byas na //
translated: but having experienced it with the tongue of awareness,

original: tshe ring nad kyang med pa'o //
analyzed: tshe ring nad kyang med pa'o //
translated: and long life without disease.

original: zhes so // ye shes bskyed pa'i rgyu ni //
analyzed: zhes so // ye shes bskyed pa'i rgyu ni //
translated: The cause of the generation of wisdom is

original: blo ldan mthe'u chung bskyod par ni //🔽zhes pa ste /
analyzed: blo ldan mthe'u chung bskyod par ni // zhes pa ste /
translated: the shaking of the little finger.

original: mthe'u chung zhes pa ni mthe'u chung ste sor mo tha ma'o //
analyzed: mthe'u chung zhes pa ni mthe'u chung ste sor mo tha ma'o //
translated: The little finger is the last finger, the smallest.

original: des rab tu bskul ba ni bskyod pa'o //
analyzed: des rab tu bskul ba ni bskyod pa'o //
translated: Shaking it is moving it.

original: de yang lo grangs bcu gnyis ma'i skye gnas su bcug pa las byung ba lces blangs na bcud kyis len 'grub par byed pas bde ba chen po bskyed pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: de yang lo grangs bcu gnyis ma'i skye gnas su bcug pa las byung ba lces blangs na bcud kyis len 'grub par byed pas bde ba chen po bskyed pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: Moreover, if one takes it with the tongue, it is the cause of the generation of great bliss, since it accomplishes the elixir.

original: sgrub pa rnam pa gsum du gnas //
analyzed: sgrub pa rnam pa gsum du gnas //
translated: The three types of practice are

original: zhes pa ni sgrub pa po dman pa dang / 'bring dang mchog tu gyur pa 'di dag gi dbye ba'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni sgrub pa po dman pa dang / 'bring dang mchog tu gyur pa 'di dag gi dbye ba'o //
translated: the inferior, middling, and excellent practitioners.

original: 'di dag ni dpal he ru ka bde mchog gi 'grel ba sgrub thabs rnams kyi gnas zhes bya ba las le'u nyi shu rtsa drug pa'i rnam par bshad pa'o /
analyzed: 'di dag ni dpal he ru ka bde mchog gi 'grel ba sgrub thabs rnams kyi gnas zhes bya ba las le'u nyi shu rtsa drug pa'i rnam par bshad pa'o /
translated: This is chapter twenty-six of the commentary called “The Origin of the Means of Achievement,” of Sri Heruka’s Supreme Tantra of the Secret Assembly.

original: // / de nas brtul zhugs spyod pa zhes pa la sogs pas ni le'u nyi shu rtsa bdun pa ston to //
analyzed: // / de nas brtul zhugs spyod pa zhes pa la sogs pas ni le'u nyi shu rtsa bdun pa ston to //
translated: Now, beginning with “Then, the conduct of observances,” the twenty-seventh chapter is taught.

original: de la spyod pa rnams ni spyod pa'o //
analyzed: de la spyod pa rnams ni spyod pa'o //
translated: There, the conduct is the conduct.

original: brtul zhugs ni mi'i rus pa'i phreng ba la sogs pas brgyan pa'o //
analyzed: brtul zhugs ni mi'i rus pa'i phreng ba la sogs pas brgyan pa'o //
translated: Observances are the ornaments of human bone garlands, and so on.

original: dpa' bo zhes pa ni rnal 'byor ba'o //
analyzed: dpa' bo zhes pa ni rnal 'byor ba'o //
translated: The hero is the yogin.

original: de yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: de yang gang zhe na /
translated: Moreover, what is that?

original: rnal 'byor ma thams cad kyi sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma thams cad kyi sgrub pa'o //
translated: It is the practice of all yoginīs.

original: mtshan nyid dbye bar shes bya na //
analyzed: mtshan nyid dbye bar shes bya na //
translated: The characteristics should be known as the divisions.

original: zhes pa ni phung po dang khams la sogs pa sgyu ma lta bur shes par bya ba 'ba' zhig ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ni phung po dang khams la sogs pa sgyu ma lta bur shes par bya ba 'ba' zhig ste /
translated: This is only the knowledge that the aggregates, constituents, and so on are like an illusion.

original: 'jig rten gyi chos brgyad po yongs su bsal te /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi chos brgyad po yongs su bsal te /
translated: Having cleared away the eight worldly dharmas,

original: thams cad kyi mgon po dpal dang ldan pa rdo rje slob dpon la phyag 'tshal te blo gros chen po dang ldan pas bzhi po gsang ba la rjes su spyad par bya zhing lung dang mi 'bral bar sbyangs pa'i yon tan gyi mtshan ma gsil byed dang /
analyzed: thams cad kyi mgon po dpal dang ldan pa rdo rje slob dpon la phyag 'tshal te blo gros chen po dang ldan pas bzhi po gsang ba la rjes su spyad par bya zhing lung dang mi 'bral bar sbyangs pa'i yon tan gyi mtshan ma gsil byed dang /
translated: having paid homage to the glorious lord of all, the vajra master, the one with great intelligence should practice the four secrets and should not be separated from the scriptures.

original: lhung bzed dang / chos gos dang / chu tshags rnams bcad par bya'i //
analyzed: lhung bzed dang / chos gos dang / chu tshags rnams bcad par bya'i //
translated: The bowl, the robe, and the water filter are to be cut off.

original: bslab pa de rnams dang bral ba'i rnal 'byor pa ni sangs rgyas pa'i mu stegs kyi spyod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bslab pa de rnams dang bral ba'i rnal 'byor pa ni sangs rgyas pa'i mu stegs kyi spyod par 'gyur ro //
translated: The yogin who is separated from those trainings becomes a Buddhist heretic.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la dmigs pa de lta bu ni lhag pa'i lha gcig yin no //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la dmigs pa de lta bu ni lhag pa'i lha gcig yin no //
translated: Such an observation of the perfection of wisdom is the one supreme deity.

original: stong pa nyid kyi ye shes las byung ba dang gdug pa thams cad gzhig pa las skyes pa'i sngon po chen po rnam par 'gyur ba drag po 'jigs pa'ang 'jigs par mdzad pa /
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi ye shes las byung ba dang gdug pa thams cad gzhig pa las skyes pa'i sngon po chen po rnam par 'gyur ba drag po 'jigs pa'ang 'jigs par mdzad pa /
translated: The great blue one arises from the wisdom of emptiness and is born from the destruction of all evildoers. He is fierce, with a wrathful transformation that terrifies even the terrifying.

original: mche ba cung zad rnam par gtsigs pa ral pa la zla ba phyed kyis brgyan pa ral ba chen po 'phungs pa'i steng na sna tshogs rdo rje @112a * //
analyzed: mche ba cung zad rnam par gtsigs pa ral pa la zla ba phyed kyis brgyan pa ral ba chen po 'phungs pa'i steng na sna tshogs rdo rje @112a * //
translated: He slightly bares his fangs, is adorned with a half-moon on his hair, and has a great topknot with a variegated vajra

original: can / thod pa'i phreng bas rnam par brgyan cing /
analyzed: can / thod pa'i phreng bas rnam par brgyan cing /
translated: and is adorned with a garland of skulls.

original: rgyan thams cad yang dag par rdzogs pa dang / stag gi pags pa'i smad g-yogs can //
analyzed: rgyan thams cad yang dag par rdzogs pa dang / stag gi pags pa'i smad g-yogs can //
translated: He is fully endowed with all ornaments and has a lower garment of tiger skin.

original: skyil krung phyed pas shin tu gnas pa /
analyzed: skyil krung phyed pas shin tu gnas pa /
translated: He is very stable.

original: gdug pa thams cad 'jigs par mdzad cing 'dod pa dang gti mug las byung ba'i phrag dog dus mtshan mo 'og tu gzir ba spyan gsum dang mgrin pa bzhi la zhal bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: gdug pa thams cad 'jigs par mdzad cing 'dod pa dang gti mug las byung ba'i phrag dog dus mtshan mo 'og tu gzir ba spyan gsum dang mgrin pa bzhi la zhal bzhi pa'o //
translated: He terrifies all evildoers. He has three eyes and four faces, each with four fangs, in order to suppress the envy that arises from desire and ignorance and the night that is the opposite of the light of the day.

original: nam mkha' lta bu'i dpal skya dang dkar po dang dmar po dang ljang gu'i zhal rnams gyen phyogs su gzigs pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' lta bu'i dpal skya dang dkar po dang dmar po dang ljang gu'i zhal rnams gyen phyogs su gzigs pa'o //
translated: His faces are blue, white, red, and green, and they look upward, like the sky.

original: rdo rje dang dril bu 'dzin pa'i phyag gnyis kyis phag gdong ma la snyoms par zhugs te gnyis su med par dga' ba'o //
analyzed: rdo rje dang dril bu 'dzin pa'i phyag gnyis kyis phag gdong ma la snyoms par zhugs te gnyis su med par dga' ba'o //
translated: With the two hands that hold a vajra and bell, he embraces Vārāhī, and they are in union, enjoying each other.

original: phyag gzhan rnams na chos kyi 'khor lo dang / gsil byed dang / lhung bzed dang / gsal shing dang / zhags pa dang / lcags kyu rnams so //
analyzed: phyag gzhan rnams na chos kyi 'khor lo dang / gsil byed dang / lhung bzed dang / gsal shing dang / zhags pa dang / lcags kyu rnams so //
translated: The other hands hold a dharma wheel, a sword, a begging bowl, a trident, a noose, and a hook.

original: de bzhin du mgo bo dang / cang te'u dang / phyag gzhan gnyas na chos gos dang mi'i pags pa bsnams pa'i tshul can no //
analyzed: de bzhin du mgo bo dang / cang te'u dang / phyag gzhan gnyas na chos gos dang mi'i pags pa bsnams pa'i tshul can no //
translated: Similarly, he has a head, a ḍamaru, and the other two hands hold a dharma robe and a human skin.

original: phag rgod mo ni kha dog dmar mo gcer bu spyan gsum pa skra grol pa rgyan thams cad kyis 'bar ba'o //
analyzed: phag rgod mo ni kha dog dmar mo gcer bu spyan gsum pa skra grol pa rgyan thams cad kyis 'bar ba'o //
translated: The sow is red, naked, with three eyes, loose hair, and blazing with all ornaments.

original: g-yon pa na sa'i lhung bzed dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: g-yon pa na sa'i lhung bzed dang ldan pa'o //
translated: She holds a begging bowl filled with earth in her left hand.

original: g-yas pa na chos kyi dbyangs kyi sgra 'khrol ba'i cang te'u'o //
analyzed: g-yas pa na chos kyi dbyangs kyi sgra 'khrol ba'i cang te'u'o //
translated: In her right hand she holds a skull with a sound of Dharma melody.

original: byin pa gnyis kyis mnyam par 'khyud pa ni thugs rje chen pos dgyes pa'i bde ba chen po'o //
analyzed: byin pa gnyis kyis mnyam par 'khyud pa ni thugs rje chen pos dgyes pa'i bde ba chen po'o //
translated: The embrace with both thighs is the great bliss of delight with great compassion.

original: shar la sogs pa'i 'dab ma la gdol ba mo dang / sme mo dang / chos mkhan ma dang / sbos mo dang / shan pa mo dang / ri khrod ma dang / nya 'chor ma dang / de bzhin du rngon pa mo'o //
analyzed: shar la sogs pa'i 'dab ma la gdol ba mo dang / sme mo dang / chos mkhan ma dang / sbos mo dang / shan pa mo dang / ri khrod ma dang / nya 'chor ma dang / de bzhin du rngon pa mo'o //
translated: On the petals in the east and so forth are the caṇḍālī, the pulliramalaya, the ḍombī, the sūci, the bukka, the caurā, the dāsinī, and the hunteress.

original: ser po dang / sngon po dang / dmar po dang / dud kha dang / khra bo dang / dmar po dang / ljang gu dang / brgyad pa ni dkar po ste /
analyzed: ser po dang / sngon po dang / dmar po dang / dud kha dang / khra bo dang / dmar po dang / ljang gu dang / brgyad pa ni dkar po ste /
translated: They are yellow, blue, red, smoke-colored, multicolored, red, green, and white, respectively.

original: rim dang rim las bzlog par ro //
analyzed: rim dang rim las bzlog par ro //
translated: They are in sequence and reverse sequence.

original: tshul rnams ni bzhad pa dang / zhi ba dang / snying rje dang / sgeg pa dang / gshe ba dang / smre ba lta bu dang / drag po dang / khro ba dang / nyams de rnams 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: tshul rnams ni bzhad pa dang / zhi ba dang / snying rje dang / sgeg pa dang / gshe ba dang / smre ba lta bu dang / drag po dang / khro ba dang / nyams de rnams 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The modes are laughing, peaceful, compassionate, passionate, scolding, moaning, fierce, angry, and those moods.

original: phyag na khar gsol lhung bzed dang / cang te'u gri gug 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: phyag na khar gsol lhung bzed dang / cang te'u gri gug 'dzin pa'o //
translated: He holds a skull bowl, a mendicant's staff, a hand drum, and a flaying knife.

original: sgo ba bzhi'i mtshan nyid ni khro mo'i tshul du dgod pa ste /
analyzed: sgo ba bzhi'i mtshan nyid ni khro mo'i tshul du dgod pa ste /
translated: The characteristics of the four gatekeepers are that they are laughing in a wrathful manner.

original: de zhi'i mtshan kyang 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de zhi'i mtshan kyang 'di lta ste /
translated: Their names are also as follows:

original: he ru ka'i 'od dang / rdo rje gtum @112b mo zhes pa dang / rdo rje srin mo nyid dang ni de bzhin du rdo rje 'jigs byed ma'o //
analyzed: he ru ka'i 'od dang / rdo rje gtum @112b mo zhes pa dang / rdo rje srin mo nyid dang ni de bzhin du rdo rje 'jigs byed ma'o //
translated: Heruka's light, Vajra Caṇḍālī, Vajra Ḍombinī, and likewise Vajra Bhairavī.

original: de rnams ni drag mo'i tshul can gdul dka' thams cad za bar mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams ni drag mo'i tshul can gdul dka' thams cad za bar mdzad pa'o //
translated: They have fierce modes and devour all the difficult to tame.

original: kha dog ni thal ka'i mdangs dang / ljang gu dang dmar po dang sngon po ste cher 'jigs par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: kha dog ni thal ka'i mdangs dang / ljang gu dang dmar po dang sngon po ste cher 'jigs par mdzad pa'o //
translated: Their colors are the radiance of vermilion, green, red, and blue, and they are extremely terrifying.

original: lhung bzed dang / kha tv'am ga dang khar gsil ni phyag g-yon na'o //
analyzed: lhung bzed dang / kha tv'am ga dang khar gsil ni phyag g-yon na'o //
translated: The skull bowl, khaṭvāṅga, and kṣura are in their left hands.

original: g-yas pa na ni chos kyi 'khor lo dang / cang te'u 'dzin pa phrag pa g-yon du chos gos bkal ba'o //
analyzed: g-yas pa na ni chos kyi 'khor lo dang / cang te'u 'dzin pa phrag pa g-yon du chos gos bkal ba'o //
translated: In the right hand he holds a Dharma wheel and a ḍamaru, and on his left shoulder he carries a Dharma robe.

original: kun kyang zhal gcig phyag bzhi pa rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan cing yi dags kyi steng na skyil krung phyed pas bzhugs pa /
analyzed: kun kyang zhal gcig phyag bzhi pa rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan cing yi dags kyi steng na skyil krung phyed pas bzhugs pa /
translated: All of them have one face and four arms, are adorned with all the ornaments, and sit in half-lotus posture upon corpses.

original: dbu skra grol zhing gcer bu ma'o //🔽bsod snyoms pa dang / chos gos gsum pa can dang / de nas zas phyis mi len pa dang / cog pu pa dang / ji lta ba'i stan gcig pa dang // bla gab med pa dang / shing drung ba dang / dgon pa ba dang /
analyzed: dbu skra grol zhing gcer bu ma'o // bsod snyoms pa dang / chos gos gsum pa can dang / de nas zas phyis mi len pa dang / cog pu pa dang / ji lta ba'i stan gcig pa dang // bla gab med pa dang / shing drung ba dang / dgon pa ba dang /
translated: Their hair is loose, and they are naked.

original: dur khrod pa dang / phyag dar khrod pa dang / gzhi ji bzhin pa dang / phying pa pa rnams te /
analyzed: dur khrod pa dang / phyag dar khrod pa dang / gzhi ji bzhin pa dang / phying pa pa rnams te /
translated: The twelve ascetic practices are the alms-begging practitioner, the practitioner of the three Dharma robes, the practitioner who does not accept food after invitation, the practitioner of sitting cross-legged, the practitioner of the single sitting [at mealtimes], the practitioner who stays in the open air, the tree-root practitioner, the practitioner who stays in charnel grounds, the practitioner who stays in abandoned villages, the practitioner who stays wherever he happens to be, the mat-possessor, and the practitioner who wears robes made of rags from the dust heap.

original: sbyangs pa'i yon tan bcu gnyis po de rnams rnam par dag pa ni rnal 'byor ma rnams te /
analyzed: sbyangs pa'i yon tan bcu gnyis po de rnams rnam par dag pa ni rnal 'byor ma rnams te /
translated: The twelve ascetic practices are the pure yogīs and yoginīs.

original: de yang gsung rab yan lag gcu gnyis dang / dam pa'i chos 'dul ba'i tshul khrims la rab tu dga' ba dang / snying rje chen pos dga' zhing mdzes pa rnams so //
analyzed: de yang gsung rab yan lag gcu gnyis dang / dam pa'i chos 'dul ba'i tshul khrims la rab tu dga' ba dang / snying rje chen pos dga' zhing mdzes pa rnams so //
translated: Moreover, one should delight in the twelve branches of the scriptures, in the morality of the discipline of the holy Dharma, and in the beauty of great compassion.

original: de rnams dang lhan cig tu mngon par spyod cing rjes su zhugs nas rdo rje byin gyis brlabs pa byas nas lhan cig tu mngon par rol pas phyag rgya chen po bde ba dang ldan par byas la bzlas pa bya'o //
analyzed: de rnams dang lhan cig tu mngon par spyod cing rjes su zhugs nas rdo rje byin gyis brlabs pa byas nas lhan cig tu mngon par rol pas phyag rgya chen po bde ba dang ldan par byas la bzlas pa bya'o //
translated: Having enjoyed and engaged in them together, having performed the consecration of the vajra, one should perform the recitation, having made the great seal endowed with bliss through the play of the union.

original: aom shr'i ma h'a su kha badzra he he kam a'a: hum h'um phat sv'a h'a zhes bya'o //
analyzed: aom shr'i ma h'a su kha badzra he he kam a'a: hum h'um phat sv'a h'a zhes bya'o //
translated: The mantra is: Om, Śrī Mahāsukha Vajra, he he, kaṃ āḥ hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ svāhā.

original: dam tshig gi kha zas rnams rab tu longs spyod cing spyod pa ni bya ba ste sangs rgyas kyi brtul zhugs so //
analyzed: dam tshig gi kha zas rnams rab tu longs spyod cing spyod pa ni bya ba ste sangs rgyas kyi brtul zhugs so //
translated: One should enjoy and practice the pledge substances, the conduct of the Buddha.

original: bhu su ku'i spyod pa ni bhu su ku ste za nyal 'chag gsum gyi spyod pa'i rim pas spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: bhu su ku'i spyod pa ni bhu su ku ste za nyal 'chag gsum gyi spyod pa'i rim pas spyad par bya'o //
translated: The conduct of the bhūsuka is the bhūsuka. One should practice by means of the conduct of eating, sleeping, and walking.

original: de la 'di'i rim pa ni 'di ste /
analyzed: de la 'di'i rim pa ni 'di ste /
translated: The procedure for that is as follows.

original: bhu zhes pa ni kha zas te /
analyzed: bhu zhes pa ni kha zas te /
translated: Bhū means food.

original: 'du 'dzi yongs su spangs nas de tsam zhig rjes su dran par byas pas bya ba yin gyi //
analyzed: 'du 'dzi yongs su spangs nas de tsam zhig rjes su dran par byas pas bya ba yin gyi //
translated: Having completely abandoned all distractions, one should recollect just that much.

original: sdug bsngal bsten pas ni 'di dag cung zad kyang bsam par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal bsten pas ni 'di dag cung zad kyang bsam par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: But one should not think about them at all by relying on suffering.

original: su zhes pa ni nyal ba ste rnam par shes pa de dag la @113a * //
analyzed: su zhes pa ni nyal ba ste rnam par shes pa de dag la @113a * //
translated: Su means “to lie down,” that is, to lie down on those consciousnesses.

original: ma rig pas nye bar mtshan pa'i sde dpung la sogs pa rnams dge ba'i dngos por mngon du bya'o //
analyzed: ma rig pas nye bar mtshan pa'i sde dpung la sogs pa rnams dge ba'i dngos por mngon du bya'o //
translated: Through the sign of ignorance, one should manifest the army of the skandhas and so on as virtuous things.

original: de yang rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba dri ma med pa'i rang bzhin can du mngon du byas la'o //
analyzed: de yang rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba dri ma med pa'i rang bzhin can du mngon du byas la'o //
translated: And that is manifested as naturally luminous, having the nature of being stainless.

original: ku zhes pa ni 'chag tu 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: ku zhes pa ni 'chag tu 'gro ba ste /
translated: Ku means “to go for a walk.”

original: bshang gci tsam zhig 'dor du phyin la 'du 'dzi yongs su spangs te /
analyzed: bshang gci tsam zhig 'dor du phyin la 'du 'dzi yongs su spangs te /
translated: Having gone to relieve oneself, having completely abandoned all distractions,

original: de 'od gsal ba tsam zhig yongs su bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de 'od gsal ba tsam zhig yongs su bsgom par bya'o //
translated: one should meditate on just that luminosity.

original: lus kyi tshor ba dang yul dang dbang po'i rang gi ngo bo dag tu ni bsam par mi bya'o //
analyzed: lus kyi tshor ba dang yul dang dbang po'i rang gi ngo bo dag tu ni bsam par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not think about the sensations of the body, the objects, and the nature of the sense organs.

original: grong dang grong du zhes pa la sogs pa ni skyo bar gyur na rgyu bar bya'o //
analyzed: grong dang grong du zhes pa la sogs pa ni skyo bar gyur na rgyu bar bya'o //
translated: “In village after village” and so on means that one should go about when one is weary.

original: brtul zhugs spyad par zhes pa ni de nas pho nya mo'i nyid can la brtul zhugs can gyi sangs rgyas kyis brtul zhugs su spyod pa ni brtul zhugs so //
analyzed: brtul zhugs spyad par zhes pa ni de nas pho nya mo'i nyid can la brtul zhugs can gyi sangs rgyas kyis brtul zhugs su spyod pa ni brtul zhugs so //
translated: “Practicing the vow” means that the one who has the vow, the yogin, practices the vow.

original: bdag gis kyang lam kar pho nya mo mthong na de bzhin du 'du'o //
analyzed: bdag gis kyang lam kar pho nya mo mthong na de bzhin du 'du'o //
translated: “I too, when I see the messenger on the road, will embrace her in the same way.”

original: de las ni phyag rgya chen po'i go 'phang bla na med pa mchog gi byang chub nyid yun ring ring por mi thogs par myur du bde bar nges par 'thob po //
analyzed: de las ni phyag rgya chen po'i go 'phang bla na med pa mchog gi byang chub nyid yun ring ring por mi thogs par myur du bde bar nges par 'thob po //
translated: “From that” means that the state of the great seal, the unsurpassed supreme enlightenment, is definitely attained quickly and easily, not after a long time.

original: de yang rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i dge ba'i rtsa bas so //
analyzed: de yang rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i dge ba'i rtsa bas so //
translated: And that is by the roots of virtue that are naturally radiant.

original: rnal 'byor gyi mtshan nyid 'dis rtag tu bsam gtan la sbyar na sems rin po che brtan par 'gyur bas sangs rgyas kyi byang chub rab tu gnas par byin gyis rlob par byed do //
analyzed: rnal 'byor gyi mtshan nyid 'dis rtag tu bsam gtan la sbyar na sems rin po che brtan par 'gyur bas sangs rgyas kyi byang chub rab tu gnas par byin gyis rlob par byed do //
translated: By this characteristic of yoga, if one is always engaged in meditation, then the precious mind becomes firm, and one is blessed with the stability of the enlightenment of the Buddha.

original: lo grangs bcu drug ma rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan pa mdzes pa'i rang bzhin can mig gi dkyus ring ba rnyed na gzung ste brtul zhugs chen pos thun mtshams bzhi ru gsang ba'i mchod pa bya zhing brtul zhugs spyod na zla ba drug nyid kyis de thams cad
analyzed: lo grangs bcu drug ma rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan pa mdzes pa'i rang bzhin can mig gi dkyus ring ba rnyed na gzung ste brtul zhugs chen pos thun mtshams bzhi ru gsang ba'i mchod pa bya zhing brtul zhugs spyod na zla ba drug nyid kyis de thams cad
translated: If one finds a sixteen-year-old girl who is adorned with all ornaments, who is beautiful by nature, and has long eyes, one should take her and, with great observance, make secret offerings in the four periods of the day. If one practices disciplined conduct, in just six months all of those🔽

original: 'thob par 'di la the tshom med do //
analyzed: 'thob par 'di la the tshom med do //
translated: If one finds a sixteen-year-old girl adorned with all ornaments, beautiful, with long eyes, one should take her, and if one practices the conduct of the great vow, making secret offerings in the four periods of the day, then in just six months one will attain all of those, there is no doubt about it.

original: rtag tu spyad bya ste zhes bya ba ni rnal 'byor chen por zhugs pa'i skye bo dag pa thams cad 'dus te /
analyzed: rtag tu spyad bya ste zhes bya ba ni rnal 'byor chen por zhugs pa'i skye bo dag pa thams cad 'dus te /
translated: “Always to be practiced” means that all the pure beings who have entered the great yoga

original: rigs thams cad mnyam par spyad cing gcig tu brtag par bya ste /
analyzed: rigs thams cad mnyam par spyad cing gcig tu brtag par bya ste /
translated: should practice equally in all clans and be considered as one.

original: me yis dag pa ji ltar grub pa ltar sngags kyis dag pa de lta bur grub par bya'o //
analyzed: me yis dag pa ji ltar grub pa ltar sngags kyis dag pa de lta bur grub par bya'o //
translated: Just as purity is established by fire, so purity by mantra should be established.

original: de la sngags ni 'di'o //
analyzed: de la sngags ni 'di'o //
translated: The mantra for that is this:

original: aom sarba badzra k'a mi ni sarba bhaksham sho dha ya gu hyam badzr'i ni sv'a h'a zhes pa'o //
analyzed: aom sarba badzra k'a mi ni sarba bhaksham sho dha ya gu hyam badzr'i ni sv'a h'a zhes pa'o //
translated: Oṃ sarva vajra kāminī sarva bhakṣaṃ śodhaya guhya vajrī svāhā.

original: bdud rtsi lnga po mar dang sbrang rtsir ldan par byas pa ni sman gyi mchog ste 'thungs na rgas pa dang 'chi ba rnam par spang zhing dpal dang ldan pa dang mdzes pa dang nad med @113b cing gzugs bzang ba dang 'dod pa'i lha'i bdag po lta bur🔽'gro'o // de yi der ni dbyer med pa //
analyzed: bdud rtsi lnga po mar dang sbrang rtsir ldan par byas pa ni sman gyi mchog ste 'thungs na rgas pa dang 'chi ba rnam par spang zhing dpal dang ldan pa dang mdzes pa dang nad med @113b cing gzugs bzang ba dang 'dod pa'i lha'i bdag po lta bur 'gro'o // de yi der ni dbyer med pa //
translated: The five nectars together with ghee and honey are the supreme medicine. If one drinks it, one will completely abandon old age and death, and will be glorious, beautiful, healthy, and have a good body, and will become like the lord of the desire realm gods.🔽There, one should practice

original: sgrub thabs gnyis bcas pho nya mo //
analyzed: sgrub thabs gnyis bcas pho nya mo //
translated: with the two messengers who are inseparable from him.

original: zhes pa ni dbang bskur ba'i don te /🔽rgyan thams cad kyis yongs su brgyan pa can no //
analyzed: zhes pa ni dbang bskur ba'i don te / rgyan thams cad kyis yongs su brgyan pa can no //
translated: This has the meaning of empowerment.🔽One should practice with the two messengers who are inseparable from him, who is adorned with all ornaments.

original: gnyis zhes pa ni phun sum tshogs pa'i phyag rgya ma ste /🔽gcig ni gsang ba'i sbyin pa'i don to //
analyzed: gnyis zhes pa ni phun sum tshogs pa'i phyag rgya ma ste / gcig ni gsang ba'i sbyin pa'i don to //
translated: The two are the excellent mudra.

original: gnyis pa ni shes rab ye shes sbyin don du'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni shes rab ye shes sbyin don du'o //
translated: One is for the purpose of the secret gift, and the second is for the purpose of the gift of the wisdom initiation.

original: de lta bu ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i dbugs 'byin par 'grub pa dang / gnyis pa ni rdo rje 'dzin pa'i yum mo //
analyzed: de lta bu ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i dbugs 'byin par 'grub pa dang / gnyis pa ni rdo rje 'dzin pa'i yum mo //
translated: Such a one is the accomplishment of the Tathagata's sigh, and the second is the consort of the vajra holder.

original: rjes su gnang ba byin la de'i rjes su slob ma de nyid la pho nya mo gcig brtul zhugs kyi gzugs kyi phyag rgya chen po bsgrub pa'i don du bdag nyid chen pos sbyin no //
analyzed: rjes su gnang ba byin la de'i rjes su slob ma de nyid la pho nya mo gcig brtul zhugs kyi gzugs kyi phyag rgya chen po bsgrub pa'i don du bdag nyid chen pos sbyin no //
translated: Having given the authorization, after that, the great being should give to that disciple a messenger in the form of a vow-observing consort for the sake of accomplishing the great seal.

original: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis gsang ba'i dbang bskur ba gnang ba'i gnas gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis gsang ba'i dbang bskur ba gnang ba'i gnas gsungs pa'o //
translated: Thus, the place for the authorization of the secret empowerment of all the tathāgatas is stated.

original: de lta bu'i dbang bskur ba ni bla ma'i man ngag gi rim pas 'thob pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i dbang bskur ba ni bla ma'i man ngag gi rim pas 'thob pa'o //
translated: Such an empowerment is obtained by the stages of the guru’s intimate instructions.

original: mi gsal bar byas pas ni 'dir gsang ba ste /
analyzed: mi gsal bar byas pas ni 'dir gsang ba ste /
translated: It is secret here because it is not clear.

original: 'on kyang rnal 'byor ma'i tshogs rnams kyis ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i ye shes kyi skur skye bar gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang rnal 'byor ma'i tshogs rnams kyis ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i ye shes kyi skur skye bar gsungs pa'o //
translated: Nevertheless, it is said that by the assembly of yoginīs one is born in the body of perfect, complete wisdom.

original: 'di la ni ji srid du de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis phyag 'tshal bar mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: 'di la ni ji srid du de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis phyag 'tshal bar mdzad pa'o //
translated: Here, one is praised by all the tathāgatas.

original: bla ma rnams kyi brgyud rim gyis //
analyzed: bla ma rnams kyi brgyud rim gyis //
translated: By the stages of the gurus,

original: dbang bskur thob pa nges legs pa //
analyzed: dbang bskur thob pa nges legs pa //
translated: the attainment of empowerment is excellent.

original: zhes pa'i don de ltar bshad do //
analyzed: zhes pa'i don de ltar bshad do //
translated: The meaning of that is explained in that way.

original: sems kyi bdag nyid tho rang sa langs //🔽zhes pa la /
analyzed: sems kyi bdag nyid tho rang sa langs // zhes pa la /
translated: The nature of the mind is the dawn.

original: tho rangs langs zhes pa ni rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal bar ro //
analyzed: tho rangs langs zhes pa ni rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal bar ro //
translated: Here, “the dawn” means the natural luminosity.

original: yang lag med byed mtshon cha ste //
analyzed: yang lag med byed mtshon cha ste //
translated: The weapon is the handless one,

original: lus la gnas par yang dag spyod //
analyzed: lus la gnas par yang dag spyod //
translated: and it is well-practiced in the body.

original: ces pa ni yan lag rnams shin tu mnan nas mtshon chas tha mal pa bzlog pa yan lag rnams shin tu dag par byas pa'o //
analyzed: ces pa ni yan lag rnams shin tu mnan nas mtshon chas tha mal pa bzlog pa yan lag rnams shin tu dag par byas pa'o //
translated: The limbs are well-pressed down, and the ordinary is repelled by the weapon. The limbs are well-purified.

original: byang chub kyi sems la sogs pa'i bdud rtsi lnga po la yang dag par spyad na bgegs thams cad mi gnas shing bsod nams dang ye shes la 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems la sogs pa'i bdud rtsi lnga po la yang dag par spyad na bgegs thams cad mi gnas shing bsod nams dang ye shes la 'jug pa'o //
translated: If one practices well with the five nectars, such as the spirit of enlightenment, all obstacles do not abide, and one enters into merit and wisdom.

original: mtshon cha rnams ni bgom mi bya //🔽zhes pa la /
analyzed: mtshon cha rnams ni bgom mi bya // zhes pa la /
translated: One should not go with the weapons.

original: mtshon cha ni rnal 'byor gyi mtshon chas nye par mtshan par spyad par bya ba la spyod pa'o //
analyzed: mtshon cha ni rnal 'byor gyi mtshon chas nye par mtshan par spyad par bya ba la spyod pa'o //
translated: Here, “weapons” are the signs of the yogin, and one should practice with the practice of the near-sign.

original: lus nyid dag par bya na ni //🔽zhes @114a * //
analyzed: lus nyid dag par bya na ni // zhes @114a * //
translated: If one purifies the body itself,

original: pa ni lha'i rnal 'byor du bdag nyid rim pa 'dis bsgom par bya ba ste /
analyzed: pa ni lha'i rnal 'byor du bdag nyid rim pa 'dis bsgom par bya ba ste /
translated: one should meditate on oneself in this sequence in the yoga of the deity.

original: gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa rnams bhr'um dang / a'am dang / hr'i: dang / ha dang / h'um dag las rnam par snang mdzad dang / rin chen 'byung ldan dang / 'od dpag med dang /
analyzed: gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa rnams bhr'um dang / a'am dang / hr'i: dang / ha dang / h'um dag las rnam par snang mdzad dang / rin chen 'byung ldan dang / 'od dpag med dang /
translated: Form, feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness are Bhruṃ, Aṃ, Hrīḥ, Ha, and Hūṃ, respectively, from which arise Vairocana, Ratnasaṃbhava, Amitābha,

original: don yod grub pa dang / mi bskyod pa rnams su'o //
analyzed: don yod grub pa dang / mi bskyod pa rnams su'o //
translated: Amoghasiddhi, and Akṣobhya.

original: hr'i: las ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad nyid du gyur pa dpal he ru ka'o //
analyzed: hr'i: las ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad nyid du gyur pa dpal he ru ka'o //
translated: From Hrīḥ arises Śrī Heruka, who is the nature of all the transcendent lords.

original: mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid rnams ni aom h'um tr'am a'am kham ham las gti mug dang / zhe sdang dang / ser sna dang / 'dod chags dang / phrag dog dang / dbang phyug rdo rje rnams so //
analyzed: mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid rnams ni aom h'um tr'am a'am kham ham las gti mug dang / zhe sdang dang / ser sna dang / 'dod chags dang / phrag dog dang / dbang phyug rdo rje rnams so //
translated: The eyes, ears, nose, tongue, body, and mind are from Om, Hūṃ, Traṃ, Aṃ, Khaṃ, and Haṃ, respectively, from which arise delusion, hatred, miserliness, desire, envy, and Maheśvara Vajra.

original: dza: h'um bam ho: kham ram las gzugs kyi rdo rje ma la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dza: h'um bam ho: kham ram las gzugs kyi rdo rje ma la sogs pa'o //
translated: From Jḥḥṃ bḥḥṃ mḥḥṃ hḥḥṃ kḥḥṃ rḥḥṃ arise Rūpavajrā and so forth.

original: lam m'am pam t'am las sa dang chu dang me dang rlung dang kham las nam mkha' ste /
analyzed: lam m'am pam t'am las sa dang chu dang me dang rlung dang kham las nam mkha' ste /
translated: The elements are earth, water, fire, wind, and space.

original: sangs rgyas kyi spyan dang / m'a ma k'i dang / gos dkar mo dang / sgrol ma dang / rdo rje phag mo rnams so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi spyan dang / m'a ma k'i dang / gos dkar mo dang / sgrol ma dang / rdo rje phag mo rnams so //
translated: The Buddhas are Buddha Lochana, Mamaki, Pandara, Tara, and Vajravarahi.

original: aom a'a: hum h'um ste de rnams las sku dang gsung dang thugs dang ye shes sems dpa'o //
analyzed: aom a'a: hum h'um ste de rnams las sku dang gsung dang thugs dang ye shes sems dpa'o //
translated: Om, Ah, Hum, Hum, are the body, speech, mind, and wisdom beings.

original: chos kyi 'khor lo ni padma 'dab ma brgyad pa la bhr'um a'am dzr'i kham ste /
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo ni padma 'dab ma brgyad pa la bhr'um a'am dzr'i kham ste /
translated: The Dharma wheel is an eight-petaled lotus with Bhur, Am, Jri, and Kham.

original: h'um ni lte bar ro //
analyzed: h'um ni lte bar ro //
translated: Hum is in the center.

original: mtshams rnams su a'a a'i a'u aee'o //
analyzed: mtshams rnams su a'a a'i a'u aee'o //
translated: In the intermediate directions are Ah, Ah, Oh, and Oh.

original: longs spyod 'khor lo ni chu skyes 'dab ma bcu drug pa'o //
analyzed: longs spyod 'khor lo ni chu skyes 'dab ma bcu drug pa'o //
translated: The enjoyment wheel is a sixteen-petaled lotus.

original: aom a ai au ae dbyangs yig lnga po de rnams dgod pa'o //
analyzed: aom a ai au ae dbyangs yig lnga po de rnams dgod pa'o //
translated: The five vowels Om, Ah, I, U, and E are placed on it.

original: bde ba chen po ni chu skyes 'dab ma sum cu rtsa gnyis pa la lte bar yi ge ham ngo //
analyzed: bde ba chen po ni chu skyes 'dab ma sum cu rtsa gnyis pa la lte bar yi ge ham ngo //
translated: The great bliss wheel is a thirty-two-petaled lotus with the syllable Ham in the center.

original: sprul pa'i 'khor lo ni chu skyes 'dab ma drug cu rtsa bzhi la lte bar aa ka tsa ta ta pa ya sha ste /
analyzed: sprul pa'i 'khor lo ni chu skyes 'dab ma drug cu rtsa bzhi la lte bar aa ka tsa ta ta pa ya sha ste /
translated: The emanation cakra is at the navel, with sixty-four lotus petals.🔽

original: sde tshan brgyad po rnams kyis rnam par brgyan pa'o //
analyzed: sde tshan brgyad po rnams kyis rnam par brgyan pa'o //
translated: The emanation wheel is the navel, with sixty-four petals, adorned with the eight groups of letters, a ka ca ṭa ta pa ya śa.

original: zla ba dang nyi ma'i rnam par gsungs pa ni g-yas dang g-yon gyi sna bug go //
analyzed: zla ba dang nyi ma'i rnam par gsungs pa ni g-yas dang g-yon gyi sna bug go //
translated: The moon and sun are said to be the right and left nostrils.

original: sgo bcu drug tu gsungs pa las kha 'og tu bltas pas yi ge ka la sogs pa'i dbus su thim par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: sgo bcu drug tu gsungs pa las kha 'og tu bltas pas yi ge ka la sogs pa'i dbus su thim par shes par bya ste /
translated: Of the sixteen doors, the one facing downward is to be known as the center of the letters ka and so on.

original: de la pu ll'ir ma la ya la sogs pa thams cad kyang gnas so //
analyzed: de la pu ll'ir ma la ya la sogs pa thams cad kyang gnas so //
translated: There, all the places, such as Pullīramalaya, are located.

original: de yang pu dz'a ao aa go r'a de m'a k'a ao tro ko ka la k'a hi pre gri soo su n'a si ma ku rnams so //
analyzed: de yang pu dz'a ao aa go r'a de m'a k'a ao tro ko ka la k'a hi pre gri soo su n'a si ma ku rnams so //
translated: They are Pūjā, O, Au, Agni, De, Māka, O, Au, Draviṇa, Su, Sa, and Ma.

original: der dpa' bo dang dpa' mo'i tshogs rnams gnas pa ni /
analyzed: der dpa' bo dang dpa' mo'i tshogs rnams gnas pa ni /
translated: The hosts of heroes and heroines are located there.

original: kham pram mam tsam kam pram bim mam sum b'am aam kham bam lam bam drum /
analyzed: kham pram mam tsam kam pram bim mam sum b'am aam kham bam lam bam drum /
translated: Kha, Pra, Ma, Ca, Ta, Ka, Pra, Vi, Ma, Su, Va, A, Kha, Ba, La, Ba, and Dra.

original: aam aem bam mam mam bam bam sum sum sham bam @114b sum mam ham bam khem /
analyzed: aam aem bam mam mam bam bam sum sum sham bam @114b sum mam ham bam khem /
translated: aṃ aṃ vaṃ maṃ maṃ vaṃ baṃ suṃ suṃ śaṃ baṃ suṃ maṃ haṃ baṃ kheṃ

original: mam tsam ram kham ham sam aom tsam shrim sum pam mam bam tsam bam mam /
analyzed: mam tsam ram kham ham sam aom tsam shrim sum pam mam bam tsam bam mam /
translated: maṃ caṃ raṃ khaṃ haṃ saṃ oṃ caṃ śrīṃ suṃ paṃ maṃ baṃ caṃ baṃ maṃ

original: de dag rnams so //🔽mtshog ma dang / spyi gtsug dang / rna ba g-yas pa dang / rgyab kyi sog phrag dang / rna ba g-yon pa dang / smin ma'i dbus dang / mig gnyis dang / dpung rtsa gnyis dang / mchan khung dang / nu ma gnyis dang /
analyzed: de dag rnams so // mtshog ma dang / spyi gtsug dang / rna ba g-yas pa dang / rgyab kyi sog phrag dang / rna ba g-yon pa dang / smin ma'i dbus dang / mig gnyis dang / dpung rtsa gnyis dang / mchan khung dang / nu ma gnyis dang /
translated: These are the seed syllables.🔽The crown of the head, the top of the head, the right ear, the nape of the neck, the left ear, the middle of the eyebrows, the two eyes, the two shoulders, the armpits, the two breasts,

original: lte ba dang / sna'i rtse mo dang / kha dang / mgrin pa dang / snying ga dang / mchan khung gi drung dang / mtshan ma dang / bshang ka dang / brla gnyis dang / byin pa gnyis dang / sor mo rnams dang / rkang pa'i bol dang /
analyzed: lte ba dang / sna'i rtse mo dang / kha dang / mgrin pa dang / snying ga dang / mchan khung gi drung dang / mtshan ma dang / bshang ka dang / brla gnyis dang / byin pa gnyis dang / sor mo rnams dang / rkang pa'i bol dang /
translated: the navel, the tip of the nose, the mouth, the throat, the heart, the armpits, the genitals, the anus, the two thighs, the two calves, the fingers, the soles of the feet,

original: mthe bong gnyis dang / long mo gnyis dang / so dang / sen mo la rab tu gtum mo'o //
analyzed: mthe bong gnyis dang / long mo gnyis dang / so dang / sen mo la rab tu gtum mo'o //
translated: the two thumbs, the two heels, the teeth, and the nails are Caṇḍālī.

original: skra dang ba spu la rab tu gtum mig can ma'o //
analyzed: skra dang ba spu la rab tu gtum mig can ma'o //
translated: The hair of the head and body is Caṇḍākṣī.

original: pags pa dang dri ma la 'od ldan ma'o //
analyzed: pags pa dang dri ma la 'od ldan ma'o //
translated: On the skin and dirt is Marici.

original: sha la sna chen ma'o //
analyzed: sha la sna chen ma'o //
translated: On the flesh is Maha-Chandika.

original: rgyus pa la dpa' bo'i blo can no //🔽rus pa la mi'u thung ma'o //
analyzed: rgyus pa la dpa' bo'i blo can no // rus pa la mi'u thung ma'o //
translated: On the sinews is Viramatti.🔽On the bones is Kharvarl.

original: glo ba la srin po'i dbang phyug ma'o //
analyzed: glo ba la srin po'i dbang phyug ma'o //
translated: On the lungs is Raktasini.

original: snying la ni shing grib ma'o //
analyzed: snying la ni shing grib ma'o //
translated: On the heart is Vaisnavi.

original: mig gnyis la ni sa srung ma'o //
analyzed: mig gnyis la ni sa srung ma'o //
translated: On the two eyes is Prthivi.

original: mkhris pa la 'jigs byed chen mo'o //🔽mkhal ma gnyis la ni rlung gi shugs ma'o //
analyzed: mkhris pa la 'jigs byed chen mo'o // mkhal ma gnyis la ni rlung gi shugs ma'o //
translated: On the bile is Maha-Bhairava.🔽On the two kidneys is Marutvati.

original: rgyu ma la ni chang 'thung ma'o //🔽gnye ma la lha mo sngo bsangs ma'o //
analyzed: rgyu ma la ni chang 'thung ma'o // gnye ma la lha mo sngo bsangs ma'o //
translated: On the intestines is Madana.🔽On the mesentery is Varahi.

original: lto ba la ni shin tu bzang mo'o //🔽lgang pa la rta rna ma'o //🔽mtshog ma'i srubs la bya gdong ma'o //
analyzed: lto ba la ni shin tu bzang mo'o // lgang pa la rta rna ma'o // mtshog ma'i srubs la bya gdong ma'o //
translated: On the stomach is Subhadra.🔽On the anus is Hayakarna.🔽On the orifice of the anus is Ghasmari.

original: snabs la 'khor lo'i shugs can ma'o //
analyzed: snabs la 'khor lo'i shugs can ma'o //
translated: On the mucus is Cakravega.

original: rnag la dum skyes ma'o //
analyzed: rnag la dum skyes ma'o //
translated: On the pus is Lantkari.

original: khrag la sna ring ma'o //
analyzed: khrag la sna ring ma'o //
translated: On the blood is Maha-Lantkari.

original: rdul la 'khor lo'i mtshon cha ma'o //🔽pho ba la shin tu dpa' mo'o //🔽mchin pa la stobs chen mo'o //
analyzed: rdul la 'khor lo'i mtshon cha ma'o // pho ba la shin tu dpa' mo'o // mchin pa la stobs chen mo'o //
translated: On the sweat is Cakra-Asikha.🔽On the stomach is Suvaktra.🔽On the liver is Maha-Bala.

original: lud pa la ni 'khor lo bskor ma'o //
analyzed: lud pa la ni 'khor lo bskor ma'o //
translated: On the phlegm is Cakra-Varman.

original: sna chu la ni brtson 'grus chen mo'o //
analyzed: sna chu la ni brtson 'grus chen mo'o //
translated: The great diligence is in the nose-juice.

original: de lta bu'i mkha' 'gro ma rnams kyi rang bzhin gyi lus ni chos kyi dbyings su rab tu grags so //
analyzed: de lta bu'i mkha' 'gro ma rnams kyi rang bzhin gyi lus ni chos kyi dbyings su rab tu grags so //
translated: Such is the nature of the dakinis, renowned in the realm of reality.

original: sngags dang phyag rgyar yang dag spyad //
analyzed: sngags dang phyag rgyar yang dag spyad //
translated: The mantra and the seal are practiced well,

original: rnal 'byor ma rnams gnas su bstan //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma rnams gnas su bstan //
translated: and the yoginis are revealed as the places.

original: zhes pa ni de ltar bshad do //
analyzed: zhes pa ni de ltar bshad do //
translated: Thus it is explained.

original: mtshon cha rnams bgom par mi bya'o zhes gsungs pa ni smin gyi dam pa bdud rtsi rnams te mi bskyod pa bsten pas ni rnal 'byor pa nad thams cad rnam par spyod do //
analyzed: mtshon cha rnams bgom par mi bya'o zhes gsungs pa ni smin gyi dam pa bdud rtsi rnams te mi bskyod pa bsten pas ni rnal 'byor pa nad thams cad rnam par spyod do //
translated: The weapons are not to be used, it is said, but the supreme ambrosia is the five nectars, and by relying on Akshobhya the yogin will eliminate all disease.

original: rtag pas ni mdangs chen por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rtag pas ni mdangs chen por 'gyur ro //
translated: By the constant one, one becomes greatly lustful.

original: 'dod dpag tu med pas ni stobs chen por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dod dpag tu med pas ni stobs chen por 'gyur ro //
translated: By the immeasurable one, one becomes greatly powerful.

original: @115a * // rdo rje nyi mas ni mi rgas so //
analyzed: @115a * // rdo rje nyi mas ni mi rgas so //
translated: By the vajra sun, one does not age.

original: srog chags thams cad kyi yan lag las byung ba'i don yod par grub pas ni rgyal po chen por te don thams cad yod par 'grub cing dpal dang ldan pa de ni rnal 'byor ma dam tshig dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: srog chags thams cad kyi yan lag las byung ba'i don yod par grub pas ni rgyal po chen por te don thams cad yod par 'grub cing dpal dang ldan pa de ni rnal 'byor ma dam tshig dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: By Amoghasiddhi, who is born from the limbs of all living beings, one becomes a great king, and one who has all one's goals accomplished and is glorious, and one becomes a yoginī who is endowed with commitments.

original: rnal 'byor pas rtag tu mi bskyod pa 'thungs na tshe lo lnga brgyar 'tsho'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pas rtag tu mi bskyod pa 'thungs na tshe lo lnga brgyar 'tsho'o //
translated: If the yogin always drinks Akshobhya, he lives five hundred years.

original: rtag pas khri phrag gcig tu 'tsho bar gsungs so //
analyzed: rtag pas khri phrag gcig tu 'tsho bar gsungs so //
translated: It is said that by means of Samantabhadra, he lives one hundred thousand years.

original: rdo rje nyi mas ni bye bar ro //
analyzed: rdo rje nyi mas ni bye bar ro //
translated: By means of Vajrasūrya, he lives ten million years.

original: tshe dpag med kyis ni tshe dpag tu med par ro //
analyzed: tshe dpag med kyis ni tshe dpag tu med par ro //
translated: By means of Amitāyus, he lives an immeasurable life.

original: rdo rje nyi ma dang 'od dpag tu med pa gnyis ni 'khor bsgrub pa'i rtsa ba ste /
analyzed: rdo rje nyi ma dang 'od dpag tu med pa gnyis ni 'khor bsgrub pa'i rtsa ba ste /
translated: Vajrasūrya and Amitābha are the roots of establishing cyclic existence.

original: 'di dag rnal 'byor pas bsten na kun du bzang mo dang mnyam par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di dag rnal 'byor pas bsten na kun du bzang mo dang mnyam par 'gyur ro //
translated: If these are relied upon by the yogin, he becomes equal to Samantabhadra.

original: lus nyid dag pas byas nas ni //
analyzed: lus nyid dag pas byas nas ni //
translated: Having made the body itself pure,

original: sngags dang phyag rgyar yang dag spyad //
analyzed: sngags dang phyag rgyar yang dag spyad //
translated: one should practice mantra and mudrā.🔽This is

original: ces pa ni /
analyzed: ces pa ni /
translated: This is the meaning of the following:🔽

original: aom n'a n'a sa ma ya shuddha: sarba dharm'a n'a n'a sa ma ya shuddho& ham: aom sva bh'a wa shuddha:/🔽sarba rdarma: sva bh'a ba shuddho& ham /
analyzed: aom n'a n'a sa ma ya shuddha: sarba dharm'a n'a n'a sa ma ya shuddho& ham: aom sva bh'a wa shuddha:/ sarba rdarma: sva bh'a ba shuddho& ham /
translated: Oṃ svabhāva śuddhāḥ, sarvadharmāḥ svabhāva śuddho ’ham.

original: aom sh'u n+ya t'a dzny'a na badzra sva bh'a ba a'atma ko& ham zhes so //
analyzed: aom sh'u n+ya t'a dzny'a na badzra sva bh'a ba a'atma ko& ham zhes so //
translated: Oṃ śūnyatājñāna vajra svabhāva ātmako ’ham.

original: rnal 'byor gnas rnams su zhes pa ni rang gi dbang bskur rdo rje'o //🔽mtshon cha rnams ni bgom mi bya //
analyzed: rnal 'byor gnas rnams su zhes pa ni rang gi dbang bskur rdo rje'o // mtshon cha rnams ni bgom mi bya //
translated: “In the places of yoga” means in one’s own initiation vajra.

original: zhes pa ni 'di yang dam tshig rnams yongs su bskyang bar bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni 'di yang dam tshig rnams yongs su bskyang bar bya'o //
translated: “One should not go to the weapons” means one should also keep the commitments.

original: des ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i mchod pa chen por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i mchod pa chen por 'gyur ro //
translated: By that, there is the great worship of the Tathāgatas.

original: rtsub mi smra zhes pa pa ni lam shin tu dag pa la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: rtsub mi smra zhes pa pa ni lam shin tu dag pa la gnas pa'o //
translated: “One should not speak roughly” means one should abide in the very pure path.

original: mngon par brtson zhes pa ni bde mchog gi rgyud 'dir dbang bskur ba'i bla ma dang / slob ma dang pho nya ni gang gi phyir mchog thob pa yin pa'i phyir na de lta bu la ni byang chub tu sems bskyed cing bsod nams kyi tshogs bskal pa bye ba brgyar bsags pa can gyis kyang sdang bar byas na de'i skad cig nyid la zad🔽par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mngon par brtson zhes pa ni bde mchog gi rgyud 'dir dbang bskur ba'i bla ma dang / slob ma dang pho nya ni gang gi phyir mchog thob pa yin pa'i phyir na de lta bu la ni byang chub tu sems bskyed cing bsod nams kyi tshogs bskal pa bye ba brgyar bsags pa can gyis kyang sdang bar byas na de'i skad cig nyid la zad par 'gyur ro //
translated: The one who is very diligent is the guru who confers initiation in this Cakrasaṃvara Tantra, and the disciple and messenger, because they are the ones who attain the supreme state. Therefore, if one is such, and one arouses the mind of enlightenment, and one has accumulated the collection of merit for a hundred million eons, then even if one were to hate, it would be exhausted in that very moment.

original: des na de lta bu la sdang ba bsdam par brtson pa las 'da' bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: des na de lta bu la sdang ba bsdam par brtson pa las 'da' bar mi bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should not transgress the effort to restrain hatred toward such a one.

original: grol ba'i don dang de don du //
analyzed: grol ba'i don dang de don du //
translated: For the sake of liberation and for that purpose,

original: zhes pa la grol ba'i don bdag gi lus gnas par bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes pa la grol ba'i don bdag gi lus gnas par bya ba'o //
translated: the sake of liberation is the abiding of one's body.

original: de'i don ni lus de'i don de bdud rtsi rnam pa lnga'o //
analyzed: de'i don ni lus de'i don de bdud rtsi rnam pa lnga'o //
translated: The purpose is the purpose of that body, which is the five kinds of nectar.

original: mtshan mo rtag par gcer bu ste /🔽zhes pa la /
analyzed: mtshan mo rtag par gcer bu ste / zhes pa la /
translated: Always naked at night,🔽with respect to night,

original: mtshan mo zhes pa ni mtshan mo phyag rgyal mchod par bya ba'o //
analyzed: mtshan mo zhes pa ni mtshan mo phyag rgyal mchod par bya ba'o //
translated: it is the night when one should worship the consort.

original: gnag dang dmar zhes pa la /
analyzed: gnag dang dmar zhes pa la /
translated: With respect to black and red,

original: nag pa ni he ru ka'i gzugs su bya ba'o //
analyzed: nag pa ni he ru ka'i gzugs su bya ba'o //
translated: Black is the form of Heruka.

original: dmar zhes pa ni rdo rje phag mor bya ba'o //
analyzed: dmar zhes pa ni rdo rje phag mor bya ba'o //
translated: Red is the form of Vajravarahi.

original: mgul @115b rgyan dang ni gdu bu dang / zhes pa ni gsal lo //
analyzed: mgul @115b rgyan dang ni gdu bu dang / zhes pa ni gsal lo //
translated: Necklace and bracelets are clear.

original: bde ba'i don thob bde ba ste /
analyzed: bde ba'i don thob bde ba ste /
translated: The attainment of the meaning of bliss is bliss.

original: zhes pa ni ji ltar 'thob pa'i bde ba ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ni ji ltar 'thob pa'i bde ba ste /
translated: The attainment of bliss is as follows.

original: des bde ba'i rang bzhin can phyogs bcu du mar gsal bar byed pa'i ye shes snang ba mar me lta bu la rnam par spyod pa'i rnal 'byor spyod pa snying rje chen po rang bzhin gyis dga' ba'i bde ba dang ldan par ro //
analyzed: des bde ba'i rang bzhin can phyogs bcu du mar gsal bar byed pa'i ye shes snang ba mar me lta bu la rnam par spyod pa'i rnal 'byor spyod pa snying rje chen po rang bzhin gyis dga' ba'i bde ba dang ldan par ro //
translated: By that, the nature of bliss, the yogic practice of the lamp-like appearance of gnosis that illuminates in many directions, is endowed with the bliss of natural joy, the nature of great compassion.

original: rigs dang rigs min dor mi blta //
analyzed: rigs dang rigs min dor mi blta //
translated: One should not look at what is proper and improper.

original: zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor gyi bya ba dang // bslab pa dag snying rje dang po'i las can gyi sems can rnams yongs su gzung ba byas na bsgom pa'i bar chad du 'gyur zhing gti mug chen por 'gro bas srid par bcings pa lta bur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor gyi bya ba dang // bslab pa dag snying rje dang po'i las can gyi sems can rnams yongs su gzung ba byas na bsgom pa'i bar chad du 'gyur zhing gti mug chen por 'gro bas srid par bcings pa lta bur 'gyur ro //
translated: If one abandons the activities of the mandala and the trainings and takes on the protection of sentient beings who are beginners, it becomes an obstacle to meditation and one goes to great delusion, as if bound in existence.

original: de'i phyir na 'ching ba las grol bar byas na skye ba 'di nyid kyi dngos grub tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir na 'ching ba las grol bar byas na skye ba 'di nyid kyi dngos grub tu 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, if one is liberated from bondage, it becomes the power of this very birth.

original: des na de'i don du ji ltar gsungs pa bzhin du gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: des na de'i don du ji ltar gsungs pa bzhin du gnas par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, for that purpose, one should abide just as it is taught.

original: zhal bzhi ru gsungs pa ni dga' ba bzhi las byung zhing skyes pa'o //
analyzed: zhal bzhi ru gsungs pa ni dga' ba bzhi las byung zhing skyes pa'o //
translated: The statement of four faces is born from and arises from the four joys.

original: dga' ba thams cad yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub stong pa nyid kyi rang gi ngo bo gcig pu'i phyir na zhal gcig mar rab tu grags so //
analyzed: dga' ba thams cad yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub stong pa nyid kyi rang gi ngo bo gcig pu'i phyir na zhal gcig mar rab tu grags so //
translated: Because all joys are the single nature of the emptiness of perfect complete enlightenment, it is renowned as having one face.

original: spyan gsum ni srid pa gsum du rab tu bshad do //
analyzed: spyan gsum ni srid pa gsum du rab tu bshad do //
translated: The three eyes are explained as the three existences.

original: thog ma dan tha ma med pa'i chos rnams bems po'i rang bzhin gyi phyir na ral pa'i don du gsungs so //
analyzed: thog ma dan tha ma med pa'i chos rnams bems po'i rang bzhin gyi phyir na ral pa'i don du gsungs so //
translated: Because phenomena are without beginning or end, they are said to be the nature of matter.

original: sna tshogs pa'i sems can gyi don mdzad pa'i phyir na sna tshogs rdo rjes mtshan par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: sna tshogs pa'i sems can gyi don mdzad pa'i phyir na sna tshogs rdo rjes mtshan par gyur pa'o //
translated: Because it performs the various purposes of sentient beings, it is marked with a vajra cross.

original: bde ba chen po'i rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i byang chub kyi sems su 'gyur bas zla ba tshes pas brgyan pa'o //
analyzed: bde ba chen po'i rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i byang chub kyi sems su 'gyur bas zla ba tshes pas brgyan pa'o //
translated: It is adorned with the waxing moon, because it becomes the bodhicitta of clear light, which is the nature of great bliss.

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba yan lag bcu gnyis su 'gyur ba'i phyir na phyag bcu gnyis dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba yan lag bcu gnyis su 'gyur ba'i phyir na phyag bcu gnyis dang ldan pa'o //
translated: It has twelve arms, because it becomes the twelve links of dependent origination.

original: phyag rnams mtshan dang ldan pa ni yul dang dbang po gnyis su med pa'i ngo bor longs spyod par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: phyag rnams mtshan dang ldan pa ni yul dang dbang po gnyis su med pa'i ngo bor longs spyod par mdzad pa'o //
translated: The arms are endowed with marks, because it enjoys the non-dual nature of the objects and the sense organs.

original: rdo rje ni byang chub kyi sems su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rdo rje ni byang chub kyi sems su 'gyur ro //
translated: The vajra is the bodhicitta.

original: dril bu ni shes rab tu bshad do //
analyzed: dril bu ni shes rab tu bshad do //
translated: The bell is explained as wisdom.

original: sku gsum rnam par dag pa'i phyir na rtse gsum pa'o //
analyzed: sku gsum rnam par dag pa'i phyir na rtse gsum pa'o //
translated: The trident is because of the purity of the three bodies.

original: glang po'i pags pa ni gti mug dral ba'o //
analyzed: glang po'i pags pa ni gti mug dral ba'o //
translated: The elephant skin is the breaking of ignorance.

original: dgra sta ni skyon rnams gcod pa'o //
analyzed: dgra sta ni skyon rnams gcod pa'o //
translated: The axe is the cutting of faults.

original: lus dang ngag dang yid las byung ba'i skyon rnams dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma lus pa @116a * //
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang yid las byung ba'i skyon rnams dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma lus pa @116a * //
translated: All the faults that arise from body, speech, and mind, and all the unfavorable conditions,

original: 'ching bas na zhags pa'o //
analyzed: 'ching bas na zhags pa'o //
translated: are bound by the noose.

original: gri gug ni sems can gyi don rnams myur du byed pa'o //
analyzed: gri gug ni sems can gyi don rnams myur du byed pa'o //
translated: The flaying knife is the swift performance of the aims of sentient beings.

original: mgo bo ni tshangs pa'i rang gi ngo bo'o //
analyzed: mgo bo ni tshangs pa'i rang gi ngo bo'o //
translated: The head is the essence of Brahmā.

original: kha tv'am ga ni stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo'o //
analyzed: kha tv'am ga ni stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo'o //
translated: The khaṭvāṅga is the essence of emptiness.

original: cang te'u ni thabs rnam par dag pa rtag tu dga' ba'i gzugs kyis chos dbyings kyi h'um sgrogs par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: cang te'u ni thabs rnam par dag pa rtag tu dga' ba'i gzugs kyis chos dbyings kyi h'um sgrogs par mdzad pa'o //
translated: The damaru is the sound of the sphere of phenomena, which is the form of constant joy, the pure method.

original: thod pa ni dngos grub kyi rgyu thugs rje'i ros nam mkha'i dkyil 'khor yongs su gang ba'i khrag gsol ba'o //
analyzed: thod pa ni dngos grub kyi rgyu thugs rje'i ros nam mkha'i dkyil 'khor yongs su gang ba'i khrag gsol ba'o //
translated: The skull cup is the blood that is drunk, which is the sky filled with the flavor of compassion, the cause of power.

original: mche ba bzhi shin tu gtsigs pa ni bdud rnam pa bzhi la btab pa'o //
analyzed: mche ba bzhi shin tu gtsigs pa ni bdud rnam pa bzhi la btab pa'o //
translated: The four very bared fangs are the four demons that are struck.

original: 'od 'phros pa'i tshogs dang ldan pa'i me mtshams ni gnyis su med pa'i thugs rje'i ros rtag tu gang ba ste /
analyzed: 'od 'phros pa'i tshogs dang ldan pa'i me mtshams ni gnyis su med pa'i thugs rje'i ros rtag tu gang ba ste /
translated: The fire quarter, which is endowed with a mass of light rays, is always filled with the flavor of nondual compassion.

original: cher bzhad cing zhal rnam par rgyas pa yang ngo //
analyzed: cher bzhad cing zhal rnam par rgyas pa yang ngo //
translated: It is also the great laughter and the fully expanded face.

original: mgo bo'i do shal gyis mdzes pa ni nyon mongs pa bzhi'i bdud dag pa'o //
analyzed: mgo bo'i do shal gyis mdzes pa ni nyon mongs pa bzhi'i bdud dag pa'o //
translated: The beauty of the necklace of heads is the purity of the four demons of the afflictions.

original: stong pa nyid rnam par dag pa ni sdigs mdzub po //
analyzed: stong pa nyid rnam par dag pa ni sdigs mdzub po //
translated: The pure emptiness is the threatening forefinger.

original: pho nya gtsang sbra dang po yin //
analyzed: pho nya gtsang sbra dang po yin //
translated: The messenger is the first purity.

original: zhes pa ni rgyal ba rin po che rnams thams cad kyi bde ba'i rgyu nyid kyi phyir na'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni rgyal ba rin po che rnams thams cad kyi bde ba'i rgyu nyid kyi phyir na'o //
translated: This is because the messengers are the cause of the bliss of all the precious victors.

original: gnyis pa zla ba yin par 'dod //🔽ces pa la /
analyzed: gnyis pa zla ba yin par 'dod // ces pa la /
translated: The second is held to be the moon.

original: zla ba ni bdud rtsi ste chang ngo //
analyzed: zla ba ni bdud rtsi ste chang ngo //
translated: The moon is the nectar, the wine.

original: zas gcig tu za ba nyid nges pa ni ji ltar bya ba'i rigs du ma rnams gcig tu bskyed par bya ba'o //
analyzed: zas gcig tu za ba nyid nges pa ni ji ltar bya ba'i rigs du ma rnams gcig tu bskyed par bya ba'o //
translated: The rule of eating only one meal is to be generated in one place the many kinds of things to be done.

original: gtsang sbra 'di dag ces pa la sogs pa ni gsal lo //
analyzed: gtsang sbra 'di dag ces pa la sogs pa ni gsal lo //
translated: These purities, and so on, are clear.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa rnams 'thob pa zhes pa ni phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub la bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa rnams 'thob pa zhes pa ni phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub la bya'o //
translated: The attainment of the stages of the transcendent lords is to be taken as the power of the great seal.

original: gang gi tshe brtson 'grus dman pas ma thob pa de'i tshe na yang sbrul gyi pags pa rnying pa bzhin du lus 'di yongs su bor nas gya nom snang la sogs par gnas te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe brtson 'grus dman pas ma thob pa de'i tshe na yang sbrul gyi pags pa rnying pa bzhin du lus 'di yongs su bor nas gya nom snang la sogs par gnas te /
translated: When one does not attain it because of inferior effort, then, having cast off this body like an old snake skin, one dwells in Abhasvara and so on.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams bzhin du 'ching ba las grol lo //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams bzhin du 'ching ba las grol lo //
translated: He is liberated from bondage, just like the Tathāgatas.
