original: de nas slar mi'i 'jig rten du skyes na ni chos dang ldan pa'i rgyal por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas slar mi'i 'jig rten du skyes na ni chos dang ldan pa'i rgyal por 'gyur ro //
translated: And if he is reborn in the human world, he becomes a righteous king.

original: bsod nams dang ye shes las byung ba des byang chub kyi sems rdo rje lta bur sems can thams cad nye bar 'tsho zhing smon pa'i sems kyis sems can thams cad nye bar 'tsho bar byed cing thams cad du phan 'dogs par byed do //
analyzed: bsod nams dang ye shes las byung ba des byang chub kyi sems rdo rje lta bur sems can thams cad nye bar 'tsho zhing smon pa'i sems kyis sems can thams cad nye bar 'tsho bar byed cing thams cad du phan 'dogs par byed do //
translated: By that merit and knowledge, he lives for the sake of all beings with the vajra-like thought of awakening, and with the aspiration thought he lives for the sake of all beings, benefiting everyone.

original: skye zhing skye ba rnams su ni //
analyzed: skye zhing skye ba rnams su ni //
translated: In birth after birth,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su skye //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su skye //
translated: he is born in the family of the Tathāgatas.

original: zhes pa ni dpal sh'akya'i mgon po ji ltar 'khrungs pa de bzhin du'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni dpal sh'akya'i mgon po ji ltar 'khrungs pa de bzhin du'o //
translated: This is like the glorious Śākya Lord being born.

original: de'i phyir na bdag nyid sangs rgyas thams cad la sogs pa'i ngo bo la bza' @116b ba dang btung bar ldan pas mchod par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir na bdag nyid sangs rgyas thams cad la sogs pa'i ngo bo la bza' @116b ba dang btung bar ldan pas mchod par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should make offerings to oneself, who is the essence of all Buddhas and so forth, with food and drink.

original: dad pa yis ni gtor ma sbyin //
analyzed: dad pa yis ni gtor ma sbyin //
translated: One should give sacrificial offerings with faith.

original: zhes pa ni las gang 'dod pa rnams la dad pa ste zhi ba dang rgyas pa la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: zhes pa ni las gang 'dod pa rnams la dad pa ste zhi ba dang rgyas pa la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: This is faith in whatever action is desired, such as pacifying, increasing, and so on.🔽The tenth day of the dark lunar fortnight is ascertained just as it is.

original: nag po'i phyogs kyi tshes bcu zhes pa ni ji lta ba bzhin du nges pa ste rang gi mthe bong rdo rje brtan por sbyar la dbu ma 'dud pa ste /🔽mdzub mo sbyar bar gnas pa dpral ba'i dbus kyi phyogs su gzhag la /
analyzed: nag po'i phyogs kyi tshes bcu zhes pa ni ji lta ba bzhin du nges pa ste rang gi mthe bong rdo rje brtan por sbyar la dbu ma 'dud pa ste / mdzub mo sbyar bar gnas pa dpral ba'i dbus kyi phyogs su gzhag la /
translated: One should place one's thumb firmly in the vajra fist, bend the middle finger, and join the index fingers.🔽One should place this in the middle of the forehead and rotate it in the forward and reverse directions.

original: rim dang rim min bzlog par bskor bar byas la sngags 'di brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: rim dang rim min bzlog par bskor bar byas la sngags 'di brjod par bya'o //
translated: One should recite this mantra:

original: aom a'a ralli ho: dza: h'um bam ho: badzra d'a ki n'i sa ma ya stvam dri shya ho: zhes so //
analyzed: aom a'a ralli ho: dza: h'um bam ho: badzra d'a ki n'i sa ma ya stvam dri shya ho: zhes so //
translated: Oṃ ārallihoḥ jaḥ hūṃ vaṃ hoḥ vajra-ḍākinī samaya stvaṃ dṛśya hoḥ.

original: de lan gsum dang bzhi'i bar du brjod do //
analyzed: de lan gsum dang bzhi'i bar du brjod do //
translated: One should recite this up to three or four times.

original: sgrub pa pho ni gcer bu skra grol par gyur pa gnas dgon par kha lho phyogs su bltas te gnas la mtshan phyed na gtor ma gtang ngo //
analyzed: sgrub pa pho ni gcer bu skra grol par gyur pa gnas dgon par kha lho phyogs su bltas te gnas la mtshan phyed na gtor ma gtang ngo //
translated: The male practitioner, naked and with loose hair, should go to a solitary place and, facing south, offer the bali at midnight.

original: 'byung po thams cad kyi gtor ma de gtang ba gnas dgon pa zhes pa de yang ri rab ri'i rgyal po mchog tu bzang por gsungs pa'i steng du dkyil 'khor chen por sbyar te /
analyzed: 'byung po thams cad kyi gtor ma de gtang ba gnas dgon pa zhes pa de yang ri rab ri'i rgyal po mchog tu bzang por gsungs pa'i steng du dkyil 'khor chen por sbyar te /
translated: That bali offering to all the bhūtas should be offered in the place called the monastery, which is said to be on top of Mount Meru, the king of mountains, the most excellent and good.

original: gru bzhi pa sgo bzhi pa tva ra na bzhis rnam par brgyan pa'i 'khor lo rim pa lnga'i dbus su ni sna tshogs padma'i lte ba'i dkyil 'khor lo rdo rje sems dpa' yongs su zhu ba'i bdag nyid las dpal he ru ka rnam par bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: gru bzhi pa sgo bzhi pa tva ra na bzhis rnam par brgyan pa'i 'khor lo rim pa lnga'i dbus su ni sna tshogs padma'i lte ba'i dkyil 'khor lo rdo rje sems dpa' yongs su zhu ba'i bdag nyid las dpal he ru ka rnam par bsgom par bya'o //
translated: In the center of the great maṇḍala, in the center of the variegated lotus, one should visualize Śrī Heruka in the form of Vajrasattva, in the center of the maṇḍala of the five-layered wheel, which is adorned with four tvaṭas and four doors.

original: rtag pa dang chad pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i ngo bo 'jigs byed dang dus mtshan gyi steng du g-yas brkyang ba'i sbyor bas gnas par mdzad cing bdud thams cad rab tu gnon pa /
analyzed: rtag pa dang chad pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i ngo bo 'jigs byed dang dus mtshan gyi steng du g-yas brkyang ba'i sbyor bas gnas par mdzad cing bdud thams cad rab tu gnon pa /
translated: He is standing in the pose of right leg extended on top of Bhairava and Kālarātri, the nature of the concepts of eternalism and nihilism, trampling on all māras.

original: kha dog sngon po chen por 'jigs //
analyzed: kha dog sngon po chen por 'jigs //
translated: He is very frightening, blue in color,

original: 'jig pa'i dus kyi me chen po lta bu 'jigs pa spyan gsum pa can mi bzad pa /
analyzed: 'jig pa'i dus kyi me chen po lta bu 'jigs pa spyan gsum pa can mi bzad pa /
translated: like the great fire of the end of the eon, with three eyes, and terrifying.🔽He has a crown of five dry human heads and a garland of fresh heads.

original: thod pa'i phreng ba'i dbu rgyan can /
analyzed: thod pa'i phreng ba'i dbu rgyan can /
translated: He has a crown of skulls and a garland of heads.

original: sangs rgyas lnga yis byin gyis brlabs pa //
analyzed: sangs rgyas lnga yis byin gyis brlabs pa //
translated: He is empowered by the five buddhas.

original: sna tshogs rdo rjes dbu'i ral pa bcings pa byang chub kyi sems zla bas nye bar mdzes pa /
analyzed: sna tshogs rdo rjes dbu'i ral pa bcings pa byang chub kyi sems zla bas nye bar mdzes pa /
translated: His topknot is bound with a vajra cross, beautified by the moon of bodhicitta.

original: phyag rgya drug gis sku la rgyan du mdzad pa /
analyzed: phyag rgya drug gis sku la rgyan du mdzad pa /
translated: He is adorned with the six mudras on his body.

original: mtshan thams cad kyis brgyan pa /
analyzed: mtshan thams cad kyis brgyan pa /
translated: He is adorned with all the marks.

original: zhal drug pa phyag bcu drug pa'o //🔽dpa' ba dang smre ba dang sgeg pa dang bzhad pa dang / drag pa dang / zhal gdangs shing ljags 'dril ba ste sngon po dang / de bzhin du dmar po dang ser po dang ljang gu dang / dkar po dang steng gi zhal ni drag @117a * //
analyzed: zhal drug pa phyag bcu drug pa'o // dpa' ba dang smre ba dang sgeg pa dang bzhad pa dang / drag pa dang / zhal gdangs shing ljags 'dril ba ste sngon po dang / de bzhin du dmar po dang ser po dang ljang gu dang / dkar po dang steng gi zhal ni drag @117a * //
translated: He has six faces and sixteen arms.🔽His faces are heroic, laughing, passionate, smiling, wrathful, gaping, and curling the tongue—blue,🔽and likewise red, yellow, green,

original: po chen po ste nag po'o //
analyzed: po chen po ste nag po'o //
translated: white, and the upper face is that of a great wrathful one, black.

original: khyon ni nam mkha'i khyon tsam mo //
analyzed: khyon ni nam mkha'i khyon tsam mo //
translated: His size is as vast as space.

original: h'a h'a zhes sgrogs shing de nyid du h'um zhes kyang mdzad cing hi hi mdzad pas 'jigs par mdzad pa /
analyzed: h'a h'a zhes sgrogs shing de nyid du h'um zhes kyang mdzad cing hi hi mdzad pas 'jigs par mdzad pa /
translated: He proclaims “ha ha” and in the same way he makes “hum” and “hi hi” sounds, terrifying.

original: h'um h'um mdzad pas phat sgra sgrogs shing aom aom gyis mdzad pa sgrogs pa'o //
analyzed: h'um h'um mdzad pas phat sgra sgrogs shing aom aom gyis mdzad pa sgrogs pa'o //
translated: By the performance of HUM HUM, he utters the sound of Phat, and by the performance of OM OM, he utters the sound of OM.

original: rdo rje dang dril bu bsnams nas snyoms par zhugs pas lha mo'i nu ma btsir ba'o //
analyzed: rdo rje dang dril bu bsnams nas snyoms par zhugs pas lha mo'i nu ma btsir ba'o //
translated: Holding the vajra and bell, he enters into union, and squeezes the breasts of the goddess.

original: gzhan rnams kyis ni dus mtshan mo dang drag po'i pags pa 'dzin pa dang thod pa dang kha tv'am ga dang / mdung rtse gsum pa dang gri gug dang / dgra sta dang / lcags kyu dang zhags pa dang / mgo bo dang / cang te'u dang /
analyzed: gzhan rnams kyis ni dus mtshan mo dang drag po'i pags pa 'dzin pa dang thod pa dang kha tv'am ga dang / mdung rtse gsum pa dang gri gug dang / dgra sta dang / lcags kyu dang zhags pa dang / mgo bo dang / cang te'u dang /
translated: The others hold the skin of Kala and Rudra, the skull, the khatvanga, the trident, the curved knife, the battle-ax, the hook, the noose, the head, the damaru,

original: de bzhin du gsal shing ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du gsal shing ngo //
translated: and likewise the spear.

original: phyag gnyis kyis ni 'bar ba'i phyag rgya bcas nas dpral ba'i steng du bzhag pa'o //
analyzed: phyag gnyis kyis ni 'bar ba'i phyag rgya bcas nas dpral ba'i steng du bzhag pa'o //
translated: With two hands he makes the blazing mudra and places it on his forehead.

original: phag mo'i kha dog dang phyag mtshan rnams kyang de bzhin no //
analyzed: phag mo'i kha dog dang phyag mtshan rnams kyang de bzhin no //
translated: The color and implements of Varahi are the same.

original: 'on kyang pags pa'i na bza' spangs pa'i phyag gis mda' dang gzhu 'dzin pa'i lha mo ste gcer bu dbu skra grol ba dum bus brgyan pa'i sku rags can /
analyzed: 'on kyang pags pa'i na bza' spangs pa'i phyag gis mda' dang gzhu 'dzin pa'i lha mo ste gcer bu dbu skra grol ba dum bus brgyan pa'i sku rags can /
translated: However, the goddess holds the bow and arrow with her hands, which are free of the skin garment, and is naked with loose hair, adorned with a belt of human bone segments.

original: byin pa gnyis kyis mnyam par bsdams pa ni thugs rje chen pos chags pa rtag tu bde ba srid pa 'gro ba rigs drug po yang dag par sbyor bar mdzad cing sems can gyi don la dgyes pa'o //
analyzed: byin pa gnyis kyis mnyam par bsdams pa ni thugs rje chen pos chags pa rtag tu bde ba srid pa 'gro ba rigs drug po yang dag par sbyor bar mdzad cing sems can gyi don la dgyes pa'o //
translated: The two thighs are bound together, which is the great compassion that always delights in the bliss of passion, and the correct union of the six classes of migrating beings.

original: 'dab ma bzhi la ni pho nya mo bzhi ste /
analyzed: 'dab ma bzhi la ni pho nya mo bzhi ste /
translated: The four messengers are on the four petals.

original: sa la sogs pa'i rang gi ngo bo mkha' 'gro ma la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: sa la sogs pa'i rang gi ngo bo mkha' 'gro ma la sogs pa ste /
translated: The nature of earth and so on is the dakini and so forth.

original: sngon po dang ser po dang / dmar po dang / ljang gu'o //
analyzed: sngon po dang ser po dang / dmar po dang / ljang gu'o //
translated: They are blue, yellow, red, and green.

original: zhal gcig phyag bzhi pa /
analyzed: zhal gcig phyag bzhi pa /
translated: They have one face and four hands.

original: spyan gsum pa gcer bu skra grol ba nu ma rgyas pa dang / sgeg pa dang bcas shing rnam par bzhad pa'i zhal can phyag rgya lngas rnam par brgyan pa'o //
analyzed: spyan gsum pa gcer bu skra grol ba nu ma rgyas pa dang / sgeg pa dang bcas shing rnam par bzhad pa'i zhal can phyag rgya lngas rnam par brgyan pa'o //
translated: They have three eyes, are naked, have loose hair, full breasts, are playful, and have smiling faces, and are adorned with the five symbolic ornaments.

original: g-yon pa rnams na lcags kyu dang / zhags pa dang / lcags sgrog dang / 'bebs pa lta bu ste 'gugs pa'i tshul dang / 'dzud pa'i tshul dang / 'ching ba'i tshul dang / spyan 'dren pa'i tshul lta bu'o //
analyzed: g-yon pa rnams na lcags kyu dang / zhags pa dang / lcags sgrog dang / 'bebs pa lta bu ste 'gugs pa'i tshul dang / 'dzud pa'i tshul dang / 'ching ba'i tshul dang / spyan 'dren pa'i tshul lta bu'o //
translated: In the left hands, a hook, a noose, a chain, and a gesture as if pulling, as if drawing in, as if binding, and as if summoning.

original: gzhan na ni gri gug dang / thod pa dang kha tv'am ga dang / cang te'u'o //
analyzed: gzhan na ni gri gug dang / thod pa dang kha tv'am ga dang / cang te'u'o //
translated: In the other hands, a flaying knife, a skull, a khaṭvāṅga, and a small drum.

original: zhabs g-yas brkyang bas yang dag par bzhugs pa /
analyzed: zhabs g-yas brkyang bas yang dag par bzhugs pa /
translated: He stands with his right leg straight.

original: thugs rje'i chags pas bde ba /
analyzed: thugs rje'i chags pas bde ba /
translated: He is blissful with the passion of compassion.

original: 'khrul pa thams cad rnam par spangs pa'o //
analyzed: 'khrul pa thams cad rnam par spangs pa'o //
translated: He is free from all error.

original: mtshams rnams na bum pa bza' ba thams cad kyis gang ba'i @117b steng na thod pa byang chub kyi sems 'o mas rab tu gang ba rnams so //
analyzed: mtshams rnams na bum pa bza' ba thams cad kyis gang ba'i @117b steng na thod pa byang chub kyi sems 'o mas rab tu gang ba rnams so //
translated: In the intermediate directions are vases filled with all kinds of food, upon which are skull cups filled with bodhicitta milk.

original: sku gsung thugs su byin gyis brlab cing ye shes sems dpa' dang go cha rnam pa gnyis byas te /
analyzed: sku gsung thugs su byin gyis brlab cing ye shes sems dpa' dang go cha rnam pa gnyis byas te /
translated: Bless the body, speech, and mind, and create the two kinds of armor of the awareness beings.

original: yi ge dza: la sogs pas yang dag par sbyar la dbang bskur te mchod cing bstod la bka' bsgo bar bya'o /
analyzed: yi ge dza: la sogs pas yang dag par sbyar la dbang bskur te mchod cing bstod la bka' bsgo bar bya'o /
translated: Having consecrated the syllables jra, etc., one should confer initiation, make offerings, praise, and give orders.

original: // / de yang shing gcig dang dur khrod la sogs par gnas la ji skad du gsungs pa'i sngags rjes su sbyor ba'i sgo nas 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lha'i tshogs thams cad kyis yongs su bskor ba'o //
analyzed: // / de yang shing gcig dang dur khrod la sogs par gnas la ji skad du gsungs pa'i sngags rjes su sbyor ba'i sgo nas 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lha'i tshogs thams cad kyis yongs su bskor ba'o //
translated: Moreover, in a solitary place such as a charnel ground, one should be surrounded by the hosts of all worldly and transcendent deities by means of the application of the previously mentioned mantra.

original: zhing brgyad kyis bdag mo dgod par bya ba'i rim pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: zhing brgyad kyis bdag mo dgod par bya ba'i rim pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: This is the procedure for the eight cemeteries:

original: phag mo dang / shes byed ma nyid dang / gzhon nu ma dang / de bzhin du keng rus ma dang / tshangs pa mo dang / tshogs bdag mo dang / khyab 'jug mo dang / dbang po ma dang / brgyad du bshad de rim pa gnyis pa'i'o //
analyzed: phag mo dang / shes byed ma nyid dang / gzhon nu ma dang / de bzhin du keng rus ma dang / tshangs pa mo dang / tshogs bdag mo dang / khyab 'jug mo dang / dbang po ma dang / brgyad du bshad de rim pa gnyis pa'i'o //
translated: Varahi, Jnanakarni, Kumari, likewise, Kapalini, Brahmani, Ganapatini, Visnumati, and Indrani.

original: rim pa gsum pa la ni dbang po dang / gshin rje dang / chu bdag dang / nor sbyin dang / yi dags kyi gdan can dang / sreg rdzas kyi gdan can dang / bden bral dang / rlung gi lha'o //
analyzed: rim pa gsum pa la ni dbang po dang / gshin rje dang / chu bdag dang / nor sbyin dang / yi dags kyi gdan can dang / sreg rdzas kyi gdan can dang / bden bral dang / rlung gi lha'o //
translated: In the third stage, there are the seats of Indra, Yama, Varuna, Kubera, and the hungry ghosts, as well as the seats of the sacrificial substances, the seats of Nairrta and the wind god.

original: rim pa bzhi pa la nyi ma dang / zla ba dang / mig dmar dang / gza' lag pa dang / phur bu dang / ba bsangs dang / spen pa dang / r'a hu la dang / rgyal mtshan no //
analyzed: rim pa bzhi pa la nyi ma dang / zla ba dang / mig dmar dang / gza' lag pa dang / phur bu dang / ba bsangs dang / spen pa dang / r'a hu la dang / rgyal mtshan no //
translated: In the fourth stage, there are the sun, moon, Mars, Mercury, Jupiter, Venus, Saturn, Rahu, and Ketu.

original: rim pa lnga pa la ni sgo bzhir te /
analyzed: rim pa lnga pa la ni sgo bzhir te /
translated: In the fifth stage, there are the four gates.

original: tshangs pa dang / khyab 'jug dang / de bzhin du drag po dang / k'arti ka rnams so //
analyzed: tshangs pa dang / khyab 'jug dang / de bzhin du drag po dang / k'arti ka rnams so //
translated: Brahma, Vishnu, Rudra, and Karttikeya.

original: de la sngon du gsungs pa'i rim pa gnyis pa'i lha mo rnams skyes pa'i rim pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la sngon du gsungs pa'i rim pa gnyis pa'i lha mo rnams skyes pa'i rim pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The order of the goddesses in the second stage mentioned previously is as follows.

original: hr'i:'i yi ge las byung ba'i lha mo phag mo zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: hr'i:'i yi ge las byung ba'i lha mo phag mo zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The goddess born from the syllable hrīḥ is called Vārāhī.

original: phyag bzhi pa la mda' dang gzhu dang / de bzhin du rgyal mtshan dang thod pa bsnams pa'o //
analyzed: phyag bzhi pa la mda' dang gzhu dang / de bzhin du rgyal mtshan dang thod pa bsnams pa'o //
translated: She has four arms and holds a bow and arrow, as well as a banner and a skull cup.

original: kha dog sngon po 'jigs pa chen po phag gi gdong pas 'jigs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: kha dog sngon po 'jigs pa chen po phag gi gdong pas 'jigs par byed pa'o //
translated: The color is blue, and the great fear is created by the face of a pig.

original: byang du yi ge phem gis shes byed mo kha dog dmar po drag mo chen mo ste /
analyzed: byang du yi ge phem gis shes byed mo kha dog dmar po drag mo chen mo ste /
translated: In the north, the letter pheṃ creates the goddess Jñānadākinī, who is red and very fierce.

original: thod pa dang lcags kyu dang / de bzhin du kha tv'am ga dang cang te'u'o //
analyzed: thod pa dang lcags kyu dang / de bzhin du kha tv'am ga dang cang te'u'o //
translated: She holds a skull cup and iron hook, and likewise a khaṭvāṅga and a small drum.

original: nub phyogs su yi ge hi yis gzhon nu mdog ser mo phyag bzhi pa ste /
analyzed: nub phyogs su yi ge hi yis gzhon nu mdog ser mo phyag bzhi pa ste /
translated: In the west, the letter hi creates the goddess Kumārī, who is yellow and has four faces.

original: rtse gsum pa dang / dar lce gsum pa dang / de bzhin du mda' dang gzhu 'dzin pa'o //🔽lhor yi ge ho yis keng rus ma mdog nag mo @118a * //
analyzed: rtse gsum pa dang / dar lce gsum pa dang / de bzhin du mda' dang gzhu 'dzin pa'o // lhor yi ge ho yis keng rus ma mdog nag mo @118a * //
translated: She holds a trident and a banner with three streamers, and likewise a bow and arrow.

original: phyag bzhi pa ste /
analyzed: phyag bzhi pa ste /
translated: In the south, the letter ho creates the goddess Kapālinī, who is black and has four faces.

original: kha tv'am ga dang thod pa dang de bzhin du ral gri dang cang te'u'o //
analyzed: kha tv'am ga dang thod pa dang de bzhin du ral gri dang cang te'u'o //
translated: She holds a khaṭvāṅga and a skull cup, and likewise a sword and a small drum.

original: me'i phyogs su yi ge bam gyis tshangs pa mo ste kha dog dkar mo phyag bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: me'i phyogs su yi ge bam gyis tshangs pa mo ste kha dog dkar mo phyag bzhi pa'o //
translated: In the southeast, the letter vaṃ creates Brahmāṇī, who is white and has four faces.

original: tshangs pa'i mgo bo dang / thod pa dang / de bzhin du mda' dang gzhu'o //
analyzed: tshangs pa'i mgo bo dang / thod pa dang / de bzhin du mda' dang gzhu'o //
translated: She holds a head of Brahmā and a skull cup, and likewise a bow and arrow.

original: bden bral du ni yi ge gam gis tshogs bdag mo kha dog sngo bsangs la phyag bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: bden bral du ni yi ge gam gis tshogs bdag mo kha dog sngo bsangs la phyag bzhi pa'o //
translated: In the southwest, from the syllable ghaṃ, is Ghasmarī, blue, with four faces,

original: phyag na rtse gsum dang / thod pa dang / phreng ba dang / la du bsnams pa'o //
analyzed: phyag na rtse gsum dang / thod pa dang / phreng ba dang / la du bsnams pa'o //
translated: holding a trident, a skull, a garland, and a ladle.

original: rlung gi mtshams su yi ge bam gyis khyab 'jug mo mdog sngon mo phyag rgya bzhi pa ste /
analyzed: rlung gi mtshams su yi ge bam gyis khyab 'jug mo mdog sngon mo phyag rgya bzhi pa ste /
translated: In the northwest, from the syllable baṃ, is Vāyuvegā, blue, with four faces,

original: chang gi snod dang / thod pa dang / de bzhin du zhags pa dang / ral gri'o //
analyzed: chang gi snod dang / thod pa dang / de bzhin du zhags pa dang / ral gri'o //
translated: holding a wine vessel, a skull, a noose, and a sword.

original: dbang ldan du yi ge ai las byung ba dbang po mo ste /
analyzed: dbang ldan du yi ge ai las byung ba dbang po mo ste /
translated: In the northeast, from the syllable i, is Indrānī,

original: kha dog ser mo phyag bzhi pa rdo rje dang gsal shing dang / thod pa dang / sdigs mdzub dang / zhags pa'o //

original: bden bral gyi dga' byed kyi chung ma mche ba'i gzugs can ma dang / mi bzad 'jigs ma dang / thod phreng ma dang / gshin rje'i steng 'gro ma ste /
analyzed: bden bral gyi dga' byed kyi chung ma mche ba'i gzugs can ma dang / mi bzad 'jigs ma dang / thod phreng ma dang / gshin rje'i steng 'gro ma ste /
translated: In the southwest, the wife of Manmatha is Dāntī, the wife of Atikhāyī, the wife of Kapālamālā, and the wife of Yama.

original: nag mo bzang mo'i kha dog can la lag na bza' btung can no //
analyzed: nag mo bzang mo'i kha dog can la lag na bza' btung can no //
translated: They are the color of Bhadrakālī and hold food and drink.

original: rlung mtshams kyi rnam par 'dren pa'i chung ma ni lag na ral gri ma dang / lag na dgra sta ma dang / lag na rdo rje ma dang / lag na gzhu 'dzin ma ste /
analyzed: rlung mtshams kyi rnam par 'dren pa'i chung ma ni lag na ral gri ma dang / lag na dgra sta ma dang / lag na rdo rje ma dang / lag na gzhu 'dzin ma ste /
translated: The wives of the leaders in the wind directions are Sword-in-Hand, Axe-in-Hand, Vajra-in-Hand, and Bow-in-Hand.

original: rgyal ma la sogs pa'i mdog can la lag na bza' btung can no //
analyzed: rgyal ma la sogs pa'i mdog can la lag na bza' btung can no //
translated: They are the colors of Jayā and so on, and they hold food and drink in their hands.

original: shar gyi tv'a ra na'i phyi rgyab kyi dur khrod na /
analyzed: shar gyi tv'a ra na'i phyi rgyab kyi dur khrod na /
translated: In the charnel ground behind Eastern Tuṣita

original: 'jigs byed lag pa tsam dang ldan pa dang / srin po khri stengs nyal dang / tshogs kyi dbang phyug dang / dril bu'i rna cha can no //
analyzed: 'jigs byed lag pa tsam dang ldan pa dang / srin po khri stengs nyal dang / tshogs kyi dbang phyug dang / dril bu'i rna cha can no //
translated: are the one with the hand of Bhairava, the rākṣasa lying on a bier, the lord of the gaṇas, and the one with a bell earring.

original: de rnams bzhi'i chung ma rnams kyang mkha' 'gro ma'i mdog can no //
analyzed: de rnams bzhi'i chung ma rnams kyang mkha' 'gro ma'i mdog can no //
translated: Their wives are the colors of the ḍākinīs.

original: byang gi dur khrod na gtum pa'i dbang phyug dang / 'jigs pa'i 'jang @120a * //
analyzed: byang gi dur khrod na gtum pa'i dbang phyug dang / 'jigs pa'i 'jang @120a * //
translated: In the northern charnel ground are Caṇḍa, the lord of fear,

original: sgrogs dang / ro smad drag po dang / sbom po'i dbang phyug ste l'a ma'i mdog can no //
analyzed: sgrogs dang / ro smad drag po dang / sbom po'i dbang phyug ste l'a ma'i mdog can no //
translated: the terrible one, and the lord of the stout one, who are the colors of lāma.

original: de rnams kyi chung ma'ang de bzhin no //
analyzed: de rnams kyi chung ma'ang de bzhin no //
translated: Their wives are the same.

original: nub kyi dur khrod na che ba dang / chen po dang / phag ka dang / 'jigs byed rnams dang / de'i chung ma rnams te /
analyzed: nub kyi dur khrod na che ba dang / chen po dang / phag ka dang / 'jigs byed rnams dang / de'i chung ma rnams te /
translated: In the western charnel ground are Mahābhairava, Mahābhairava, Vārāha, and Bhairava, and their wives.

original: dum skyes ma'i mdog can no //
analyzed: dum skyes ma'i mdog can no //
translated: They are the color of Caṇḍī.

original: lho phyogs kyi dur khrod na dri za'i dbang phyug dang / 'jigs pa'i sgra sgrogs dang / mche ba gtsigs pa dang / gzhu 'dzin te /
analyzed: lho phyogs kyi dur khrod na dri za'i dbang phyug dang / 'jigs pa'i sgra sgrogs dang / mche ba gtsigs pa dang / gzhu 'dzin te /
translated: In the southern charnel ground are Gandharva, Bhīṣaṇa, Daṃṣṭri, and Dhanuṣka.

original: 'di dag rang gi chung ma dang bcas pa gzugs can ma'i mdog can no //
analyzed: 'di dag rang gi chung ma dang bcas pa gzugs can ma'i mdog can no //
translated: They are the color of Rūpiṇī, together with their wives.

original: de dag thams cad gdong gcig pa lag pa bzhi pa ste /
analyzed: de dag thams cad gdong gcig pa lag pa bzhi pa ste /
translated: All of them have one face and four arms.

original: kha tv'am ga dang thod pa dang rtse gsum pa dang / lha mo la 'khyud pa'i lag pa'o //
analyzed: kha tv'am ga dang thod pa dang rtse gsum pa dang / lha mo la 'khyud pa'i lag pa'o //
translated: They hold a khaṭvāṅga, a skull, a trident, and an arm embracing the goddess.

original: sngon du bshad pa'i shing brgyad dang ldan par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: sngon du bshad pa'i shing brgyad dang ldan par blta bar bya'o //
translated: They should be seen as possessing the eight trees previously explained.

original: de dag khams gsum pa thams cad kyang gnas te /
analyzed: de dag khams gsum pa thams cad kyang gnas te /
translated: All of the three realms are their abode.

original: rig pa 'dzin pa grub pa dang / lha ma yin dang mi ma yin pa la sogs pa mang pos kun du yongs su bskor bar byas pa'o //
analyzed: rig pa 'dzin pa grub pa dang / lha ma yin dang mi ma yin pa la sogs pa mang pos kun du yongs su bskor bar byas pa'o //
translated: They are surrounded by many accomplished knowledge holders, demigods, and non-humans.

original: yi dags dang sha za la sogs pa kun du sgra sgrogs shing thams cad kyang sgrub pa po la gdong mngon du phyogs te mchog ster bar bya'o //
analyzed: yi dags dang sha za la sogs pa kun du sgra sgrogs shing thams cad kyang sgrub pa po la gdong mngon du phyogs te mchog ster bar bya'o //
translated: The pretas, piśācas, and so on, all shout out, and all of them, facing the practitioner, grant the supreme.

original: thams cad kyi snying gar rang rang gi ming gi yi ge dang po dgod par bya'o //
analyzed: thams cad kyi snying gar rang rang gi ming gi yi ge dang po dgod par bya'o //
translated: At the heart of all of them, one should place the first letter of their names.

original: aom a'a: h'um zhes pas ni sku gsung thugs kyi rigs gsum du bskyed par bstan no //
analyzed: aom a'a: h'um zhes pas ni sku gsung thugs kyi rigs gsum du bskyed par bstan no //
translated: With Oṃ āḥ hūṃ, one should generate the three families of body, speech, and mind.

original: de nas cho ga bzhin du zhabs bsil ba dang / bsang gtor dang / zhal bsil la dam tshig rnams la dam tshig gi sbyor bas sbyar te bza'/
analyzed: de nas cho ga bzhin du zhabs bsil ba dang / bsang gtor dang / zhal bsil la dam tshig rnams la dam tshig gi sbyor bas sbyar te bza'/
translated: Then, as in the ritual, one should offer the foot-washing, the sprinkling, and the mouth-rinsing, and one should eat the pledges with the application of the pledge.

original: rang gi dkyil 'khor pa rnams la bza' ba dang btung ba sbyin par bya ste /
analyzed: rang gi dkyil 'khor pa rnams la bza' ba dang btung ba sbyin par bya ste /
translated: One should give the food and drink to one’s maṇḍala.

original: phyag 'tshal yi ger yang dag ldan /
analyzed: phyag 'tshal yi ger yang dag ldan /
translated: Homage, endowed with the syllables,

original: dbus su h'um nyid byas nas su //
analyzed: dbus su h'um nyid byas nas su //
translated: in the middle, having made the hūṃ itself,

original: 'bar zhing 'bar bar hr'i: 'bar bas //
analyzed: 'bar zhing 'bar bar hr'i: 'bar bas //
translated: blazing, blazing, with hrīḥ blazing,

original: bya ba ji srid rab tu 'grub //
analyzed: bya ba ji srid rab tu 'grub //
translated: one should do it as long as one is successful.

original: ces so // rdo rje thal mo kha gyen du phye la sngags 'di brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: ces so // rdo rje thal mo kha gyen du phye la sngags 'di brjod par bya ste /
translated: Having opened the vajra palms upward, one should recite this mantra:

original: kha kha kh'a hi kh'a hi zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: kha kha kh'a hi kh'a hi zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: kha kha khāhi khāhi, etc.

original: me tog dang / bdug pa dang / byug pa la sogs pas kyang mchod de /
analyzed: me tog dang / bdug pa dang / byug pa la sogs pas kyang mchod de /
translated: One should also worship with flowers, incense, ointments, etc.

original: de dag gi sems mgu bar byas na 'dod pa'i mchog ster bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag gi sems mgu bar byas na 'dod pa'i mchog ster bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one pleases their minds, they will grant the supreme of wishes.

original: de dag kyang bcom ldan 'das kyi sku gsung thugs kyi rnam par bsams la btang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de dag kyang bcom ldan 'das kyi sku gsung thugs kyi rnam par bsams la btang bar bya'o //
translated: And one should imagine them as the body, speech, and mind of the Bhagavat, and send them forth.

original: 'di dag ni dpal @120b he ru ka bde mchog gi 'grel pa sgrub thabs rnams kyi gnas zhes bya ba las le'u nyi shu rtsa bdun pa'i rnam par bshad pa'o /
analyzed: 'di dag ni dpal @120b he ru ka bde mchog gi 'grel pa sgrub thabs rnams kyi gnas zhes bya ba las le'u nyi shu rtsa bdun pa'i rnam par bshad pa'o /
translated: This is the explanation of the twenty-seventh chapter in the Śrī Herukābhidhāna, the king of tantras, called “The Origin of the Means of Achievement.”

original: // / de nas mchod pa rnam dag bdag //
analyzed: // / de nas mchod pa rnam dag bdag //
translated: Then, the pure self of worship,

original: ces pa la /
analyzed: ces pa la /
translated: one should worship the mandala.

original: rnam dag ces pa ni dngos po thams cad so so ma yin pa nyid de gnyis su med par bde ba chen po rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'o //
analyzed: rnam dag ces pa ni dngos po thams cad so so ma yin pa nyid de gnyis su med par bde ba chen po rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'o //
translated: “Pure” means that all things are not discrete, nondual, the nature of great bliss, natural luminosity.

original: de lta bu de nyid ni sangs rgyas rnams kyi chos kyi sku'o //
analyzed: de lta bu de nyid ni sangs rgyas rnams kyi chos kyi sku'o //
translated: That is the Dharma Body of the Buddhas.

original: de nas dpa' bo nges 'gro ba //🔽zhes pa ni srid pa mnyam pa dag gis mi g-yo ba'i phyir na /
analyzed: de nas dpa' bo nges 'gro ba // zhes pa ni srid pa mnyam pa dag gis mi g-yo ba'i phyir na /
translated: Then, the hero's definite departure,

original: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ste //
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ste //
translated: means that the Enjoyment Body is unmoved by the equalities of existence,

original: kun du bsags pa las 'khrungs pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: kun du bsags pa las 'khrungs pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because it is born from the accumulation of all.

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rjes su spyod pa'o //
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rjes su spyod pa'o //
translated: Then, the Bodhisattvas' practice,

original: sangs rgyas kyi tshogs 'phrog pas sems cad kyi don mdzad pa'i mtshan nyid ni sprul ba'i sku'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi tshogs 'phrog pas sems cad kyi don mdzad pa'i mtshan nyid ni sprul ba'i sku'o //
translated: means that the Emanation Body has the characteristic of working for the welfare of sentient beings by stealing the assemblies of the Buddhas.

original: de'i bdag nyid can gyi bdag nyid rang gi lhag pa'i lha'i sbyor bas ji ltar nus pa mchod par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid can gyi bdag nyid rang gi lhag pa'i lha'i sbyor bas ji ltar nus pa mchod par bya'o //
translated: One should make offerings to the extent of one's ability with the yoga of one's own special deity, whose nature is that.

original: bdag nyid mchod par bya zhes pa ni de lta bur bshad do //
analyzed: bdag nyid mchod par bya zhes pa ni de lta bur bshad do //
translated: It is explained that one should make offerings to oneself in that way.

original: don du spyad pa nyid kyang mchod //
analyzed: don du spyad pa nyid kyang mchod //
translated: One should also make offerings for the sake of practice.

original: ces pa ni /
analyzed: ces pa ni /
translated: It is said:

original: lhan cig thos pa dang bsam pa dag pa phun sum tshogs pa can te /
analyzed: lhan cig thos pa dang bsam pa dag pa phun sum tshogs pa can te /
translated: The one who is endowed with the perfection of the purity of hearing and reflection together,

original: rnal 'byor gcig la nges par byed pa rnams so //
analyzed: rnal 'byor gcig la nges par byed pa rnams so //
translated: and the ascertainment of the single yoga.

original: nyid ces pa'i sgra ni rnal 'byor ma rnams kyang yang dag par gzung bar bya ste /
analyzed: nyid ces pa'i sgra ni rnal 'byor ma rnams kyang yang dag par gzung bar bya ste /
translated: The word “also” is to be understood as referring to the yoginīs.

original: gang gi phyir der ma gyur na phun sum tshogs pa ma yin pa des na'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir der ma gyur na phun sum tshogs pa ma yin pa des na'o //
translated: Because if they are not there, then the perfection is not there.

original: des na 'di las /
analyzed: des na 'di las /
translated: Therefore, it is said here:

original: zla ba 'dus par yang dag gnas //🔽zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: zla ba 'dus par yang dag gnas // zhes gsungs te /
translated: The moon is situated in union.

original: yang dag gnas zhes pa ni shes rab dang yang dag par sbyor bar 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: yang dag gnas zhes pa ni shes rab dang yang dag par sbyor bar 'gro ba'o //
translated: “Situated in union” means the union with wisdom.

original: zla ba zhes pa ni chang ngo //
analyzed: zla ba zhes pa ni chang ngo //
translated: “Moon” means wine.

original: yang na ni zla ba zhes pa ni bde ba'i ga pur te /
analyzed: yang na ni zla ba zhes pa ni bde ba'i ga pur te /
translated: Or else, “moon” means the camphor of bliss,

original: rtag tu rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba skye ba'o //
analyzed: rtag tu rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba skye ba'o //
translated: which is always naturally luminous and arises.

original: de yang snying gi padmo la dngos gzhi dang bral ba'i stong pa nyid du blta bar bya ba yin te /
analyzed: de yang snying gi padmo la dngos gzhi dang bral ba'i stong pa nyid du blta bar bya ba yin te /
translated: And that is to be seen as the emptiness free from the main part in the lotus of the heart.

original: de lta bu'i sems ni bsgom par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de lta bu'i sems ni bsgom par bya ba yin no //
translated: Such a mind is to be cultivated.

original: spun dang sring mo lhan cig tu //
analyzed: spun dang sring mo lhan cig tu //
translated: With brothers and sisters together,

original: zhes pa ni byang chub kyi sems dang rnam par bral ba'i sdug pa'i bu dang bu mo mo la sogs pa dag la spangs dang / phyag rgya ston pa dang / dkyil 'khor dang / tshogs kyi 'khor lo ston pa dang / rdo rje'i glu thos par byed pa @121a * //
analyzed: zhes pa ni byang chub kyi sems dang rnam par bral ba'i sdug pa'i bu dang bu mo mo la sogs pa dag la spangs dang / phyag rgya ston pa dang / dkyil 'khor dang / tshogs kyi 'khor lo ston pa dang / rdo rje'i glu thos par byed pa @121a * //
translated: This is to say, if one disparages and despises that master, and all sentient beings become hostile, when one shows the seal to those who are separated from the spirit of enlightenment, to one's dear sons and daughters, etc.,

original: dang / dam tshig dag go bar byed na slob dpon de la smod cing brnyas pa dang / sems can thams cad kyang sdang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dang / dam tshig dag go bar byed na slob dpon de la smod cing brnyas pa dang / sems can thams cad kyang sdang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and when one makes them hear the vajra song, and makes them understand the commitments.

original: de'i phyir na slob dpon de'i bu la sogs pa rnams dmyal bar 'gro zhing //
analyzed: de'i phyir na slob dpon de'i bu la sogs pa rnams dmyal bar 'gro zhing //
translated: Therefore, the sons, etc., of that master go to hell,

original: sems can gzhan rnams kyang 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems can gzhan rnams kyang 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and other sentient beings also go there.

original: de'i phyir na de byang chub kyi sems dri ma can du 'gro'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir na de byang chub kyi sems dri ma can du 'gro'o //
translated: Therefore, that [master] goes to a defiled spirit of enlightenment.

original: des na de dag nyid yongs su gzung ste zas la spyad par bya'o zhes bya bar 'brel to //
analyzed: des na de dag nyid yongs su gzung ste zas la spyad par bya'o zhes bya bar 'brel to //
translated: Therefore, one should take them and enjoy the food.

original: 'di dag ni spyi'i khyad par tsam ste /
analyzed: 'di dag ni spyi'i khyad par tsam ste /
translated: These are just general distinctions.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gal to 'am brgya la byang chub tu sems bskyed pa snying rjes ma bcings pa yin na ni ji lta ba de bzhin du ste /
analyzed: gal to 'am brgya la byang chub tu sems bskyed pa snying rjes ma bcings pa yin na ni ji lta ba de bzhin du ste /
translated: If, in a hundred cases, one has generated the Thought of Awakening, but not bound by compassion, then just like that,

original: de rnams la yang dag nyid kyis ni bstan par mi bya'i /
analyzed: de rnams la yang dag nyid kyis ni bstan par mi bya'i /
translated: one should not teach the real nature to them.

original: de rnams gzhan la spyod du gzhug par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: de rnams gzhan la spyod du gzhug par bya ba yin te /
translated: One should cause them to engage in the practice of others,

original: der byang chub kyi sems bskyed pa'i dad pas de'i dbang du gting bar bya'o //
analyzed: der byang chub kyi sems bskyed pa'i dad pas de'i dbang du gting bar bya'o //
translated: and there, by the faith of generating the Thought of Awakening, one should bring them under one's control.

original: de ltar na ni rtag tu dam tshig la sbyar par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na ni rtag tu dam tshig la sbyar par 'gyur ro //
translated: In that way, one is always connected to the commitments.

original: rtag tu dam tshig spyad byas 'gyur //
analyzed: rtag tu dam tshig spyad byas 'gyur //
translated: One should always practice the commitments.

original: zhes pa'i don ni de ltar ro //
analyzed: zhes pa'i don ni de ltar ro //
translated: The meaning is like that.

original: gsang sngags su la'ang mi sbyin no //
analyzed: gsang sngags su la'ang mi sbyin no //
translated: One should not give the mantra to anyone.

original: zhes pa ni yongs su ma byang ba'i sems can rnams la'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni yongs su ma byang ba'i sems can rnams la'o //
translated: This is for sentient beings who are not completely purified.

original: sbyin zhes pa ni bdag gis dbang bskur ba rnams so //
analyzed: sbyin zhes pa ni bdag gis dbang bskur ba rnams so //
translated: One should give means those who have been initiated by me.

original: pho nya mo zhes pa la sogs pa la /
analyzed: pho nya mo zhes pa la sogs pa la /
translated: The messenger, etc., is as follows:

original: lam ni lam dang 'dra bas byang chub kyi lam ste /
analyzed: lam ni lam dang 'dra bas byang chub kyi lam ste /
translated: The path is the path of awakening, like the path.

original: nyon mongs pa mtha' yas par yongs su dag par skyes par byed de //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa mtha' yas par yongs su dag par skyes par byed de //
translated: He causes the arising of the purification of the infinite afflictions.

original: nyon mongs pa rnams ni glo bur ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams ni glo bur ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because the afflictions are adventitious.

original: de yang 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de yang 'di lta ste /
translated: And that is like this:

original: dper na nam mkha' la kha ba dang du ba la sogs pas bsgos pa lta bu'i 'khrul pa tsam po de rnam par bsal bar byas na ni /
analyzed: dper na nam mkha' la kha ba dang du ba la sogs pas bsgos pa lta bu'i 'khrul pa tsam po de rnam par bsal bar byas na ni /
translated: For example, just like the confusion of the sky being colored by snow, smoke, and so forth, when that is removed,

original: rdo rje 'dzin pa nyid du tshe 'di nyid la 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: rdo rje 'dzin pa nyid du tshe 'di nyid la 'gyur ba'o //
translated: one becomes a vajra-holder in this very life.

original: de lta bur byed pa de yongs su spangs nas rnal 'byor gzhan la yang dag par gnas pa ni //
analyzed: de lta bur byed pa de yongs su spangs nas rnal 'byor gzhan la yang dag par gnas pa ni //
translated: Having abandoned such activity, one should abide in another yoga.

original: nyan thos kyi spyod pa dang / bya ba'i rgyud kyi spyod pa la sogs par bshad do //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi spyod pa dang / bya ba'i rgyud kyi spyod pa la sogs par bshad do //
translated: It is explained that one should abide in the conduct of the śrāvakas, the conduct of the kriyā tantras, and so forth.

original: de lta bu'i dngos grub la 'dod pa de ni rnam par rmongs te /
analyzed: de lta bu'i dngos grub la 'dod pa de ni rnam par rmongs te /
translated: One who desires such an attainment is confused.

original: de'i dngos grub dang bde ba tsam du yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i dngos grub dang bde ba tsam du yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: That will not even be an attainment or happiness for him.

original: rgyal srid dang bral ba'i mi lta bu'o //
analyzed: rgyal srid dang bral ba'i mi lta bu'o //
translated: It is like a person who has been deprived of his kingdom.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de la dad pa med pa'i phyir na'o //
analyzed: de la dad pa med pa'i phyir na'o //
translated: Because he has no faith in that.

original: 'o na ji ltar zhe na //🔽pho nyar chags pa rnam thar pa //
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar zhe na // pho nyar chags pa rnam thar pa //
translated: How then?

original: zhes pa gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes pa gsungs te /
translated: The messenger is liberated by passion.

original: chags par bya ba la @121b chags pas bltas te mthong na grol zhing thar te /
analyzed: chags par bya ba la @121b chags pas bltas te mthong na grol zhing thar te /
translated: If one sees by the passion of the one to be passionate, one is liberated and freed.

original: pho nya mo la chags pas yang dag par grol ba'o //
analyzed: pho nya mo la chags pas yang dag par grol ba'o //
translated: The messenger is truly liberated by passion.

original: de'i phyir na de la rim pa bzhin du spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir na de la rim pa bzhin du spyad par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should practice in stages with her.

original: bha ga las bskyed pa'i thams cad bde ba rnams ni bdud rtsir rtag tu nges pa'o //
analyzed: bha ga las bskyed pa'i thams cad bde ba rnams ni bdud rtsir rtag tu nges pa'o //
translated: All the bliss generated from the bhaga is always ascertained as nectar.

original: bsnyen bkur nyid ni bya ba min //
analyzed: bsnyen bkur nyid ni bya ba min //
translated: One should not do the act of worship.

original: zhes pa ni de la bsnyen bkur la sogs pa'i don gyi bya ba ma yin te /

analyzed: shar gyi sgor ni rdo rje 'bar ma'o // byang du ni 'khyil pa ma'o // nub tu ni rdo rje 'jigs byed ma'o //

original: lho ru ni rdo rje 'grub pa ma'o //
analyzed: lho ru ni rdo rje 'grub pa ma'o //

analyzed: mkha' 'gro ma de dag ni dngos grub kyi dkyil 'khor de kun kyang spyan gsum pa //

original: zhal rnam par gtsigs pa /
analyzed: zhal rnam par gtsigs pa /

original: lto 'phyang ma'i sgo skyong ma'o //
analyzed: lto 'phyang ma'i sgo skyong ma'o //

original: gzhan rnams ni sna tshogs pa'i gzugs can rnam par sgeg pa kun kyang phyag rgya lnga 'chang ba thod pa'i phreng bas rnam par brgyan pa zhal gsum pa dpa' zhing sgeg pa snying rje'i ros gang ba //
analyzed: gzhan rnams ni sna tshogs pa'i gzugs can rnam par sgeg pa kun kyang phyag rgya lnga 'chang ba thod pa'i phreng bas rnam par brgyan pa zhal gsum pa dpa' zhing sgeg pa snying rje'i ros gang ba //
translated: The others have various forms, are very charming, all hold the five symbolic ornaments, are adorned with garlands of skulls, have three faces, are heroic and charming, are filled with the taste of compassion,

analyzed: brang 'phel che zhing nu ma rgas pa //

original: skal ldan ma /
analyzed: skal ldan ma /

analyzed: mchog tu dga' ba dang ldan pa // thod pa dang / kha tv'am ga dang / cang te'u bsnams shing //

analyzed: g-yas na zhags pa dang / lcags kyu 'dzin pa dang / gzhan gnyis na rdo rje gsor zhing dril bu 'khrol ba'o //
translated: hold a noose and a goad in the right hands, and with the other two hands brandish a vajra and ring a bell.

original: sku gsungs thugs su @123b byin gyis brlabs te /
analyzed: sku gsungs thugs su @123b byin gyis brlabs te /
translated: Consecrate the body, speech, and mind.

original: go cha gnyis kyis brgyan te /
analyzed: go cha gnyis kyis brgyan te /

analyzed: de nas ye shes kyi 'khor lo bkug ste dbang bskur nas mchod pa dang / bstod pa byas la bzlas pa bya'o //

original: aom shr'i badzra d'a ka a'a: hr'i: h'im d'a ka n'i dz'a la sambara h'um h'um phat sv'a h'a zhes pa mos pa'i bsam pas rtag tu spro zhing bsdu ba'i sbyor ba'i rdo rje brtul zhugs chen po dang ldan par mi g-yeng bar bzlas so /

translated: With the thought of devotion, one should always perform repetition without distraction, endowed with the great vajra conduct of the yoga of the emanation and gathering of the three syllables om aḥ hūṃ in the three places of the three vajras.

analyzed: aom shr'i buddha d'a ka a'a: bhr'um h'um d'a ki n'i dz'a la sambara hum h'um phat sv'a h'a // aom dhr'i karma d'a ka a'a: kham h'um d'a ki n'i dz'a la samba ra hum h'um phat sv'a h'a /
translated: Om śrī buddha dak aḥ bhruṃ hūṃ dakini jvala sampra hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ svāhā.🔽Om śrī karma dak aḥ khaṃ hūṃ dakini jvala sampra hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ svāhā.

original: aom shr'i padma d'a ka a'a: hr'i: h'um d'a ki n'i dz'a la samba ra hum h'um phat sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom shr'i padma d'a ka a'a: hr'i: h'um d'a ki n'i dz'a la samba ra hum h'um phat sv'a h'a /
translated: Om śrī padma dak aḥ hrīḥ hūṃ dakini jvala sampra hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ svāhā.

original: aom shr'i rtan d'a ka a'a: aom h'um d'a ki n'i dz'a la samba ra hum h'um phat sv'a h'a: aom shr'i badzra b'a r'a h'i bam hum h'um phat sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom shr'i rtan d'a ka a'a: aom h'um d'a ki n'i dz'a la samba ra hum h'um phat sv'a h'a: aom shr'i badzra b'a r'a h'i bam hum h'um phat sv'a h'a /
translated: Oṃ śrī-vajra-vārāhī vaṃ hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ svāhā.

original: de lta bur ni mkha' 'gro ma thams cad kyis sngags su yang rab tu bzlas par grags so //
analyzed: de lta bur ni mkha' 'gro ma thams cad kyis sngags su yang rab tu bzlas par grags so //
translated: Thus, all ḍākinīs are renowned for reciting the mantra.

original: 'di ni dam tshig dang sdom pa blang ste /
analyzed: 'di ni dam tshig dang sdom pa blang ste /
translated: This is the vow of the commitments and vows.

original: rdo rje dang mnyam par rab tu 'grub pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje dang mnyam par rab tu 'grub pa'o //
translated: It is the supreme accomplishment of the vajra.

original: mchog 'bring tha ma lhan cig 'gugs //
analyzed: mchog 'bring tha ma lhan cig 'gugs //
translated: The supreme, middling, and lesser are summoned together.

original: zhes pa la sogs pa ni gang dang gang zhan na gnas pa sngon du 'grub pa dam tshig dang ldan ma byin gyis rlob par dran par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa ni gang dang gang zhan na gnas pa sngon du 'grub pa dam tshig dang ldan ma byin gyis rlob par dran par bya'o //
translated: And so forth. Whatever is inferior is accomplished first. One should recall the consecration of the commitments.

original: mchog ces pa lhan cig skyes pa'o //
analyzed: mchog ces pa lhan cig skyes pa'o //
translated: The supreme is the coemergent.

original: 'bring zhes pa ni zhing skyes ma'o //
analyzed: 'bring zhes pa ni zhing skyes ma'o //
translated: The middling is the field-born.

original: tha ma zhes pa ni sngags ma'o //
analyzed: tha ma zhes pa ni sngags ma'o //
translated: The lesser is the mantra-born.

original: des bskyed pa'i rdzas gang yin pa thams cad de /
analyzed: des bskyed pa'i rdzas gang yin pa thams cad de /
translated: All substances generated by them are that.

original: des na de ltar rdzas ni rab nges yin //
analyzed: des na de ltar rdzas ni rab nges yin //
translated: Therefore, the substance is thus ascertained.

original: zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes gsungs te /
translated: It is said:

original: de ni rtsa rnams la gnas pa'i rdzas dbang po gnyis kyi sbyor ba las skyes pa thams cad do //
analyzed: de ni rtsa rnams la gnas pa'i rdzas dbang po gnyis kyi sbyor ba las skyes pa thams cad do //
translated: That is the substance located in the channels, born from the union of the two organs.

original: rkyen des bskyed pa'i bdud rtsi lnga la sogs pa chang dang khrag tu mnyam par ldan pas thod pa la dkyil 'khor gru gsum par byas pa bris par gzhag te /
analyzed: rkyen des bskyed pa'i bdud rtsi lnga la sogs pa chang dang khrag tu mnyam par ldan pas thod pa la dkyil 'khor gru gsum par byas pa bris par gzhag te /
translated: The five nectars and so forth generated by that condition, equal to the beer and blood, are placed in a skull-cup, drawn as a triangular maṇḍala.

original: steng dang byol song dang / 'og dang gnas pa rnams phyogs dang phyogs mtshams ji lta ba bzhin du bskyed de //
analyzed: steng dang byol song dang / 'og dang gnas pa rnams phyogs dang phyogs mtshams ji lta ba bzhin du bskyed de //
translated: The upper, animal, and lower, stationary, [deities] are generated in the directions and intermediate directions, just as they are.

original: de nas kha zas de rnams la ste /
analyzed: de nas kha zas de rnams la ste /
translated: Then, those foods

original: de kho na nyid gsum gyis sngags kyis btab la dam tshig gi mchog de 'thungs shing zos te /
analyzed: de kho na nyid gsum gyis sngags kyis btab la dam tshig gi mchog de 'thungs shing zos te /
translated: are empowered with the mantra of the three realities, and that supreme pledge is drunk and eaten.

original: yang dag par 'khrigs pa'i rnal 'byor ma rnams la yang phul te /
analyzed: yang dag par 'khrigs pa'i rnal 'byor ma rnams la yang phul te /
translated: It is also offered to the yoginīs who are completely aroused.

original: bla ma dang mda' bdag rdo rje 'dzin gyis gsan par dam tshig rnams la @124a * //
analyzed: bla ma dang mda' bdag rdo rje 'dzin gyis gsan par dam tshig rnams la @124a * //
translated: The guru and the vajra master should listen to the pledges.

original: 'dis gsol ba btab bo //
analyzed: 'dis gsol ba btab bo //
translated: This is the supplication.

original: bdag gis rtag tu sdom pa mang por blangs shing bskyang bar bgyi'o zhes so //
analyzed: bdag gis rtag tu sdom pa mang por blangs shing bskyang bar bgyi'o zhes so //
translated: I always take up and maintain many vows.

original: 'jig rten rtag tu g-yon gyis spyod //
analyzed: 'jig rten rtag tu g-yon gyis spyod //
translated: The world always practices with the left.

original: ces pa ni g-yon pa'i spyod par 'gro ba rnams kyi bde ba blang bar bsgrub pa'i phyir na bde ba bsrung ba'i nam mkha'i gnas la rnal 'byor chen pos 'di rnam par spyad do //
analyzed: ces pa ni g-yon pa'i spyod par 'gro ba rnams kyi bde ba blang bar bsgrub pa'i phyir na bde ba bsrung ba'i nam mkha'i gnas la rnal 'byor chen pos 'di rnam par spyad do //
translated: This is for the sake of accomplishing the taking of bliss by those who practice with the left. The great yogi practices this in the abode of the sky of protecting bliss.

original: g-yon pa dang g-yon pa'i tshogs mchog tu mdzes pa ni 'jig rten gsum gyi bdag po dang / mchog gi don thams cad gsal bar brjod cing rgyal bar mdzad pas na bde ba ster bar mdzad pa'i g-yon pa la bsnyen bkur bar bya ste /
analyzed: g-yon pa dang g-yon pa'i tshogs mchog tu mdzes pa ni 'jig rten gsum gyi bdag po dang / mchog gi don thams cad gsal bar brjod cing rgyal bar mdzad pas na bde ba ster bar mdzad pa'i g-yon pa la bsnyen bkur bar bya ste /
translated: The left and the assembly of the left are supremely beautiful. Since the lord of the three worlds and all supreme goals are declared and accomplished, one should serve the left that bestows bliss.

original: gang gi phyir rnal 'byor ba'i dge ba thams cad kyi thabs yin pa de'i gtso bor nges par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rnal 'byor ba'i dge ba thams cad kyi thabs yin pa de'i gtso bor nges par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since it is the means of all the virtue of the yogi, it becomes the principal one.

original: thams cad bskyed pa'i g-yon pa phyag rgya chen po can la mchod pa mi byed par de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la mchod pa byed pa ni yongs su nyon mongs shing de la 'bras bu mi rnyed do //
analyzed: thams cad bskyed pa'i g-yon pa phyag rgya chen po can la mchod pa mi byed par de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la mchod pa byed pa ni yongs su nyon mongs shing de la 'bras bu mi rnyed do //
translated: Those who do not worship the great seal, the left channel that gives rise to everything, but worship the tathagatas are completely defiled and will not find the result in that.

original: gang 'og dag gi gsal bas ma bkrol to /
analyzed: gang 'og dag gi gsal bas ma bkrol to /
translated: The following is not clarified.

original: brtul zhugs med kyang brtul zhugs rdzogs //
analyzed: brtul zhugs med kyang brtul zhugs rdzogs //
translated: Even without observances, there is the perfection of observances.

original: zhes pa la brtul zhugs ni phyis mi len pa la sogs pa sbyangs pa'i yon tan bcu gnyis te /🔽'di dag gis ni bskal ba du mas kyang sangs rgyas nyid du brgya lam 'ga' zhig na 'gyur la /
analyzed: zhes pa la brtul zhugs ni phyis mi len pa la sogs pa sbyangs pa'i yon tan bcu gnyis te / 'di dag gis ni bskal ba du mas kyang sangs rgyas nyid du brgya lam 'ga' zhig na 'gyur la /
translated: With regard to that, observances are the twelve qualities of training, such as not taking anything later.

original: 'dir ni de lta bu'i brtul zhugs thams cad zil gyis mnan cing bcom yang tshe 'di nyid sangs rgyas kyi de kho na nyid thob pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'dir ni de lta bu'i brtul zhugs thams cad zil gyis mnan cing bcom yang tshe 'di nyid sangs rgyas kyi de kho na nyid thob pa'i phyir te /
translated: Through these, buddhahood will occur after many eons, but here, even though all such observances are overwhelmed and destroyed, buddhahood is attained in this lifetime.

original: de'i phyir na brtul zhugs rdzogs pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir na brtul zhugs rdzogs pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Therefore, it is called the perfection of observances.

original: de bas na gang gi phyir sgrub pa pos der 'bad pa byas na 'jig rten gyi spyod pa las rnam par grol bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bas na gang gi phyir sgrub pa pos der 'bad pa byas na 'jig rten gyi spyod pa las rnam par grol bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, since the adept makes effort there, he becomes liberated from worldly conduct.

original: dam tshig ces pa ni rigs kyi tshogs 'di dag ste /
analyzed: dam tshig ces pa ni rigs kyi tshogs 'di dag ste /
translated: The pledge is this group of clans.

original: rigs drug dang rigs lnga la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rigs drug dang rigs lnga la sogs pa'o //
translated: The clans are the six clans, the five clans, and so forth.

original: sngon bzhin du 'di dag dang de bzhin du lhan cig tu spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: sngon bzhin du 'di dag dang de bzhin du lhan cig tu spyad par bya'o //
translated: As before, one should practice in union with them.

original: rigs lngar yang dag spyod ces pa ni /
analyzed: rigs lngar yang dag spyod ces pa ni /
translated: The conduct in the five clans is

original: rigs bzhi ru ni rnam par brtan //
analyzed: rigs bzhi ru ni rnam par brtan //
translated: firmly based in the four clans.

original: ces pa 'di'i rigs ni rin po che dang mi bskyod pa rnam par snang mdzad kyi bar mdor gyur ba'o //
analyzed: ces pa 'di'i rigs ni rin po che dang mi bskyod pa rnam par snang mdzad kyi bar mdor gyur ba'o //
translated: This clan is the middle one of Ratnasaṃbhava, Akṣobhya, and Vairocana.

original: rigs gcig ces pa ni gtso bo'i sems te mthar thug pa'o //
analyzed: rigs gcig ces pa ni gtso bo'i sems te mthar thug pa'o //
translated: The one clan is the principal mind, which is the ultimate.

original: des dkyil 'khor @124b ba rnams der mnyam pa'o //
analyzed: des dkyil 'khor @124b ba rnams der mnyam pa'o //
translated: By that, the maṇḍalas are equal there.

original: yang dag spyod ces pa ni rnam par mi rtogs pas yang dag par spod pa ste /
analyzed: yang dag spyod ces pa ni rnam par mi rtogs pas yang dag par spod pa ste /
translated: The conduct is the correct conduct by way of nonconceptuality.

original: tshogs pa med pa dang / yongs su gzung ma med pa dang / longs spyod pa med pas spro bar bya zing //
analyzed: tshogs pa med pa dang / yongs su gzung ma med pa dang / longs spyod pa med pas spro bar bya zing //
translated: One should delight in the five sense objects, because they are not a collection, not something to be grasped, and not something to be enjoyed.

original: 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga rnams sdig pa med par bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga rnams sdig pa med par bstan par bya'o //
translated: The five sense objects should be taught to be without sin.

original: de yang ji ltar sdig pa med par mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de yang ji ltar sdig pa med par mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: And how will they not be without sin?

original: mnyam par spyod pa'i blos ji ltar mes zas rnams thun mong du spyod pa dang / ji ltar nyi ma bltas na der thun mong du mthong ba dang / ji ltar rlung dri la thun mong du byed par ltar dam tshig kun la spyod pa ni rnam par rtog pa gti mug gi rgya mtsho ring du spong ba'o //
analyzed: mnyam par spyod pa'i blos ji ltar mes zas rnams thun mong du spyod pa dang / ji ltar nyi ma bltas na der thun mong du mthong ba dang / ji ltar rlung dri la thun mong du byed par ltar dam tshig kun la spyod pa ni rnam par rtog pa gti mug gi rgya mtsho ring du spong ba'o //
translated: Just as fire is used in common for cooking food, just as the sun is seen in common by looking at it, and just as the wind is used in common for smell, so the pledge is used in common for all, and the ocean of the conceptual thought of delusion is abandoned far away.

original: dkyil 'khor gru gsum byas zhes pa ni shva sa bskams pa'i sa nag po tsha sgo can gas pa la song nyi shu ba'i tshad la sor bcu thur du brkos pa zur gsum gyi mgo rnon po byang du bstan no //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gru gsum byas zhes pa ni shva sa bskams pa'i sa nag po tsha sgo can gas pa la song nyi shu ba'i tshad la sor bcu thur du brkos pa zur gsum gyi mgo rnon po byang du bstan no //
translated: The triangular maṇḍala is a black, hot, cracked earth, twenty finger-widths across, dug down ten finger-widths, with a sharp point facing north.

original: de dag ni me thab kyi las so //
analyzed: de dag ni me thab kyi las so //
translated: These are the activities of the hearth.

original: rdo rje dang de bzhin du gsal shing dang / 'bar ba rtse gsum dang rdo rje thob dang / gsal shing ni kha gyen du bstan te gzugs par bya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje dang de bzhin du gsal shing dang / 'bar ba rtse gsum dang rdo rje thob dang / gsal shing ni kha gyen du bstan te gzugs par bya'o //
translated: The vajra, the stake, the trident with flames, the vajra hook, and the stake should be drawn facing upward.

original: de dag gis gsang par bya zhing sdug bsngal du gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag gis gsang par bya zhing sdug bsngal du gzhug par bya'o //
translated: One should draw them in the secret place, and they should be made to suffer.

original: phyag mtshan 'di dag ni sor bzhi'i tshad du bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: phyag mtshan 'di dag ni sor bzhi'i tshad du bri bar bya'o //
translated: These hand implements should be drawn the size of four finger lengths.

original: de'i steng du sor gsum bskyed pa la kha khyer sor gsum gyi tshad kyis gru gsum du bskor zhing zheng dang dpangs su mnyam par kha phyir phyogs su bltas la bya'o //
analyzed: de'i steng du sor gsum bskyed pa la kha khyer sor gsum gyi tshad kyis gru gsum du bskor zhing zheng dang dpangs su mnyam par kha phyir phyogs su bltas la bya'o //
translated: Above that, having increased by three finger lengths, one should draw a triangle with a perimeter of three finger lengths, equal in width and height, facing outward.

original: sa nag po dri da ba dang / bong bu dang rnga mo'i sbangs dang / mi'i rus phe dang / sol phye bsres pas de la byug go //
analyzed: sa nag po dri da ba dang / bong bu dang rnga mo'i sbangs dang / mi'i rus phe dang / sol phye bsres pas de la byug go //
translated: One should smear it with black earth, cow dung, the dung of donkeys and camels, human bone ash, and charcoal powder.

original: dri nga ba'i me tog dang spos kyi mchod pa dang / tsher ma rnon po can gyi dri nga ba'i shing dang / dur khrod kyi shing dang / bong bu dang rnga mo'i sbangs bskams pas bung shing bya'o //🔽shing nim pa dang / tsandan dmar po dang / tsher ma can gyi shing ku nya tsa ka dang / tsher ma dang / 'khri shing dang / tsher ma shin tu rnon po dang / shing shin tu rnon po dang ro bsregs pa'i shing gas pa dag las sor bcu gnyis pa'i rtsa ba'i cha rnams dug dang khrag dang til mar la sbangs pa shin tu rno ba rnams yam shing du sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: dri nga ba'i me tog dang spos kyi mchod pa dang / tsher ma rnon po can gyi dri nga ba'i shing dang / dur khrod kyi shing dang / bong bu dang rnga mo'i sbangs bskams pas bung shing bya'o // shing nim pa dang / tsandan dmar po dang / tsher ma can gyi shing ku nya tsa ka dang / tsher ma dang / 'khri shing dang / tsher ma shin tu rnon po dang / shing shin tu rnon po dang ro bsregs pa'i shing gas pa dag las sor bcu gnyis pa'i rtsa ba'i cha rnams dug dang khrag dang til mar la sbangs pa shin tu rno ba rnams yam shing du sbyin par bya'o //
translated: One should offer foul-smelling flowers and incense, and also sharp thorns, foul-smelling wood, charnel ground wood, and wood that has been eaten by termites.🔽One should offer sticks made from the nimba tree, red sandalwood, the thorny kunajataka tree, thorns, vines, very sharp thorns, very sharp wood, and wood from a burned corpse. The twelve-finger-widths of the root parts, soaked in poison, blood, and oil, are very sharp and are used as kindling.

original: yungs kar dang / @125a * //
analyzed: yungs kar dang / @125a * //
translated: Mustard seeds,

original: dri dku ba can gyi til dang / khrag dang lan tshva dang / ske tshe dang / shing nim pa'i lo ma dang / dur khrod kyi thal ba dang / rkang rjes kyi rdul dang / bong bu dang / rnga mo la sogs pa'i sbangs dang /
analyzed: dri dku ba can gyi til dang / khrag dang lan tshva dang / ske tshe dang / shing nim pa'i lo ma dang / dur khrod kyi thal ba dang / rkang rjes kyi rdul dang / bong bu dang / rnga mo la sogs pa'i sbangs dang /
translated: sesame seeds with a foul smell, blood, salt, black mustard seeds, neem tree leaves, charnel ground ash, footprints, the dung of donkeys, camels, and so forth,

translated: Burn those substances in the flame of poison, blood, and the leaves of a crazy plant, and make an effigy of the evil one from the ashes, charcoal, chaff, and so forth. With a very sharp weapon, beginning from the head,

analyzed: lus kun bcad te /

original: de yang dkon mchog gsum la bsdo ba dang / dam tshig las nyams pa dang / sdang ba can dag la bya ba ni nag pos brgyan cing lcags kyi rgyan cha can gyi sngags pa gshin rje la bltas te /

translated: Further, one should do this for those who harm the Three Jewels, who violate their commitments, and who are hostile, adorned with black, the mantra practitioner looking like Yama, wearing iron ornaments.

analyzed: kho bo'i skyil mo krung gis shing khri'i stan la yang dag par gnas la mtshan phyed nyi ma phyed na bsgrub bya la bsam par bya'o //

original: re phas ni me'i dkyil 'khor te /
