translated: The unmoving is the world of the receptacle.

original: der de rnams dang bcas par ro gcig par gyur pa rdo rje 'dzin pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes so //
analyzed: der de rnams dang bcas par ro gcig par gyur pa rdo rje 'dzin pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes so //
translated: Therein, it is the identity with them, because of the state of Vajradhara.

original: yang na 'jig rten gsum zhes pa ni /
analyzed: yang na 'jig rten gsum zhes pa ni /
translated: Or else, the three worlds is

original: sku rdo rje la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sku rdo rje la sogs pa'o //
translated: the Vajra Body, etc.

original: de rnams su rgyu ba ni byang chub kyi sems rdo rje ste //
analyzed: de rnams su rgyu ba ni byang chub kyi sems rdo rje ste //
translated: The moving therein is the mind of enlightenment, the vajra,

original: bde ba 'dod pa g-yo ba'i phyir rgyu ba'o //
analyzed: bde ba 'dod pa g-yo ba'i phyir rgyu ba'o //
translated: because of the movement of the desire for bliss.

original: mi rgyu ba ni de thob pa'o //
analyzed: mi rgyu ba ni de thob pa'o //
translated: The unmoving is the attainment of that.

original: de rnams dang lhan cig 'jug ces par sbyar ro //
analyzed: de rnams dang lhan cig 'jug ces par sbyar ro //
translated: It is to be supplied: “it is the engagement with them. ”

original: su zhe na /
analyzed: su zhe na /
translated: Who is it?

original: sgrub pa po zhes pa 'di ste /
analyzed: sgrub pa po zhes pa 'di ste /
translated: The adept, this one.

original: gang yang 'dir /
analyzed: gang yang 'dir /
translated: And here,

original: sngags dang phyag rgyar yang dag ldan //
analyzed: sngags dang phyag rgyar yang dag ldan //
translated: Possessing mantra and seal,

original: sgrub pa po yi dngos grub mchog / ces pa ste /
analyzed: sgrub pa po yi dngos grub mchog / ces pa ste /
translated: the adept's supreme attainment.

original: de nas de ltar phyag rgya dang bral na byin gyis mi rlob ces pa'o //
analyzed: de nas de ltar phyag rgya dang bral na byin gyis mi rlob ces pa'o //
translated: Then, if one is separated from the seal, there is no consecration.

original: phyag rgya zhes pa ni shes rab la gsungs te /
analyzed: phyag rgya zhes pa ni shes rab la gsungs te /
translated: The seal is said to be wisdom,

original: sku gsung thugs la rgyas btab pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sku gsung thugs la rgyas btab pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it seals the body, speech, and mind.

original: de dang bral ba ni dang pa med par ci'i phyir na /
analyzed: de dang bral ba ni dang pa med par ci'i phyir na /
translated: If one is separated from that, why is there no consecration?

original: nyan thos lta bu'o //
analyzed: nyan thos lta bu'o //
translated: Like a śrāvaka.

original: de nas de'i lus sngags kyis byin gyis rlob par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas de'i lus sngags kyis byin gyis rlob par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, his body is not consecrated by mantra.

original: sngags zhos pa ni gnyis su med pa'i ye shes rdo rje 'dzin pa thob pa'i don te /
analyzed: sngags zhos pa ni gnyis su med pa'i ye shes rdo rje 'dzin pa thob pa'i don te /
translated: The mantra is the attainment of the nondual gnosis vajra holder,

original: gang gi phyir mngon du sbyar na byang chub par 'gyur ba de'i phyir yid kyi 'du byed gzhan du mi 'gyur bas brtson 'grus lhag par brtun te bya'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir mngon du sbyar na byang chub par 'gyur ba de'i phyir yid kyi 'du byed gzhan du mi 'gyur bas brtson 'grus lhag par brtun te bya'o //
translated: because when it is applied, there is enlightenment. Therefore, since the mental formation does not change, one should practice with superior diligence.

original: ji ltar dro bar bdag nyid bya //
analyzed: ji ltar dro bar bdag nyid bya //
translated: How does one make oneself warm?

original: zhes pa ni dang por ni shes rab dro bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni dang por ni shes rab dro bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: This is the initial warming of wisdom.

original: gnyis pa ni du ba lta bur 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni du ba lta bur 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The second is like smoke.

original: gsum pa la me stag lta bur 'phro ba'o //
analyzed: gsum pa la me stag lta bur 'phro ba'o //
translated: The third is like a firefly.

original: bzhi pa la mar me 'bar ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: bzhi pa la mar me 'bar ba lta bu'o //
translated: The fourth is like a burning lamp.

original: lnga pa la rtag tu shin tu snang ba ste /
analyzed: lnga pa la rtag tu shin tu snang ba ste /
translated: The fifth is like the light of the sun and moon.

original: rdul med pa'i nam mkha' lta bu'o //
analyzed: rdul med pa'i nam mkha' lta bu'o //
translated: It is like a cloudless sky.

original: 'di'i don gsal bar bshad pa /
analyzed: 'di'i don gsal bar bshad pa /
translated: The meaning of this is explained clearly.

original: cung zhig gsal bar snang ba la ni 'gro ba yin no //
analyzed: cung zhig gsal bar snang ba la ni 'gro ba yin no //
translated: When it appears a little bit clearly, it is called “going to the destination.”

original: de lta bu de nyid kyi snang ba gsal ba 'bring por 'gyur ba ni rtse mor 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta bu de nyid kyi snang ba gsal ba 'bring por 'gyur ba ni rtse mor 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When that very appearance becomes medium clarity, it is called “going to the peak.”

original: gang gi tshe de nyid shin tu gsal bar 'gyur @130b te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe de nyid shin tu gsal bar 'gyur @130b te /
translated: When it becomes very clear,

original: phyi'i don rnams shes pa nyid du snang zhing rnam par shes pa tsam la gnas te rtog pa'i dra ba las grol ba'i rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i rnam pa rgyun mi 'chad pa de ni bzod par 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyi'i don rnams shes pa nyid du snang zhing rnam par shes pa tsam la gnas te rtog pa'i dra ba las grol ba'i rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i rnam pa rgyun mi 'chad pa de ni bzod par 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
translated: the external objects appear as consciousness only, and one abides in mere consciousness. When the appearance of clear light, which is free from the net of conceptual thought, is uninterrupted, it is called “going to acceptance.”

original: de nyid ni sangs rgyas thams cad kyi chos rnams kyi mchog tu 'gyur ba'i phyir nang chos kyi mchog gi don to //
analyzed: de nyid ni sangs rgyas thams cad kyi chos rnams kyi mchog tu 'gyur ba'i phyir nang chos kyi mchog gi don to //
translated: That is the meaning of the supreme inner Dharma, because it becomes the supreme of all the dharmas of the Buddhas.

original: rnal 'byor pa la gang zhig sdang // zhes pa la sogs pa la /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa la gang zhig sdang // zhes pa la sogs pa la /
translated: As for “whoever hates the yogi,” and so forth,

original: gang zhig sdang zhes pa ni gti mug gi phyir na mi dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis kun du phyir kha thur du bltas te 'gro ba dag go //
analyzed: gang zhig sdang zhes pa ni gti mug gi phyir na mi dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis kun du phyir kha thur du bltas te 'gro ba dag go //
translated: “whoever hates” means that, due to delusion, the unvirtuous spiritual friend turns one’s back and goes down.

original: lhag ma ni go sla'o //🔽rnal 'byor che 'chang dpa' bo 'di //
analyzed: lhag ma ni go sla'o // rnal 'byor che 'chang dpa' bo 'di //
translated: The rest is easy to understand.

original: zhes pa la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa ni /
translated: “This hero who possesses great yoga” and so forth.

original: de gnas pa'i yul ni yongs su brtag pa yin pas na /
analyzed: de gnas pa'i yul ni yongs su brtag pa yin pas na /
translated: Since the place where he resides is imagined,

original: mchod par 'os pas de'i nye 'khor lta ci smos /
analyzed: mchod par 'os pas de'i nye 'khor lta ci smos /
translated: what need is there to mention his retinue?

original: de rung ni rtag par gnas //
analyzed: de rung ni rtag par gnas //
translated: “He is always present.”

original: zhes pas ni 'di shes pa'i rnal 'byor pa'i snying la zhugs so zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: zhes pas ni 'di shes pa'i rnal 'byor pa'i snying la zhugs so zhes pa'i don to //
translated: This means that he has entered the heart of the yogi who knows this.

original: 'di dag ni dpal he ru ka bde mchog gi 'grel pa sgrub thabs rnams kyi gnas zhes bya ba las le'u nyi shu rtsa dgu pa'i rnam par bshad pa'o /
analyzed: 'di dag ni dpal he ru ka bde mchog gi 'grel pa sgrub thabs rnams kyi gnas zhes bya ba las le'u nyi shu rtsa dgu pa'i rnam par bshad pa'o /
translated: This is the explanation of the twenty-ninth chapter in the tantra, called “The Presentation of the Means of Achievement,” in the commentary called “Illuminating the Meaning of the Root Tantra.”

original: // / de nas gzhan yang zhes pa ni he ru ka gzhan te /
analyzed: // / de nas gzhan yang zhes pa ni he ru ka gzhan te /
translated: Now, “and also another” is another Heruka.

original: khro bo'i rgyal po gnod mdzes kyi don 'di'o //
analyzed: khro bo'i rgyal po gnod mdzes kyi don 'di'o //
translated: This is the meaning of the wrathful king Sumbha.

original: der 'gro ba ni 'dir te /
analyzed: der 'gro ba ni 'dir te /
translated: “Going there” is here.

original: shin tu rnyed dka' spangs par zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: shin tu rnyed dka' spangs par zhes gsungs te /
translated: “Having abandoned what is very difficult to obtain,”

original: de la spangs par zhes pa ni rjod byed dang phyi mo rnams rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du ma 'dres par dgod par bya'o //
analyzed: de la spangs par zhes pa ni rjod byed dang phyi mo rnams rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du ma 'dres par dgod par bya'o //
translated: and so on. There, “having abandoned” means that the expressions and the letters should be set down in order without mixing them up.

original: sa'i cha zhes pa la sogs par 'di dag ni 'byung po thams cad la gtor ma sbyin la'o //
analyzed: sa'i cha zhes pa la sogs par 'di dag ni 'byung po thams cad la gtor ma sbyin la'o //
translated: “The part of the earth,” and so on. These are for giving the sacrificial cake to all the bhūtas.

original: bdag gi bya ba kun byas shing //
analyzed: bdag gi bya ba kun byas shing //
translated: Having done all my work,

original: zhes pa la /
analyzed: zhes pa la /
translated: and so on.

original: kun zhes pa ni sa bon yi ge h'um gi sgra yis gzugs su 'gyur bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: kun zhes pa ni sa bon yi ge h'um gi sgra yis gzugs su 'gyur bar bya ba'o //
translated: “All” means that the seed syllable hūṃ is to be transformed into the form by the sound.

original: bde ba ni dngos po med par 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: bde ba ni dngos po med par 'gyur ba ste /
translated: “Bliss” is the transformation into non-entity.

original: nam mkha' dang mnyam pa'i gzhi'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' dang mnyam pa'i gzhi'o //
translated: The basis is equal to space.

original: de nas go chas bcing bar byas la thams cad mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid du shes par bya ste /
analyzed: de nas go chas bcing bar byas la thams cad mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid du shes par bya ste /
translated: Then, having bound on the armor, one should know the non-apprehension of everything as emptiness.

original: rdza rnga bcing bar bya'o //
analyzed: rdza rnga bcing bar bya'o //
translated: One should beat the drum.

original: de la mu ram dzam zhes pa ni rdza rnga ste /
analyzed: de la mu ram dzam zhes pa ni rdza rnga ste /
translated: There, the drum is the drum.

original: yi ge gsum po ni /
analyzed: yi ge gsum po ni /
translated: The three syllables

original: sku gsum du mi phyed pa yin la /
analyzed: sku gsum du mi phyed pa yin la /
translated: are the indivisibility of the three bodies.

original: zlum po ni rlung gi ngo bo'o //
analyzed: zlum po ni rlung gi ngo bo'o //
translated: The roundness is the nature of the wind.

original: ri mo brgyad kyis mnyam pa'i bzhi po dbus su ri mo gcig gzhug pa dang / dgu ru 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ri mo brgyad kyis mnyam pa'i bzhi po dbus su ri mo gcig gzhug pa dang / dgu ru 'gyur ro //
translated: The eight lines are the four equalities. In the middle, one should insert one line, making nine.

original: stong pa nyid kyi dngos po dri ma med pa'i a'a li dang k'a li rnams @131a * //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi dngos po dri ma med pa'i a'a li dang k'a li rnams @131a * //
translated: The entities of emptiness are the stainless vowels and consonants.

original: mnyam par so sor dgod par bya'o //
analyzed: mnyam par so sor dgod par bya'o //
translated: One should arrange them equally, individually.

original: dga' ba bzhi las 'byung ba'i chos gzhom du med pa ni rdza rnga'o //
analyzed: dga' ba bzhi las 'byung ba'i chos gzhom du med pa ni rdza rnga'o //
translated: The drum is the indestructible Dharma that arises from the four joys.

original: der yi ges yongs su bkang ba ni dam pa'i chos gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis so //
analyzed: der yi ges yongs su bkang ba ni dam pa'i chos gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis so //
translated: The filling of it with syllables is the true Dharma of the twelve branches of scripture.

original: de dag gi grangs kyi bar bar nas btu ba ni chos bdag med pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gi grangs kyi bar bar nas btu ba ni chos bdag med pa'o //
translated: The extraction of them in between the numbers is the selflessness of phenomena.

original: zhal bzhir gsungs pa ni bdud bzhi rnam par bcad pa'o //
analyzed: zhal bzhir gsungs pa ni bdud bzhi rnam par bcad pa'o //
translated: The four faces are said to be the elimination of the four demons.

original: sngags kyi gzugs rnams bzlas pa'i dus na rnam par 'phro ba dang bsdu ba ni rlung la mnyam du zhon pas khams gsum ma lus pa rlung gi de kho na nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sngags kyi gzugs rnams bzlas pa'i dus na rnam par 'phro ba dang bsdu ba ni rlung la mnyam du zhon pas khams gsum ma lus pa rlung gi de kho na nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: The emanation and gathering of the forms of the mantras at the time of recitation are to be known as the reality of the wind, the entire three realms, by mounting together on the wind.

original: rim bzhin 'byung dang rim min pas //
analyzed: rim bzhin 'byung dang rim min pas //
translated: In order, and not in order,

original: zhes pa ni rim pa bzhin dang rim pa bzhin ma yin pa'i a'a li k'a li las yang dag par byung brjod par byed pa'i yi ge rnams te /
analyzed: zhes pa ni rim pa bzhin dang rim pa bzhin ma yin pa'i a'a li k'a li las yang dag par byung brjod par byed pa'i yi ge rnams te /
translated: the letters that are the correct origin of the ālikāli, in order and not in order, are the letters that express.

original: de ni sgra brnyan lta bur bstan pa'i phyir ro //🔽re mig sum cu rtsa gsum gyi //
analyzed: de ni sgra brnyan lta bur bstan pa'i phyir ro // re mig sum cu rtsa gsum gyi //
translated: This is because they are taught to be like an echo.🔽Take the third square

original: re mig las ni gsum pa blang //
analyzed: re mig las ni gsum pa blang //
translated: from the thirty-third square.

original: zhes pa la sogs pa ni ji lta ba bzhin du gsal bas na dkyus nyid las bla mas smras pa tsam gyis so //🔽aom sum bha ni sum bha hum h'um phat /
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa ni ji lta ba bzhin du gsal bas na dkyus nyid las bla mas smras pa tsam gyis so // aom sum bha ni sum bha hum h'um phat /
translated: Since this and so forth are clear just as they are, the master should just say it from the manual.🔽Oṃ sumbha niḥ sumbha hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ

original: aom gri han gri han hum h'um phat /
analyzed: aom gri han gri han hum h'um phat /
translated: Oṃ gṛhṇa gṛhṇa hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ

original: aom gri han'a pa ya gri han'a pa ya hum h'um phat /
analyzed: aom gri han'a pa ya gri han'a pa ya hum h'um phat /
translated: Oṃ, crush, crush, hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ.

original: aom a'a na ya ho: bha ga b'ana badzra h'um h'um phat /
analyzed: aom a'a na ya ho: bha ga b'ana badzra h'um h'um phat /
translated: Oṃ, come, come, O Lord, the Blessed Vajra, hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ.

original: de dag ni 'jig rten gsum las rnam par rgyal ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de dag ni 'jig rten gsum las rnam par rgyal ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: These are called the “conquest over the three worlds.”

original: sngags kyi phreng ba bzhi po des ni dkyil 'khor gyi don du gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: sngags kyi phreng ba bzhi po des ni dkyil 'khor gyi don du gsungs pa ste /
translated: The four mantra strings are taught for the sake of the maṇḍala.

original: gdug pa thams cad rnam par gnon pa'o //
analyzed: gdug pa thams cad rnam par gnon pa'o //
translated: They are the subjugation of all evildoers.

original: khro bo bzhi dang yang dag ldan //
analyzed: khro bo bzhi dang yang dag ldan //
translated: Endowed with the four wrathful ones,

original: skad cig gis ni sku brgyad 'gyur //
analyzed: skad cig gis ni sku brgyad 'gyur //
translated: in an instant there are eight bodies.

original: zhes pa 'di ni /
analyzed: zhes pa 'di ni /
translated: This means

original: sngags kyi phreng ba re re las sku shin tu 'jigs pa gnyis gnyis skad cig gis spros pas bgegs thams cad rnam par 'joms pa la bya'o //
analyzed: sngags kyi phreng ba re re las sku shin tu 'jigs pa gnyis gnyis skad cig gis spros pas bgegs thams cad rnam par 'joms pa la bya'o //
translated: that from each mantra string two extremely terrifying bodies are emanated in an instant, which is said to be the total destruction of all obstructors.

original: de'i rim pa yang 'khor lo chen po phyi rol gyi mthar thug pa rnams na khva gdong ma la sogs pa brgyad po rnams zhal gcig phyag gnyis pa gri gug dang thod pa 'dzin ma /
analyzed: de'i rim pa yang 'khor lo chen po phyi rol gyi mthar thug pa rnams na khva gdong ma la sogs pa brgyad po rnams zhal gcig phyag gnyis pa gri gug dang thod pa 'dzin ma /
translated: The procedure is as follows. At the outer limit of the great wheel, the eight beginning with Kālarātri have one face and two hands holding a flaying knife and skull cup.

original: kha dog dmar 'od 'bar ba spyan gsum ma //
analyzed: kha dog dmar 'od 'bar ba spyan gsum ma //
translated: She has three eyes and blazes with a red light.

original: drag mo 'jigs par byed ma /🔽dar la bab pa'i cha byad can /
analyzed: drag mo 'jigs par byed ma / dar la bab pa'i cha byad can /
translated: She is fierce and terrifying.🔽She is in the prime of youth.

original: mdzes ma zhal rnam par 'gyur ba stag gi pags pa'i smad g-yogs can /
analyzed: mdzes ma zhal rnam par 'gyur ba stag gi pags pa'i smad g-yogs can /
translated: She is beautiful, with a contorted face, and wears a tiger-skin skirt.

original: sku smad gsal shing lta bur 'bar ba rnon po 'jig pa'i dus kyi me ltar mnyam par 'bar ba'i 'od zer @131b dang ldan par bzhugs pa /
analyzed: sku smad gsal shing lta bur 'bar ba rnon po 'jig pa'i dus kyi me ltar mnyam par 'bar ba'i 'od zer @131b dang ldan par bzhugs pa /
translated: Her lower body blazes like a stake, with a light that burns like the fire at the time of the destruction of the world.🔽She should be visualized as pressing down on the hosts of all the obstructors in the eight directions, with her waist just below the surface of the earth.

original: phyogs brgyad kyi bgegs thams cad kyi tshogs la rked pa nub tsam du sngags gzhan gyis khro bo'i phur pa rnams rim pa bzhin dang / rim pa bzhin ma yin par btab ste gzir bar bya'o //
analyzed: phyogs brgyad kyi bgegs thams cad kyi tshogs la rked pa nub tsam du sngags gzhan gyis khro bo'i phur pa rnams rim pa bzhin dang / rim pa bzhin ma yin par btab ste gzir bar bya'o //
translated: She should be visualized as striking them with the daggers of the wrathful ones, with the other mantras, in and not in sequence.

original: sngags ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: sngags ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The mantras are as follows:

original: aom gha gha gh'a ta ya gh'a ta ya sarba dusht'am h'um phat /
analyzed: aom gha gha gh'a ta ya gh'a ta ya sarba dusht'am h'um phat /
translated: Oṃ gha gha ghatāya ghatāya sarva duṣṭān hūṃ phaṭ.

original: k'i la ya k'i la ya sarba p'a pam h'um phat h'um h'um badzra k'i la ya badzra dha ra a'a dzny'a pa ya ti k'a ya b'a ktsitta badzra k'i la ya h'um phat ces pas gzir ro //
analyzed: k'i la ya k'i la ya sarba p'a pam h'um phat h'um h'um badzra k'i la ya badzra dha ra a'a dzny'a pa ya ti k'a ya b'a ktsitta badzra k'i la ya h'um phat ces pas gzir ro //
translated: kailāya kailāya sarvapāpaṃ hūṃ phaṭ hūṃ hūṃ vajrakilāya vajradhara ājñāpayati kāyavākcittavajrakilāya hūṃ phaṭ.🔽With this, one should frighten them.

original: de rdo rje tho bas brdung ba ni khro bo'i lta stangs kyis bltas la brdung ba'i sngags ni //
analyzed: de rdo rje tho bas brdung ba ni khro bo'i lta stangs kyis bltas la brdung ba'i sngags ni //
translated: Then, with the gaze of wrath, one should strike them with the vajra hammer, and the mantra for striking is:

original: aom badzra munggar badzra k'i la ya a'a ko ta ya h'um phat ces so //
analyzed: aom badzra munggar badzra k'i la ya a'a ko ta ya h'um phat ces so //
translated: oṃ vajra-muṃ vajrakilāya ākoṭaya hūṃ phaṭ.

original: de 'debs par byed pa'i khro bo'i 'khor lo'i rtsibs rnams la gnas pa rnams kyi so //
analyzed: de 'debs par byed pa'i khro bo'i 'khor lo'i rtsibs rnams la gnas pa rnams kyi so //
translated: The retinue of wrathful ones who reside on the spokes of the wheel that throws them,

original: de dag gi mtshan yang /
analyzed: de dag gi mtshan yang /
translated: their names are:

original: rdo rje gtum po dang ni rdo rje nyi ma me //
analyzed: rdo rje gtum po dang ni rdo rje nyi ma me //
translated: Vajra Caṇḍa, Vajra Sun Fire,🔽Vajra Uṣṇīṣa, Vajra Noose, Vajra Yakṣa, Vajra Blue,

original: rdo rje gtsug tor dang ni rdo re 'khyil pa dang // rdo rje gnod sbyin dang ni rdo rje sngon po dang // rdo rje stobs po che dang de bzhin du //
analyzed: rdo rje gtsug tor dang ni rdo re 'khyil pa dang // rdo rje gnod sbyin dang ni rdo rje sngon po dang // rdo rje stobs po che dang de bzhin du //
translated: Vajra Mahābala, and likewise,

original: rdo rje 'jigs byed nyid ni brgyad pa ste //
analyzed: rdo rje 'jigs byed nyid ni brgyad pa ste //
translated: Vajra Bhairava is the eighth.

original: steng na gtsug tor 'khor los sgyur ba nyid //
analyzed: steng na gtsug tor 'khor los sgyur ba nyid //

original: 'og tu gnod mdzes zhes byar rab tu grags //
analyzed: 'og tu gnod mdzes zhes byar rab tu grags //

original: sdug bsngal kun 'byung 'gog pa lam nyid dang // zad dang mi skyo chos dang rjes shes dang // kun rdzob nyid dang yongs su shes pa dang // ye shes bcu po 'di dag rnam dag pa'i //
analyzed: sdug bsngal kun 'byung 'gog pa lam nyid dang // zad dang mi skyo chos dang rjes shes dang // kun rdzob nyid dang yongs su shes pa dang // ye shes bcu po 'di dag rnam dag pa'i //

original: khro bo bcu po de nas spro bar bya'o //
analyzed: khro bo bcu po de nas spro bar bya'o //
translated: should then be emanated as the ten wrathful ones.

original: rdo rje sems dpa' yongs su zhu ba las //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' yongs su zhu ba las //

original: bdag nyid rdo rje h'um mdzad nyid du bskyed //
analyzed: bdag nyid rdo rje h'um mdzad nyid du bskyed //
translated: one should generate oneself as Vajra-Hūṃkara.🔽Great blue, with great majesty,

original: sngon po chen po brjid pa chen po dang // de nyid mche ba gtsigs pa 'jigs par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: sngon po chen po brjid pa chen po dang // de nyid mche ba gtsigs pa 'jigs par mdzad pa'o //

original: g-yas dang g-yas min zhal ni sngo dang ljang //
analyzed: g-yas dang g-yas min zhal ni sngo dang ljang //
translated: The right and left faces are blue and green,🔽the three faces in sequence with the manner of a hero,

analyzed: zhal gsum rim pa bzhin du dpa' tshul dang // smre ba'i tshul dang gdangs nas ljags 'dril ba'o //

original: smin ma shin tu khro gnyer lta bu dang // spyan gsum zlum zhing shin tu dmar pa dang // khro bo 'jigs pa 'bar bas 'khrigs pa ste //
analyzed: smin ma shin tu khro gnyer lta bu dang // spyan gsum zlum zhing shin tu dmar pa dang // khro bo 'jigs pa 'bar bas 'khrigs pa ste //
translated: With a wrathful, terrifying, blazing form,

original: rdo rje h'um mdzad h'um nyid mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje h'um mdzad h'um nyid mdzad pa'o //
translated: Vajra Hūṃkāra makes the sound hūṃ.

original: mi rus rgyan gyis brgyan par mdzad pa ste //
analyzed: mi rus rgyan gyis brgyan par mdzad pa ste //
translated: He is adorned with ornaments of human bone,

original: mi yi mgo bo'i phreng ba'i do shal can /
analyzed: mi yi mgo bo'i phreng ba'i do shal can /
translated: With a necklace of human heads.

original: sangs rgyas lnga rnams 'byung zhing 'phro ba'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas lnga rnams 'byung zhing 'phro ba'o //
translated: The five buddhas emerge and radiate

original: phyag gnyis rdo rje dang ni dril bu 'dzin //
analyzed: phyag gnyis rdo rje dang ni dril bu 'dzin //
translated: From his two hands holding vajra and bell.

original: 'jig rten gsum rgyal phyag rgya bcing mdzad pa'i //🔽gnyis @132a * //
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum rgyal phyag rgya bcing mdzad pa'i // gnyis @132a * //
translated: He binds the mudrā of Trilokavijaya,

original: po shes rab snyoms par 'jug pa ste //
analyzed: po shes rab snyoms par 'jug pa ste //
translated: With the two in union with wisdom.🔽The remaining hands hold a hook, a noose,

original: lhag ma'i phyag gis lcags kyu zhags pa dang // kha tv'am ga dang thod pa ral gri 'dzin //
analyzed: lhag ma'i phyag gis lcags kyu zhags pa dang // kha tv'am ga dang thod pa ral gri 'dzin //
translated: A khaṭvāṅga, a skull cup, and a sword.

original: g-yas brkyang ba yi gnas pas yang dag bzhugs //
analyzed: g-yas brkyang ba yi gnas pas yang dag bzhugs //
translated: He stands with his right leg straight,

original: 'jigs byed dus mtshan zhabs mthil gyis gnon mdzad //
analyzed: 'jigs byed dus mtshan zhabs mthil gyis gnon mdzad //
translated: Treading on Bhairava and Kālarātri with his two feet.

original: de la shar gyi rtsibs la rdo rje gtum po sngon po dang / g-yas dang g-yon gyi zhal ni ser po dang ljang gu'o //
analyzed: de la shar gyi rtsibs la rdo rje gtum po sngon po dang / g-yas dang g-yon gyi zhal ni ser po dang ljang gu'o //
translated: On the eastern spoke is blue Vajra Caṇḍa, with a yellow face to the right and a green face to the left.

original: g-yas kyi phyag na rdo rje tho ba bsnams shing rdo rje sdigs mdzub mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: g-yas kyi phyag na rdo rje tho ba bsnams shing rdo rje sdigs mdzub mdzad pa'o //
translated: He holds a vajra and a hammer in his right hands and makes a threatening gesture with a vajra.

original: g-yon na ni thod pa dang kha tv'am ga'o //
analyzed: g-yon na ni thod pa dang kha tv'am ga'o //
translated: In the left hands he holds a skull cup and a khaṭvāṅga.

original: phyag gnyis kyis ni rang lta bu'i shes rab ma la 'khyud pa'o //🔽byang du ni nyi ma me ltar 'bar ba ser po /
analyzed: phyag gnyis kyis ni rang lta bu'i shes rab ma la 'khyud pa'o // byang du ni nyi ma me ltar 'bar ba ser po /
translated: With two hands he embraces a wisdom consort similar to himself.

original: g-yas dang g-yon pa dag ni sngon po dang ljang gu'o //
analyzed: g-yas dang g-yon pa dag ni sngon po dang ljang gu'o //
translated: In the north is yellow Sūryya-jvalana, with a blue face to the right and a green face to the left.

original: rang dang 'dra ba'i shes rab ma la 'khyud pa dang / rdo rje dbyig pa dang / thod pa dang / kha tv'am ga 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: rang dang 'dra ba'i shes rab ma la 'khyud pa dang / rdo rje dbyig pa dang / thod pa dang / kha tv'am ga 'dzin pa'o //
translated: He embraces a wisdom consort similar to himself, holding a vajra club, a skull cup, and a khaṭvāṅga.

analyzed: nub tu ni rdo rje gtsug tor dmar po rang dang 'dra ba'i shes rab ma la 'khyud pa /
translated: In the west is red Vajra-uṣṇīṣa, embracing a wisdom consort similar to himself.

original: g-yas pa dang g-yon pa ni dkar po dang ljang gu'o //
analyzed: g-yas pa dang g-yon pa ni dkar po dang ljang gu'o //
translated: He has a white face to the right and a green face to the left.

original: padma dmar po dang / thod pa dang / kha tv'am ga 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: padma dmar po dang / thod pa dang / kha tv'am ga 'dzin pa'o //
translated: He holds a red lotus, a skull, and a khaṭvāṅga.

original: lhor ni bdud rtsi 'khyil pa ljang gu /
analyzed: lhor ni bdud rtsi 'khyil pa ljang gu /
translated: In the south is green Amṛtakuṇḍali,

original: rang dang 'dra ba'i shes rab ma la 'khyud pa /
analyzed: rang dang 'dra ba'i shes rab ma la 'khyud pa /
translated: embracing a wisdom consort similar to himself.

original: g-yas dang g-yon pa'i zhal ni ser po dang / dkar po'o //
analyzed: g-yas dang g-yon pa'i zhal ni ser po dang / dkar po'o //
translated: His right and left faces are yellow and white.

original: sna tshogs rdo rje dang / thod pa dang / kha tv'am ga 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: sna tshogs rdo rje dang / thod pa dang / kha tv'am ga 'dzin pa'o //
translated: He holds a vajra cross, a skull, and a khaṭvāṅga.

original: mer ni rdo rje gnod sbyin dud kha rang dang 'dra ba'i shes rab ma la 'khyud pa /
analyzed: mer ni rdo rje gnod sbyin dud kha rang dang 'dra ba'i shes rab ma la 'khyud pa /
translated: In the southeast is smoky Vajrayakṣa, embracing a wisdom consort similar to himself.

original: g-yon dang g-yas pa ser po dang / ljang gu 'gying bag can /
analyzed: g-yon dang g-yas pa ser po dang / ljang gu 'gying bag can /
translated: His left and right faces are yellow and green, and he is in a mood of passion.

original: lcags kyu dang / thod pa dang / kha tv'am ga 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: lcags kyu dang / thod pa dang / kha tv'am ga 'dzin pa'o //
translated: He holds a goad, a skull, and a khaṭvāṅga.

original: bden bral du rdo rje dus byed dmar po //
analyzed: bden bral du rdo rje dus byed dmar po //
translated: In the southwest is red Vajrāci,

original: g-yas dang g-yon pa dag ni ser po dang / ljang gu ste /
analyzed: g-yas dang g-yon pa dag ni ser po dang / ljang gu ste /
translated: his right and left faces yellow and green.

original: rang dang 'dra ba'i shes rab ma la 'khyud pa dang / dgra sta dang thod pa dang kha tv'am ga 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: rang dang 'dra ba'i shes rab ma la 'khyud pa dang / dgra sta dang thod pa dang kha tv'am ga 'dzin pa'o //
translated: He embraces a wisdom consort similar to himself and holds an axe, a skull, and a khaṭvāṅga.

original: rlung gi mtshams su rdo rje stobs po che sngon po /
analyzed: rlung gi mtshams su rdo rje stobs po che sngon po /
translated: At the wind direction is blue Vajra-Mahābala,

original: g-yas dang g-yon pa ni ser po dang ljang gu'o //
analyzed: g-yas dang g-yon pa ni ser po dang ljang gu'o //
translated: with right and left [faces] yellow and green.

original: rang dang 'dra ba'i shes rab ma la snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rtse gsum pa dang / kha tv'am ga dang thod pa 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: rang dang 'dra ba'i shes rab ma la snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rtse gsum pa dang / kha tv'am ga dang thod pa 'dzin pa'o //
translated: He is in union with a knowledge-woman like himself, holding a trident, khaṭvāṅga, and skull-cup.

original: dbang ldan du rdo rje 'jigs par byed pa sngon po mi g-yo ba g-yas dang g-yon pa ser po dang ljang gu'i kha dog can rang lta bu'i shes rab ma la 'khyud pa /
analyzed: dbang ldan du rdo rje 'jigs par byed pa sngon po mi g-yo ba g-yas dang g-yon pa ser po dang ljang gu'i kha dog can rang lta bu'i shes rab ma la 'khyud pa /
translated: At the northeast corner is blue Vajra-Bhairava, with right and left [faces] yellow and green, embracing a knowledge-woman like himself.

original: @132b ral gri dang thod pa dang kha tv'am ga 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: @132b ral gri dang thod pa dang kha tv'am ga 'dzin pa'o //
translated: He holds a sword, skull-cup, and khaṭvāṅga.

original: steng du ni gtsug tor 'khor los sgyur ba dkar po ste /
analyzed: steng du ni gtsug tor 'khor los sgyur ba dkar po ste /
translated: Above is white Uṣṇīṣa-cakravartin,

original: g-yas dang g-yon pa dag ni sngon po dang ljang gu rang lta bu'i shes rab ma la 'khyud pa 'khor lo dang / thod pa dang / kha tv'am ga 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: g-yas dang g-yon pa dag ni sngon po dang ljang gu rang lta bu'i shes rab ma la 'khyud pa 'khor lo dang / thod pa dang / kha tv'am ga 'dzin pa'o //
translated: with right and left [faces] blue and green, embracing a knowledge-woman like himself, holding a chakram, skull-cup, and khaṭvāṅga.

original: 'og tu ni rdo rje gnod mdzes sngon po dang / g-yas dang g-yon pa dag ni ser po dang ljang gu /
analyzed: 'og tu ni rdo rje gnod mdzes sngon po dang / g-yas dang g-yon pa dag ni ser po dang ljang gu /
translated: and to his right and left are yellow and green [figures].

original: rang lta bu'i shes rab ma la 'khyud pa /
analyzed: rang lta bu'i shes rab ma la 'khyud pa /
translated: He embraces a wisdom-woman similar to himself.

original: rdo rje gsal shing dang / g-yon na chags pa'i zhags pa dang / sdigs mdzub can no //
analyzed: rdo rje gsal shing dang / g-yon na chags pa'i zhags pa dang / sdigs mdzub can no //
translated: He holds a vajra-stake and a noose of passion in his left hand, and he makes a threatening gesture with his right.

original: khro bo thams cad kyang sna tshogs rdo rje dang / chu skyes dang / nyi ma dang / sum brtsegs kyi dbus na gnas pas 'jig rten skyong ba brgyad po rim pa ltar g-yas brkyang bas gdan du gzir te /
analyzed: khro bo thams cad kyang sna tshogs rdo rje dang / chu skyes dang / nyi ma dang / sum brtsegs kyi dbus na gnas pas 'jig rten skyong ba brgyad po rim pa ltar g-yas brkyang bas gdan du gzir te /
translated: All the wrathful ones stand in the midst of a variegated vajra, a lotus, a sun, and a triple-mountain abode, trampling on the eight directional guardians with their right legs extended.🔽Thus:

original: 'di ltar / lus ngan mig dang gshin rje dang // de bzhin chu bdag nor sbyin dang // me dang bden bral rlung lha dang // dbang ldan nyid de lha rnams so //
analyzed: 'di ltar / lus ngan mig dang gshin rje dang // de bzhin chu bdag nor sbyin dang // me dang bden bral rlung lha dang // dbang ldan nyid de lha rnams so //
translated: Dhritarashtra, Virûpâksha, and likewise Vaisrâvana, Kubera, Agni, Nirriti, Vâyu, and Içvara are the gods.

original: steng du ni tshangs pa'i mdun na 'don gyi lha rnams dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: steng du ni tshangs pa'i mdun na 'don gyi lha rnams dang bcas pa'o //
translated: Above are the gods of Brahma's retinue.

original: 'og tu thags bzangs ris te /
analyzed: 'og tu thags bzangs ris te /
translated: Below is Vemacitrin.

original: de rnams kyi snying ga rnams su gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi snying ga rnams su gnas par bya'o //
translated: They should be visualized in their hearts.

original: dgong lugs ni rim pa bzhin dang / rim bzhin ma yin par te /
analyzed: dgong lugs ni rim pa bzhin dang / rim bzhin ma yin par te /
translated: The way they stand is in sequence and not in sequence.

original: khro bo thams cad dbu skra dmar ser ro //
analyzed: khro bo thams cad dbu skra dmar ser ro //
translated: All the wrathful ones have orange hair.

original: de dag kyang smin ma'i khro gnyer bsnyer zhing rnam par 'gyur ba can no //
analyzed: de dag kyang smin ma'i khro gnyer bsnyer zhing rnam par 'gyur ba can no //
translated: They have scowling wrathful eyebrows and contorted faces.

original: lus thung zhing gsus pa ldir ba /
analyzed: lus thung zhing gsus pa ldir ba /
translated: They have short bodies and protruding bellies.

original: dmar zhing zlum pa'i spyan gsum pa //
analyzed: dmar zhing zlum pa'i spyan gsum pa //
translated: They have three eyes, red and round.

original: mgo'i phreng ba'i do shal byas pa /
analyzed: mgo'i phreng ba'i do shal byas pa /
translated: They wear garlands of heads.

original: mi'i rus pa'i rgyan gyis brgyan pa /
analyzed: mi'i rus pa'i rgyan gyis brgyan pa /
translated: They are adorned with human bone ornaments.

original: sbrul nag po mtha' yas kyi thod can dang / mdangs dmar po 'jog pos ni rna ba'i 'dab mar shin tu dkris pa'i gdengs ka can /
analyzed: sbrul nag po mtha' yas kyi thod can dang / mdangs dmar po 'jog pos ni rna ba'i 'dab mar shin tu dkris pa'i gdengs ka can /
translated: Ananta, the black snake, is on their head, and Takṣaka, the red snake, is on their ear, with a hood fully wrapped around it.

original: padma chen po dkar pos do shal du brgyan par byas pa /🔽stobs kyi rgyu ljang gus ni mchod phyir thogs shing 'chang ba /🔽dung skyong ser pos ni gdu bur byas pa /
analyzed: padma chen po dkar pos do shal du brgyan par byas pa / stobs kyi rgyu ljang gus ni mchod phyir thogs shing 'chang ba / dung skyong ser pos ni gdu bur byas pa /
translated: Mahāpadma, the white snake, is made into a necklace.🔽Vāsuki, the green snake, is made into an armlet and worn.🔽Śaṅkhapāla, the yellow snake, is made into a bracelet.

original: sna tshogs pa'i mdog gi rigs ldan gyi dpung rgyan gyis yang dag par mdzes pa /
analyzed: sna tshogs pa'i mdog gi rigs ldan gyi dpung rgyan gyis yang dag par mdzes pa /
translated: The multicolored Kulika snake is a beautiful armlet.

original: nor rgyas padma dkar po'i mdog can gyis rnam par mdzes pa'i ska rags can /
analyzed: nor rgyas padma dkar po'i mdog can gyis rnam par mdzes pa'i ska rags can /
translated: The one called “Vasudhara” is adorned with a beautiful belt, and is the color of a white lotus.

original: padma'i rtsa ba ltar skye ba'i padmas ni rkang gdub byas pa'o //
analyzed: padma'i rtsa ba ltar skye ba'i padmas ni rkang gdub byas pa'o //
translated: The one called “Padmodbhava” has lotus feet.

original: de rnams kyang skad cig gis sku gsung thugs la brgyan par byas @133a * //
analyzed: de rnams kyang skad cig gis sku gsung thugs la brgyan par byas @133a * //
translated: They are all instantly adorned with the body, speech, and mind ornaments.

original: la // skad cig gis sku gsung thugs la byang chub sems kyis bkrus te /
analyzed: la // skad cig gis sku gsung thugs la byang chub sems kyis bkrus te /
translated: Instantly, the body, speech, and mind are washed with bodhicitta.

original: rang gi rigs rnams dbu rgyan du gsal bar bya'o //
analyzed: rang gi rigs rnams dbu rgyan du gsal bar bya'o //
translated: One should visualize one’s own family as the crown ornament.

original: rang rang gi lus las rdo rje 'bar ba 'khrigs pa 'jigs par spros te /
analyzed: rang rang gi lus las rdo rje 'bar ba 'khrigs pa 'jigs par spros te /
translated: From one’s own body, one should emanate terrifying, blazing vajras.

original: nam mkha'i dkyil 'khor bkang bas phyogs bcu'i mthar thug par khro bo 'bar bas dkrigs shing 'khrigs par bya'o //
analyzed: nam mkha'i dkyil 'khor bkang bas phyogs bcu'i mthar thug par khro bo 'bar bas dkrigs shing 'khrigs par bya'o //
translated: Filling the realm of space, one should fill the ends of the ten directions with blazing wrath.

original: de nyid rig pa dag gis bka'i 'khor lo de g-yon du myur du 'khor bar bya zhing lha la brten pa'i sems kyis gdod nas dag pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa lta bur bgegs med par 'gyur zhing 'di thos pa tsam gyis gdug pa thams cad 'chi bar byed
analyzed: de nyid rig pa dag gis bka'i 'khor lo de g-yon du myur du 'khor bar bya zhing lha la brten pa'i sems kyis gdod nas dag pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa lta bur bgegs med par 'gyur zhing 'di thos pa tsam gyis gdug pa thams cad 'chi bar byed
translated: Those who know reality should quickly turn the wheel to the left with the mind of the deity, and without obstacles, like the originally pure Tathagata, all evildoers will die merely by hearing this.

original: par nges so //
analyzed: par nges so //
translated: The wheel of the Command is quickly turned to the left by those who know reality, and by the mind that is based on the deity, one becomes free of obstacles, like the originally pure Tathagata, and by merely hearing this, all evildoers are certainly killed.

original: nyon mongs pa'i gdug pa can yang 'jigs par byed do //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i gdug pa can yang 'jigs par byed do //
translated: The evildoers of the afflictions are also frightened.

original: gang dag 'ga' zhig 'di las 'da' bar gyur ba de'i tshe dum bur chad par the tshom mi za ba'o //🔽dpal rdo rje h'um mdzad kyi 'khor lo'i rnal 'byor gyis bdag nyid rdza rngas bdud rnams dbye ba'i las rnams phye ba dngos grub kun gyi 'bras bu skyed par byed pa zhes pa'o //
analyzed: gang dag 'ga' zhig 'di las 'da' bar gyur ba de'i tshe dum bur chad par the tshom mi za ba'o // dpal rdo rje h'um mdzad kyi 'khor lo'i rnal 'byor gyis bdag nyid rdza rngas bdud rnams dbye ba'i las rnams phye ba dngos grub kun gyi 'bras bu skyed par byed pa zhes pa'o //
translated: When someone transgresses this, there is no doubt that he will be cut to pieces.🔽The wheel yoga of glorious Vajra Humkara, the drum-beating self, the work of dividing the demons, the fruit of all powers, is the producer.

original: 'di dag ni dpal he ru ka bde mchog gi 'grel pa sgrub thabs rnams kyi gnas zhes bya ba las le'u sum cu pa'i rnam par bshad pa'o /
analyzed: 'di dag ni dpal he ru ka bde mchog gi 'grel pa sgrub thabs rnams kyi gnas zhes bya ba las le'u sum cu pa'i rnam par bshad pa'o /
translated: This is the explanation of the thirtieth chapter in the commentary called “The Stage of the Means of Achieving the Yoga of the Glorious Chatuhpitha,” which is the first part of the Means of Achievement Called “Source of All Powers.”

original: // / de nas sha chen zhes pa la sogs pa ni zhe sdang la sogs pa thams cad do /
analyzed: // / de nas sha chen zhes pa la sogs pa ni zhe sdang la sogs pa thams cad do /
translated: Now, “great flesh” and so forth are all the hatreds and so forth.

original: de rnams kyi sel byed ni dam tshig rnams te mthu dang ldan pa'i phyir na'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi sel byed ni dam tshig rnams te mthu dang ldan pa'i phyir na'o //
translated: The “removers” of those are the commitments, because they are powerful.

original: de dag gis ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de dag gis ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: rdo rje skyes zhes pa gsungs pa la /
analyzed: rdo rje skyes zhes pa gsungs pa la /
translated: It is said, “born from the vajra.”

original: rdo rje ni mi phyed pa'i ye shes te /
analyzed: rdo rje ni mi phyed pa'i ye shes te /
translated: The vajra is the indivisible intuition.

original: de ltar skyes pas na rdo rje 'dzin pa'i sku ste /
analyzed: de ltar skyes pas na rdo rje 'dzin pa'i sku ste /
translated: Since he is born from that, he is the body of the vajra-holder.

original: de nas zhes pa ni de rnams kyis te /
analyzed: de nas zhes pa ni de rnams kyis te /
translated: “Then” is by those.

original: zhe sdang la sogs pa'i gdug pa thams cad rnam par 'joms pa mi bzad pa'o //
analyzed: zhe sdang la sogs pa'i gdug pa thams cad rnam par 'joms pa mi bzad pa'o //
translated: “All the fierce ones” are all the fierce ones such as hatred and so forth.🔽“The destroyer” is the one who destroys them.

original: de gang gis she na /
analyzed: de gang gis she na /
translated: By what?

original: rdo rje skya ba nye bar rdzogs pas so //
analyzed: rdo rje skya ba nye bar rdzogs pas so //
translated: By the completion of the vajra-born one.

original: de bzhin khyi dang zhes pa la sogs pa rnams ni de lta bu'o //
analyzed: de bzhin khyi dang zhes pa la sogs pa rnams ni de lta bu'o //
translated: “Likewise, dogs” and so forth are like that.

original: bza' dang sbyin sreg ces pa la de bza' ba yang yin la sbyin sreg kyang yin pas bza' ba dang sbyin sreg ste /
analyzed: bza' dang sbyin sreg ces pa la de bza' ba yang yin la sbyin sreg kyang yin pas bza' ba dang sbyin sreg ste /
translated: “Food and fire sacrifice” are both food and fire sacrifice, so they are food and fire sacrifice.

original: gtor ma'i bya ba rnams su bya ba'o //
analyzed: gtor ma'i bya ba rnams su bya ba'o //
translated: They are to be done in the rites of the sacrificial cakes.

original: mngon spyod ces pa 'di ni rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba nyid kyi phyir na /
analyzed: mngon spyod ces pa 'di ni rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba nyid kyi phyir na /
translated: Since this direct action is naturally luminous,

original: de rnams kyi sha kha na ma tho ba med pa rnyed na @133b rdo rje rnal 'byor pas gtor ma la sogs par bya ste /
analyzed: de rnams kyi sha kha na ma tho ba med pa rnyed na @133b rdo rje rnal 'byor pas gtor ma la sogs par bya ste /
translated: the vajra yogin should offer the meat of those who have died a natural death in the bali offering, and so forth.

original: gzhan dag ni sems can rnams la gnod pa'i phyir na spang ngo //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni sems can rnams la gnod pa'i phyir na spang ngo //
translated: The others should be abandoned because they harm sentient beings.

original: de ltar yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ltar yang gsungs pa /
translated: Thus it is said:

original: sngags pas sems can gnod byed pa //
analyzed: sngags pas sems can gnod byed pa //
translated: The mantrin who harms sentient beings

original: phyag rgya'i dngos grub mi thob po //
analyzed: phyag rgya'i dngos grub mi thob po //
translated: does not attain the power of the seal.

original: zhes so // de'i thab khung ni rnam par rtog pa med pa'i sems ni thab khung du grags so //
analyzed: zhes so // de'i thab khung ni rnam par rtog pa med pa'i sems ni thab khung du grags so //
translated: The hearth is the mind free from discursive thought, known as the hearth.

original: me ni gnyen po'i me rab tu 'bar ba'o //
analyzed: me ni gnyen po'i me rab tu 'bar ba'o //
translated: The fire is the blazing fire of the antidotes.

original: der yang bsregs pa ni s'a lu skyes kyi stobs te rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: der yang bsregs pa ni s'a lu skyes kyi stobs te rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: There, the burnt offering is the power of the rice-born, that is, discursive thought.

original: gang cung zad skyo bo rnams smod par byed pa'i srog chags thams cad kyi yan lag las byung ba rnams dang / sna tshogs pa'i chang dag bza' zhing btung bar bya'o //
analyzed: gang cung zad skyo bo rnams smod par byed pa'i srog chags thams cad kyi yan lag las byung ba rnams dang / sna tshogs pa'i chang dag bza' zhing btung bar bya'o //
translated: One should eat and drink the various wines that arise from the limbs of all living beings, even those that are a little emaciated and are disparaged.

original: ma lus zhes pa ni khams gsum na yod do cog go //
analyzed: ma lus zhes pa ni khams gsum na yod do cog go //
translated: The phrase without exception means all that exist in the three realms.

original: lus pa med par grub ces pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyis de dang de las gsungs pa'i dngos grub lus pa med par 'grub ces pa'i don to //
analyzed: lus pa med par grub ces pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyis de dang de las gsungs pa'i dngos grub lus pa med par 'grub ces pa'i don to //
translated: The phrase accomplishment without exception means that all the accomplishments taught by the Blessed One in this and that tantra are accomplished.

original: rgyal srid thams cad ces pa ni rdo rje 'dzin pa nyid do //🔽dung dang nya phyis mu tig rnams //
analyzed: rgyal srid thams cad ces pa ni rdo rje 'dzin pa nyid do // dung dang nya phyis mu tig rnams //
translated: The phrase all kingdoms means the state of a vajra holder.

original: zhes pa la sogs pa dang // gsum char rgyu las byung ba yin //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa dang // gsum char rgyu las byung ba yin //
translated: The phrase conch, oyster, and pearl and so forth, and all three arise from a cause,

original: zhes pa la /
analyzed: zhes pa la /
translated: is explained as follows.

original: rgyu zhes pa ni mi dge ba'i las rnams so //
analyzed: rgyu zhes pa ni mi dge ba'i las rnams so //
translated: The phrase cause means nonvirtuous actions.

original: 'byung ba zhes pa ni de las byung ba ste 'gro ba rigs drug rnams so //
analyzed: 'byung ba zhes pa ni de las byung ba ste 'gro ba rigs drug rnams so //
translated: The phrase arising means that which arises from that, the six kinds of beings.

original: de rnams kyi nang nas bsod nams chen pos skyes pa'i mi'i 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi nang nas bsod nams chen pos skyes pa'i mi'i 'gro ba'o //
translated: Among them, the human rebirth that arises from great merit is the best.

original: de lta bu 'dis na chos kyi sku'i lus can gyi thod pa la ni su zhig smod de /
analyzed: de lta bu 'dis na chos kyi sku'i lus can gyi thod pa la ni su zhig smod de /
translated: Therefore, who would disparage the skull of one who has the body of the dharma body?

original: smad par mi bya'o zhes pa'i don te /
analyzed: smad par mi bya'o zhes pa'i don te /
translated: The meaning is that it should not be disparaged.

original: dge ba'i las kyis bskyed pa'i 'bras bu ni ma yin pa'i phyir na shin tu dka' ste /
analyzed: dge ba'i las kyis bskyed pa'i 'bras bu ni ma yin pa'i phyir na shin tu dka' ste /
translated: because it is not the result produced by virtuous karma, it is very difficult.

original: bsod nams kyi tshogs chen po las 'byung bas na'o //
analyzed: bsod nams kyi tshogs chen po las 'byung bas na'o //
translated: Because it arises from a great accumulation of merit.

original: ci'i phyir na mi'i skye ba mchog ce na //
analyzed: ci'i phyir na mi'i skye ba mchog ce na //
translated: Why is human birth supreme?

original: ye shes dang thar pa'i don rab tu bsgrub pa'i gnas yin pas na chos kyi sku'i lus can gyi thod pa la lha dang mi rnams la gzugs mdzes pa'i yon tan gyi gzhi po de la bsngags so //
analyzed: ye shes dang thar pa'i don rab tu bsgrub pa'i gnas yin pas na chos kyi sku'i lus can gyi thod pa la lha dang mi rnams la gzugs mdzes pa'i yon tan gyi gzhi po de la bsngags so //
translated: Because it is the basis for accomplishing the purpose of wisdom and liberation, the skull of one who has the body of the Dharma body is praised as the basis for the quality of a beautiful form for gods and humans.

original: de nas shin tu sna tshogs pa'i phyag rgya lnga po ni mi rus kyi phreng bar shin tu nges te /
analyzed: de nas shin tu sna tshogs pa'i phyag rgya lnga po ni mi rus kyi phreng bar shin tu nges te /
translated: Then, the five extremely varied mudras are definitely a human bone garland.

original: shin tu dag pa'i rgyan rnams bzang pos dpa' bo rnam par mdzes par bshad do //
analyzed: shin tu dag pa'i rgyan rnams bzang pos dpa' bo rnam par mdzes par bshad do //
translated: The ornaments of complete purity are explained as the excellent adornments of the hero.

original: brda zhes pa ni brda ste /
analyzed: brda zhes pa ni brda ste /
translated: The word sign means a sign.

original: sangs rgyas kyi phyag rgyas dpa' bo rnams kyi lag pa g-yon pa 'di sangs rgyas lnga'i gzugs dang / @134a * //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi phyag rgyas dpa' bo rnams kyi lag pa g-yon pa 'di sangs rgyas lnga'i gzugs dang / @134a * //
translated: This left hand of the heroes with the mudra of the Buddha is the form of the five buddhas,

original: 'byung ba lnga'i bdag nyid dang / sna tshogs pa'i brtan pa dang g-yo ba'i 'gro ba ma lus pa ni rtsa lnga'i rang bzhin gyis ji ltar bde ba'i bdag nyid du bskyed do //
analyzed: 'byung ba lnga'i bdag nyid dang / sna tshogs pa'i brtan pa dang g-yo ba'i 'gro ba ma lus pa ni rtsa lnga'i rang bzhin gyis ji ltar bde ba'i bdag nyid du bskyed do //
translated: The nature of the five elements and all the various moving and unmoving beings are generated as the nature of bliss by the nature of the five nāḍīs.

original: de lta bus mngon par byang chub par 'byung ba'i theg pa'i don mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta bus mngon par byang chub par 'byung ba'i theg pa'i don mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In that way, one will see the meaning of the vehicle of the arising of manifest enlightenment.

original: g-yon pa zhes pa ni shes rab ste rang bzhin med par kun rdzob ma 'di ni yongs su rig par byed pa'i thabs kyi mtshan nyid dang gnyis su med pa chos rnams kyi de bzhin nyid de /
analyzed: g-yon pa zhes pa ni shes rab ste rang bzhin med par kun rdzob ma 'di ni yongs su rig par byed pa'i thabs kyi mtshan nyid dang gnyis su med pa chos rnams kyi de bzhin nyid de /
translated: “The left” is wisdom, the emptiness of inherent nature. This is the suchness of phenomena, which is the method of complete knowledge, the characteristic of nonduality.

original: dpal he ru ka rdo rje phag mo dang gnyis su med pa'i bde ba rdzogs par byang chub pa'i dkyil 'khor la mngon du phyogs te mnyam par bltas na thams cad mgu bar yang dag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dpal he ru ka rdo rje phag mo dang gnyis su med pa'i bde ba rdzogs par byang chub pa'i dkyil 'khor la mngon du phyogs te mnyam par bltas na thams cad mgu bar yang dag par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one gazes with equipoise, facing the maṇḍala of the perfect enlightenment of the bliss of Śrī Heruka nondual with Vajravārāhī, one will please everyone.

original: de'i tshe slob dpon rang nyid dpal dang ldan pa'i rdo rje 'chang sangs rgyas kyi yab chen po ste /
analyzed: de'i tshe slob dpon rang nyid dpal dang ldan pa'i rdo rje 'chang sangs rgyas kyi yab chen po ste /
translated: At that time, the teacher himself is the glorious Vajradhara, the great father of the Buddhas.

original: lag pa g-yon la rigs drug po rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du bkod do //
analyzed: lag pa g-yon la rigs drug po rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du bkod do //
translated: He places the six clans in the left hand in the same order.

original: a'a li k'a li mnyam par byas pa las sde tshan rnams kyi grangs las rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du bzlas brjod bya'o //
analyzed: a'a li k'a li mnyam par byas pa las sde tshan rnams kyi grangs las rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du bzlas brjod bya'o //
translated: Having equalized the vowels and consonants, one should recite the number of the groups in the same order.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: sdong por rdo rje sems dpa' bzhugs //🔽zhes pa la /
analyzed: sdong por rdo rje sems dpa' bzhugs // zhes pa la /
translated: Vajrasattva resides in the trunk.

original: sdong po zhes pa ni mthe bong ngo //
analyzed: sdong po zhes pa ni mthe bong ngo //
translated: Here, the trunk is the thumb.

original: lcug mar rnam par snang mdzad bzhugs //🔽zhes pa la /
analyzed: lcug mar rnam par snang mdzad bzhugs // zhes pa la /
translated: Vairocana resides in the twig.

original: lcug ma zhes pa ni mdzub mo'o //
analyzed: lcug ma zhes pa ni mdzub mo'o //
translated: Here, the twig is the index finger.

original: bla mar padma gar dbang bzhugs //🔽zhes pa la /
analyzed: bla mar padma gar dbang bzhugs // zhes pa la /
translated: Padmanarteshvara resides in the top.

original: bla ma zhes pa ni gung mo ring po'o //
analyzed: bla ma zhes pa ni gung mo ring po'o //
translated: Here, the top is the long middle finger.

original: rgyun la dngos grub thams cad ni //🔽zhes pa la /
analyzed: rgyun la dngos grub thams cad ni // zhes pa la /
translated: All powers are in the stream.

original: rgyun ni srin lag go //
analyzed: rgyun ni srin lag go //
translated: The stream is the ring finger.

original: mtha' ma la ni mkha' snying po //🔽zhes pa la /
analyzed: mtha' ma la ni mkha' snying po // zhes pa la /
translated: Akashagarbha is in the end.

original: mtha' zhes pa ni mthe'u chung ngo //
analyzed: mtha' zhes pa ni mthe'u chung ngo //
translated: Here, the end is the little finger.

original: rdo rje sems dpa' zhes pa ni go sla'o //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' zhes pa ni go sla'o //
translated: The term Vajrasattva is easy to understand.

original: dpa' bo zhes pa ni mi bskyod pa'o //🔽gang dang gang la gnas pa'i sngags kyi yi ge de dang des rigs kyi ming gis bos la /🔽de'i rnal 'byor byin la rab tu gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: dpa' bo zhes pa ni mi bskyod pa'o // gang dang gang la gnas pa'i sngags kyi yi ge de dang des rigs kyi ming gis bos la / de'i rnal 'byor byin la rab tu gnas par bya'o //
translated: The term hero is Akshobhya.

original: de yang 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de yang 'di lta ste /
translated: The mantra syllables that are located in any particular place should be addressed by name with the name of the family, and the yoga of that [syllable] should be conferred and well-established.

original: kye dpal che ge mo rdo rje de bzhin gshegs pa zhes so //
analyzed: kye dpal che ge mo rdo rje de bzhin gshegs pa zhes so //
translated: And that is as follows: Oh, so-and-so, the glorious vajra tathagata.

original: de la yang rigs kyi rim pa bzhin du'o //
analyzed: de la yang rigs kyi rim pa bzhin du'o //
translated: And that is also according to the sequence of the families.

original: aa a'a ka tsa ta ta pa ya sha zhes pa'i sde tshan gyi yi ge de rnams ni rnam par snang mdzad rgyal po'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: aa a'a ka tsa ta ta pa ya sha zhes pa'i sde tshan gyi yi ge de rnams ni rnam par snang mdzad rgyal po'i bdag nyid do //
translated: The syllables of the class beginning with a, a, ka, ca, ta, ta, pa, ya, and sha are the nature of Vairochana, the king.

original: ai a'i kha tsha tha tha pha ra sha sde tshan gnyis pa 'di dag ni rin chen rgyal po'o //
analyzed: ai a'i kha tsha tha tha pha ra sha sde tshan gnyis pa 'di dag ni rin chen rgyal po'o //
translated: The two classes beginning with i, i, kha, tha, dha, pha, ra, and sha are Ratnasambhava, the king.

original: au a'u @134b ga dza da da pa la sa zhes pa sde tshan gyi gsum pa de rnams ni 'od dpag tu med pa'i'o //
analyzed: au a'u @134b ga dza da da pa la sa zhes pa sde tshan gyi gsum pa de rnams ni 'od dpag tu med pa'i'o //
translated: The three classes beginning with u, u, ga, ja, da, da, ba, la, and sha are Amitabha.

original: ae aee gha dzha dha dha bha wa ha zhes sde tshan rnams kyi bzhi pa 'di rnams ni don yod grub pa'i'o //
analyzed: ae aee gha dzha dha dha bha wa ha zhes sde tshan rnams kyi bzhi pa 'di rnams ni don yod grub pa'i'o //
translated: The fourth of the classes, beginning with ai, ai, gha, jha, dha, dha, bha, va, ha, are of Amoghasiddhi.

original: ao aoo aam aa: nga nya na ma zhes pa sde tshan rnams kyi lnga pa 'di rnams ni mi bskyod pa'i'o //
analyzed: ao aoo aam aa: nga nya na ma zhes pa sde tshan rnams kyi lnga pa 'di rnams ni mi bskyod pa'i'o //
translated: The fifth of the classes, beginning with au, au, aṃ, aḥ, ña, ṇa, ma, are of Akshobhya.

original: de lta bu ni 'jig rten thams cad kyi zad pa dang skye bar gnas so //
analyzed: de lta bu ni 'jig rten thams cad kyi zad pa dang skye bar gnas so //
translated: Thus, he abides in the destruction and origination of the entire world.

original: de'i phyir na sangs rgyas thams cad kyi bdag por sbyor bas rdo rje zhes pa ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir na sangs rgyas thams cad kyi bdag por sbyor bas rdo rje zhes pa ste /
translated: Therefore, he is called Vajra, because he is applied as the lord of all the Buddhas.

original: rim pa ji lta bar rigs drug pa rdo rje sems dpa' bdag po cod pan te /
analyzed: rim pa ji lta bar rigs drug pa rdo rje sems dpa' bdag po cod pan te /
translated: In due order, the six families are the lords of the crown, the Vajrasattva,

original: rgyu yis 'bras bu la rgyas btab pa dang / 'bras bus rgyu la rgyas gdab pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu yis 'bras bu la rgyas btab pa dang / 'bras bus rgyu la rgyas gdab pa'o //
translated: the seal of the effect on the cause, and the seal of the cause on the effect.

original: de la bzhad pa'i rdo rje zhes pa dang / rnam par sgeg pa'i rdo rje zhes pa dang / rdo rje bsgyings pa zhes pa dang / rdo rje rol pa zhes pa ni rnam par snang mdzad kyi rigs kyi ming rnams so //
analyzed: de la bzhad pa'i rdo rje zhes pa dang / rnam par sgeg pa'i rdo rje zhes pa dang / rdo rje bsgyings pa zhes pa dang / rdo rje rol pa zhes pa ni rnam par snang mdzad kyi rigs kyi ming rnams so //
translated: Among them, the names of the family of Vairocana are: Vajra-smile, Vajra-play, Vajra-dance, Vajra-song, Vajra-adorning, and Vajra-incense.

original: bde ba'i myu gu rdo rje zhes pa dang / rdo rje padmo zhes pa dang / padmo'i myu gu rdo rje zhes pa dang / rdo rje rol pa zhes pa ni rin po che'i rigs kyi ming rnams so //🔽rdo rje ye shes zhes pa dang / rdo rje yid bzhin nor bu zhes pa dang / yan lag med pa'i rdo rje zhes pa dang / snang byed rdo rje zhes pa ni padma'i rigs can gyi ming rnams so //
analyzed: bde ba'i myu gu rdo rje zhes pa dang / rdo rje padmo zhes pa dang / padmo'i myu gu rdo rje zhes pa dang / rdo rje rol pa zhes pa ni rin po che'i rigs kyi ming rnams so // rdo rje ye shes zhes pa dang / rdo rje yid bzhin nor bu zhes pa dang / yan lag med pa'i rdo rje zhes pa dang / snang byed rdo rje zhes pa ni padma'i rigs can gyi ming rnams so //
translated: The names of the jewel lineage are: Vajra-sprout, Vajra-lotus, Lotus-sprout-vajra, and Vajra-sport.🔽The names of the lotus lineage are: Vajra-gnosis, Vajra-wish-granting gem, Vajra-without-limbs, and Vajra-illuminator.

original: rdo rje shes rab myu gu zhes pa dang / rdo rje snying rje myu gu zhes pa dang / rdo rje mchog tu dga' ba zhes pa dang / rdo rje dga' ba de zhes pa dang / rdo rje 'bebs pa zhes pa ni las kyi rigs can gyi ming rnams so //
analyzed: rdo rje shes rab myu gu zhes pa dang / rdo rje snying rje myu gu zhes pa dang / rdo rje mchog tu dga' ba zhes pa dang / rdo rje dga' ba de zhes pa dang / rdo rje 'bebs pa zhes pa ni las kyi rigs can gyi ming rnams so //
translated: The names of the action lineage are: Vajra-sprout-of-wisdom, Vajra-sprout-of-compassion, Vajra-supreme-joy, Vajra-joy, and Vajra-descent.

original: rdo rje bde ba chen po zhes pa dang / rdo rje chags pa zhes pa dang / nam mkha' rdo rje zhes pa dang / shes rab rdo rje zhes pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa'i rdo rje zhes pa ni /
analyzed: rdo rje bde ba chen po zhes pa dang / rdo rje chags pa zhes pa dang / nam mkha' rdo rje zhes pa dang / shes rab rdo rje zhes pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa'i rdo rje zhes pa ni /
translated: Vajra of great bliss,🔽Vajra of passion,🔽Vajra of space,🔽Vajra of wisdom,🔽Vajra of the perfections.🔽

original: zhe sdang gi rigs can rnams kyi ming ste /
analyzed: zhe sdang gi rigs can rnams kyi ming ste /
translated: Vajra Great Bliss, Vajra Passion, Vajra Space, Vajra Wisdom, and Vajra Perfection are the names of those of the Vajra family who are of the nature of anger.

original: gya nom snang ba la sogs par rab tu gnas pa na phyag rgya chen por grub pa rnams kyi ming du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gya nom snang ba la sogs par rab tu gnas pa na phyag rgya chen por grub pa rnams kyi ming du 'gyur ro //
translated: When they are well established in the Splendid Vision and so forth, they become the names of those who have achieved the Great Seal.

original: de bzhin du phyag rgya chen po grub pa po rnams kyi ming yang 'gyur te /🔽rdo rje snying po ma zhes pa dang / rdo rje mtshon cha ma zhes pa dang / rdo rje ae ma'o bde ba ma zhes pa dang / rdo rje bdag med ma zhes pa dang / rdo rje spyan ma zhes pa dang / ming de rnams ni rnam par snang mdzad kyi rigs can ma rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du phyag rgya chen po grub pa po rnams kyi ming yang 'gyur te / rdo rje snying po ma zhes pa dang / rdo rje mtshon cha ma zhes pa dang / rdo rje ae ma'o bde ba ma zhes pa dang / rdo rje bdag med ma zhes pa dang / rdo rje spyan ma zhes pa dang / ming de rnams ni rnam par snang mdzad kyi rigs can ma rnams kyi'o //
translated: Similarly, the names of those who have achieved the Great Seal are also given.🔽Vajra Essence, Vajra Weapon, Vajra Amazing Bliss, Vajra Nairatmya, and Vajra Locana are the names of those of the Vajra family who are of the nature of anger.

original: rdo rje @135a * //
analyzed: rdo rje @135a * //
translated: Vajra

original: mkha' 'gro ma zhes bya ba dang / rdo rje sor mo zhes bya ba dang / rdo rje phreng ba ma zhes bya ba dang / rdo rje mgu ma zhes pa ni rin po che'i rigs can ma'i ming rnams so //🔽rdo rje shugs ldan ma zhes pa dang / rdo rje lcags kyu ma zhes pa dang / rdo rje phreng skor ma zhes pa dang / rdo rje phreng ba ma zhes pa dang / rdo rje bzhad mo zhes pa ni padmo'i rigs can ma'i ming rnams so //
analyzed: mkha' 'gro ma zhes bya ba dang / rdo rje sor mo zhes bya ba dang / rdo rje phreng ba ma zhes bya ba dang / rdo rje mgu ma zhes pa ni rin po che'i rigs can ma'i ming rnams so // rdo rje shugs ldan ma zhes pa dang / rdo rje lcags kyu ma zhes pa dang / rdo rje phreng skor ma zhes pa dang / rdo rje phreng ba ma zhes pa dang / rdo rje bzhad mo zhes pa ni padmo'i rigs can ma'i ming rnams so //
translated: The names of those belonging to the Jewel Family are: Vajra-finger, Vajra-garland, Vajra-joy, and Vajra-dakini.🔽The names of those belonging to the Lotus Family are: Vajra-speed, Vajra-hook, Vajra-garland-turner, Vajra-garland, and Vajra-laughter.

original: rdo rje bsdams ma zhes pa dang / rdo rje kha rgyas ma zhes pa dang / rdo rje padma ma zhes pa dang / rdo rje gsal byed ma zhes pa dang / rdo rje lus ldan ma zhes pa ni las kyi rigs can ma'i ming rnams so //

translated: Having visualized the wheel of glorious Heruka facing straight ahead from the heart, one should perform the homa one hundred and eight times with the essence mantra.

analyzed: te / dpal he ru ka rdo rje phag mo dang mkha' 'gro ma bye ba'i 'khor dang bcas pas bskor bar blta zhing //

translated: One should see oneself surrounded by a retinue of a hundred million of those who are very laughing, greatly laughing, and roaring like hyenas, and by the ten direction protectors who are making the sounds of “Kill!” and “Go!” and by those who are roaring like rakshasas, and one should meditate with unwavering, undivided diligence.

original: lho phyogs su sgrub pa po'i grogs mchog phyag na rdo rje'i cha byad can dril bu'i sgra 'khrol zhing bdug spes rgyun mi 'chad par bdug par byed pa'o //

translated: In the south, the supreme friend of the adept, in the form of Vajrapāṇi, rings a bell and continuously fumigates with incense.

analyzed: de nas ro de langs nas ci bgyi ci bgyi zhes smra bar byed do // des de la mchod yon byin te /

analyzed: 'di skad ces smra'o //

analyzed: legs so legs so dpa' chen gyi //

analyzed: shin tu brtul zhugs rdo rje'i thugs //

original: de yang 'di skad smra ste //
analyzed: de yang 'di skad smra ste //
translated: ” He also says this:

original: nga ni grub pa'o zhes so //
analyzed: nga ni grub pa'o zhes so //

original: de la 'di skad smras te /🔽bdag la dngos grub bkra shis pa //
analyzed: de la 'di skad smras te / bdag la dngos grub bkra shis pa //

analyzed: grub par rab tu stsal du gsol //

analyzed: zhes so // de nas sgrub pa po yid la gang 'dod pa cig byin nas rang gi gnas su srin po dpa' bo 'khor dang bcas par 'gro bar 'gyur ro //

original: sgrub pa po dpal dang ldan zhing de'i skad cig la 'jig rten gsum po zhes pa can du 'gyur zhing lus bzang por 'gro ba dang / 'dod pa'i gzugs can dpa' bo chen por skal ba dang ldan pa ste //

analyzed: khams gsum na de bzhin gshegs pa lta bur 'gyur zhing //

analyzed: rga she dang bral ba nam mkha' lta bur 'gyur ba dang / sa thams cad la ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du rnam par spyod par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: lci ba'i thal ba nyid dag dang / de bzhin lhag ma mgo bo skam //

analyzed: zhes pa 'di dag gis ni bskyed pa'i rim pa'i gzhi yang dag par gsungs pa'o //

analyzed: de dag gi don ni 'di ltar shes par bya ste //

analyzed: lci ba zhes pa'i sgra ni sa'o //

original: thal ba zhas pa ni chu'o //
analyzed: thal ba zhas pa ni chu'o //

original: mgo bo skam zhes pa ni me'o //
analyzed: mgo bo skam zhes pa ni me'o //

analyzed: de'i don ni ri rab ri'i rgyal po la bya'o //

original: de la 'di'i rim pa ni yi ge yam yongs su zhu ba las rlung gi dkyil 'khor gzhu lta bu rgyal mtshan gyis mtshan pa yi ge yam yig gis byin gyis brlabs pa ste /

original: de yi rngams kyi tshad nyid kyang //
analyzed: de yi rngams kyi tshad nyid kyang //

analyzed: sa ya dang ni drug 'bum mo //

analyzed: rgya ru grangs med rlung dkyil 'khor //

analyzed: de'i steng du yi ge ram gyis me'i dkyil 'khor dam pa ste /

analyzed: de yi chu yi tshad nyid ni //

analyzed: lhag ma ni gser ro //

analyzed: mtha' skor du sum 'gyur ro //

original: de yang 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de yang 'di lta ste /

analyzed: gser gyi sa gzhir 'gyur ba'o //

analyzed: sna tshogs rdo rje de'i lte bar yi ge sum las byung ba'i ri rab zur bzhi pa /

analyzed: dpag tshad brgyad khri mtshor nub cing //

analyzed: zhu ba las byang sgra mi snyan dbyibs gru bzhi rgyar ni dpag tshad stong phrag bcu'o //

analyzed: 'di rnams kyi shar dang lho dang nub dang byang gi bar mtshams rnams su gnyis gnyis te /

analyzed: gling re re la'ang gling phran lnga brgya lnga brgyas bskor bar bya'o //

analyzed: de'i steng du yi ge re pha yongs su zhu ba las nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor ro //

analyzed: de'i steng du yi ge h'um de nyid yongs su zhu ba las rdo rje'o //

analyzed: de'i lte ba'i yi ge h'um gis rdo rje'i phur bu dang ra ba bsam zhing //

analyzed: rdo rje h'um mdzad yongs su zhu ba las kun du bzang pos gsum mi phyed pa'i bdag nyid can gyi chos kyi 'byung gnas dkar po gru gsum gyen du gnas pa mtha' yas pa nang gi nam mkha'i rang bzhin can der padma dmar po la 'khor lo dang
translated: Vajra Hūṃkara completely melts and becomes a white source of phenomena with the nature of the indivisibility of the three—Akṣobhya, Samantabhadra, and the three vajras—standing upright, limitless, and with the nature of the inner space of the sky.

analyzed: yi ge bh'um gnas pa yongs su zhu ba las /

analyzed: g-yon na dril bu thod pa kha tv'am ga dang bcas pa 'dzin pa /

analyzed: de yang rin po che sna lnga las byung ba'i rang bzhin can bzang po gru bzhi pa la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa /

analyzed: sgo nga las skye ba'i rim pa'o //

analyzed: dngos grub kyi don 'ba' zhig tu bsam par bya'o //

original: 'di dag ni dpal he ru ka bde mchog gi 'grel pa sgrub thabs rnams kyi gnas zhes bya ba las le'u sum cu rtsa gnyis pa'i rnam par bshad pa'o /

analyzed: // / de nas zhes pa la sogs pas ni 'di ltar thams cad du shes par bya ste /

analyzed: bsod nams kyi tshogs chen po mkha' gro ma dra ba'i sdom pa di yin pas so //

analyzed: de'i dbus su a'a li dang k'a li la ye shes lnga'i rang bzhin yi ge h'um gis byin gyis brlabs pa'o //

translated: Bam is the union with the nature of Vajrasattva, who is peaceful and compassionate, the color of an autumn sky, radiating many garlands of light, and stainless like the rays of the moon.

analyzed: bdud bzhi zhabs kyis mnan pa phag mo dang gnyis su med pa'i bde ba chen po gzi brjid chen po dang ldan pa //

original: lcang lo sngon po can no //
analyzed: lcang lo sngon po can no //

analyzed: zla ba'i steng na mi shigs pa'i shing aa ta sha'i me tog ltar sngon po las pa'i 'o ma'i rgyun ltar nyen mtshan du 'dzag pa'o //
translated: On the moon is a blue drop, like an indestructible drop, the color of an atisha flower, dripping with nectar like a stream of milk.

analyzed: 'og gi gnas gang yin pa ni padma zla ba'i 'od zer gyis brgyan pa can /

original: lte ba'i dkyil du me dang rlung gi dbus su bsam par bya ste /
analyzed: lte ba'i dkyil du me dang rlung gi dbus su bsam par bya ste /
translated: In the center of the navel, in the middle of fire and wind, one should imagine the drop.

analyzed: gzhan yang lus med par blta zhing yid kyis rab tu zhi bar blta'o //
translated: Moreover, one should visualize the body as nonexistent, and visualize the mind as peaceful.

translated: If one wishes to prolong one's life, one should visualize a snake in the form of a great hood with three hoods, beautified by a drop in the middle of the head, on the earth mandala in the head, with the path syllables.

analyzed: // pa dang / mig dag tu dgod par bya ba'i bdud rtsi'i yi ge ai bsam par bshad de //
translated: It is explained that one should visualize the syllable ai of nectar in the eyes.

analyzed: mig nyid zla ba dang kunda lta bur dkar ba'i dngos po dbang po'i gzhu lta bus rnam par brgyan pa'o //
translated: The eyes themselves are white like the moon and jasmine, and are adorned with a sense organ like a rainbow.

original: steng du ni gdug lta bu'i sprin dang / glog ljang gu //
analyzed: steng du ni gdug lta bu'i sprin dang / glog ljang gu //
translated: Above, one should visualize a cloud like a snake, and green lightning.

analyzed: 'brug sgras nam mkha' khyab par bsam zhing bdud rtsi zhu ba char pa lta bu'i rgyun gyis zhi bar bya'o //
translated: One should imagine that the sky is filled with the sound of thunder, and one should pacify with a stream of nectar like rain.

analyzed: de yang grong gi dbus su bsgrub bya bsams pa'i steng du nges par bzhag pas dug bsreg pa dang / rims la sogs pa bsams pa tsam gyis nges par 'joms pa'o //
translated: If one visualizes a fever, etc., he will be definitely destroyed by merely thinking [of him].

original: de nyid rtag par gang zhig gis dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su gnas pa'i rjod byed de dag bsams na de'i tshe zad pa'ang tshe ring po nyid du 'gro'o //
analyzed: de nyid rtag par gang zhig gis dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su gnas pa'i rjod byed de dag bsams na de'i tshe zad pa'ang tshe ring po nyid du 'gro'o //
translated: If one who always recites those [mantras] while staying in the middle of the maṇḍala visualizes [the victim], then even one who is exhausted will go to a long life.

original: lo gcig rab tu sbyor ba byas na /
analyzed: lo gcig rab tu sbyor ba byas na /
translated: If one performs the practice for one year,

analyzed: rgas pa med cing 'chi ba med pa dang / de'i nad rnams gnon cing med par byed do //
translated: he will be without old age and without death, and his diseases will be suppressed and eliminated.

analyzed: klu chen po brgyad rnams kyis de'i tshe zos pa'am //
translated: The eight great nāgas will at that time eat [him].

original: dug chen po'ang bsams pa tsam gyis dug med par byed cing //
analyzed: dug chen po'ang bsams pa tsam gyis dug med par byed cing //
translated: Even great poison will be rendered poisonless by merely thinking [of him].

original: dug gis brgyal ba bdag ldang bar byed do //
analyzed: dug gis brgyal ba bdag ldang bar byed do //
translated: One who is unconscious from poison will be made to rise up by himself.

original: bdag nyid kyi 'chi ba 'ang gzhan du 'gro bar 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi 'chi ba 'ang gzhan du 'gro bar 'gyur zhing //
translated: One's own death will also go elsewhere.

original: nad las kyang rnam par grol lo //
analyzed: nad las kyang rnam par grol lo //
translated: One will be liberated from disease.

analyzed: ston ka'i dus kyi zla ba lta bu'i lag pa g-yon pa'i mtheb snying la yi ge bam gyis ri bong 'dzin gyi gzugs rdzogs par bya ste /
translated: The moon of autumn, the left hand, with the thumb and the heart, is the form of the rabbit-holder, the letter vaṃ.

original: lce'u chung rtse mor mnan pa'i bdud rtsi dang / ham gi rim pas mi 'chi ba bza' bar bya'o //
analyzed: lce'u chung rtse mor mnan pa'i bdud rtsi dang / ham gi rim pas mi 'chi ba bza' bar bya'o //
translated: The nectar, pressed with the tip of the tongue, is eaten in the order of the haṃ, the food of immortality.

analyzed: de nas rdo rje phyir bzlog ma'i cho ga'i rim pas bsrung bar 'gyur ba bshad de //

analyzed: bdag nyid khyab bdag phyir bzlog ma rdo rje dkar mo la sngon po dang dmar po dang ser po ni g-yas pa'i zhal rnams so //
translated: One should visualize oneself as Vajra-turning-back-of-evil, white, with a blue, red, and yellow right face,

analyzed: g-yon pa rnams ni ljang gu dang dmar po dang dud ka'o //
translated: and green, red, and smoke-colored left faces.

original: steng gi zhal ni dkar po chen po'o //
analyzed: steng gi zhal ni dkar po chen po'o //

original: zla ba la bzhugs shing sna tshogs pa'i rgyan gyis brgyan pa //
analyzed: zla ba la bzhugs shing sna tshogs pa'i rgyan gyis brgyan pa //
translated: Standing on a moon, adorned with various ornaments,

original: na bza' dkar pos mdzes par byas pa'o //
analyzed: na bza' dkar pos mdzes par byas pa'o //
translated: beautified with a white garment,

original: g-yas brkyang ba'i zhabs kyi sbyor bas 'chi bdag gi bdud mnan ba //
analyzed: g-yas brkyang ba'i zhabs kyi sbyor bas 'chi bdag gi bdud mnan ba //
translated: with the posture of the right leg extended, trampling on the demon of death.

original: sangs rgyas lnga'i dbu rgyan chen po ca //
analyzed: sangs rgyas lnga'i dbu rgyan chen po ca //
translated: He has a great crown with the five Buddhas.

analyzed: 'chi ba yang dag par 'tsho ba'i mchog spyan gsum pa bzhi pa thugs rje chen po'i ros dga' ba'o //
translated: He has three eyes, and is delighted by the taste of great compassion.

analyzed: phyag na sdigs @143b mdzub dang bcas pa'i rdo rje kha gyes gsor ba dang / gzhan na dril bu dang zhag pa 'dzin pa'o //
translated: In one hand he holds a vajra with a threatening forefinger, and in another a bell and a skull-cup.

translated: In another he holds a sword, an axe, a mace, a noose, a skull-cup, a gesture of protection, a goad, a bow and arrow always drawn, a khatvanga staff, a skull-cup,

analyzed: bdud rtsi'i thod pa dang / padma dang dung dang / dbang bskur ba'i phyag rgya ste phyag bcu drug pa'o //
